** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1063078966|POLICY 1063078966}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the line {{tq|The scope of this guideline covers all groups of people organized together for a purpose with the exception of non-profit educational institutions, religions or sects, and sports teams.}} be altered to state:
*'''A''': That esports are within the scope of this notability guideline
*'''B''': That esports are not within the scope of this notability guideline
*'''C''': No change

This RfC is proposed in the context of the no consensus [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Stalwart Esports (2nd nomination)|Stalwart Esports AfD]] where the closer opined that there was a "real need" for guidance on which guideline or policy was controlling.
02:32, 2 December 2021 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In September, a {{template|POV}} tag was added atop the article. Is it still the case that the tag should be in the lead of the article?

*'''Option A''' No, the {{template|POV}} tag is not necessary atop the article, nor in any section.
*'''Option B''' The tag should be moved to particular sections where neutrality is contested, using {{template|POV section}}.
*'''Option C''' Yes, the {{template|POV}} tag should be placed atop top of the article.

‚Äî [[User:Mhawk10|Mhawk10]] ([[User talk:Mhawk10 |talk]]) 06:19, 2 December 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Abraham#rfc_310C42C|Talk:Abraham]] expired 2022-01-03 03:01 ===
* Id: 310C42C
* User: St.nerol
* Date: 2021-12-04 02:39:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1058528156|RELI 1058528156}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1063441804|RELI 1063441804}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The infobox type has {{Diff2|1053292414|recently}} been changed to "Infobox character", with [[User:tgeorgescu|Tgeorgescu]] reasoning that this is the right infobox to use for fictional characters, such as biblical patriarchs. The effect of the change is that some fields are hidden from view, a change in layout and that a banner saying "In-universe information" appears. The undersigned argues that the infobox should be chosen pragmatically, that the hidden fields are relevant and that the "in-universe information"-banner is slightly jarring outside the context of modern fiction.

A similar change has recently been made for other biblical characters: {{Diff2|1057903602|here}}, {{Diff2|1053292117|here}}, {{Diff2|1053292022|here}}, {{Diff2|1053292893|here}}, {{Diff2|1053292662|here}} and {{Diff2|1058237890|here}}. [[User:St.nerol|St.nerol]] ([[User talk:St.nerol|talk]]) 02:39, 4 December 2021 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the [[WP:LEDE|lede sentence]] of [[George Kambosos Jr.]] be refer to him as a "Greek-Australian professional boxer" (as opposed to an "Australian professional boxer")?
[[User:Robert McClenon|Robert McClenon]] ([[User talk:Robert McClenon|talk]]) 02:01, 17 December 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of presidents of the United States#rfc_813260B|Talk:List of presidents of the United States]] expired 2022-01-08 20:01 ===
* Id: 813260B
* User: Tol
* Date: 2021-12-09 19:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1059494652|HIST 1059494652}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1059494663|POL 1059494663}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1064518229|HIST 1064518229}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1064518237|POL 1064518237}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This request for comment covers three distinct unresolved questions relating to [[List of presidents of the United States]] and [[List of vice presidents of the United States]]:

# Should the lists be sortable? ([[#1: Sortability|section]])
# Should the lists' headers contain [[wikipedia:Manual of Style/Accessibility/Data tables tutorial#Overview of basics|scope]] metadata? ([[#2: Scope metadata|section]])
# How should the columns be ordered? ([[#3: Column order|section]])

A brief summary of related edits to the list of presidents from 21 October to 17 November, which led to discussion and this RfC, can be found [[Special:PermaLink/1055809556#c-Tol-2021-11-17T23:04:00.000Z-Thewolfchild-2021-11-17T22:22:00.000Z|here]].

Some recent discussions on these issues are:
* [[Talk:List of presidents of the United States#Sortability|¬ß Sortability]] (mainly question 1, but also some of question 2)
* [[Talk:List of presidents of the United States#Recent edits & reversions|¬ß Recent edits & reversions]] (question 2, and some other issues)
* [[Talk:List of presidents of the United States#Column ordering|¬ß Column ordering]] (question 3, and some question 2)

[[User:Tol|<span style="color:#f542d7">Tol</span>]] ([[User talk:Tol|talk]] &#124; [[Special:Contribs/Tol|contribs]]) @ 19:52, 9 December 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Spartan army#rfc_C807454|Talk:Spartan army]] expired 2022-01-10 02:01 ===
* Id: C807454
* User: Jonas1015119
* Date: 2021-12-11 01:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1059704158|HIST 1059704158}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1064756400|HIST 1064756400}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The newer source in the article seems to refute the older one regarding the existence of shields with the Lambda symbol on them (Relevant excerpts from both https://imgur.com/a/kjDy64C). 
Both seem to be more PopHist rather than academic, so I believe there is reason to collect an overview of recent scholarship and establish a consensus on whether the use of the symbol should be included in the article.

The reason why this is an RfC relates to the widespread use of the symbol on a shield across Wikipedia. The "Spartan Constitution" Template as well as the [[Sparta]] main article use a [https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Sparta_shield.svg drawing] of the supposed shield as illustrations, which seems to be inspired by the old movie [[The 300 Spartans]]. All of which should probably be replaced if there is no real evidence for the historicity of the design (maybe by a spartan helmet?). In recent years the particular shield design popularized by the 2007 version of ''[[300 (film)|300]]'' also became the logo of the [[Identitarian movement]], which received media attention at the time,<ref>{{cite web |title=The Sparta Fetish Is a Cultural Cancer |url=https://newrepublic.com/article/154563/sparta-myth-rise-fascism-trumpism}}</ref> where it is treated more like a popular misconception, while on Wikipedia it is essentially stated as fact.
[[User:Jonas1015119|jonas]] ([[User talk:Jonas1015119|talk]]) 01:26, 11 December 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_4A4121F|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2022-01-10 03:01 ===
* Id: 4A4121F
* User: The Alternate Mako
* Date: 2022-01-03 05:02:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1063462587|PROP 1063462587}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1064765151|PROP 1064765151}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
User generated news site, seems to be quite new, and has so far [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?search=insource%3A%22twnews.co.uk%22&title=Special:Search&profile=advanced&fulltext=1&ns0=1&ns1=1&ns2=1&ns3=1&ns14=1&ns15=1&ns118=1&ns119=1 only been used a handful of times]. Mostly local news in the UK at the moment like complaints about roadworks, dogs up for adoption and such. However there are obvious issues that anyone can just "create" a reliable source there. The [[Adrian C√¢ciu]] (a Romanian politician) article is one BLP article that uses it as a source. This might be a bit of a premature rfc, and one with a forgone conclusion but I think that it's better to deal with it explicitly now than wait until it becomes a problem later.

Is it:
#¬†Generally¬†reliable¬†for factual reporting
#¬†Unclear or additional considerations apply
#¬†Generally¬†unreliable¬†for factual reporting (and therefore ruled out for BLP articles)
#¬†Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be¬†deprecated

I hope I've done this correctly, <nowiki>{{ping}}</nowiki> me if I've messed up. üôÇ  [[User:The Alternate Mako|Mako001]][[Special:Contributions/The Alternate Mako|&nbsp;(C)&nbsp;]][[User talk:The Alternate Mako|&nbsp;(T)&nbsp;]]<sub><sup>(The&nbsp;Alternate&nbsp;Mako)</sup></sub> 05:02, 3 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Jeffrey Epstein#rfc_43B6AE8|Talk:Jeffrey Epstein]] expired 2022-01-11 10:01 ===
* Id: 43B6AE8
* User: Gaioa
* Date: 2022-01-05 11:54:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1063885020|POL 1063885020}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1065011805|POL 1065011805}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Epstein's death and theories thereof are already widely discussed in bodies of articles, but how should it be typed in the infobox? This has been edited back and forth for quite a while, and I think it'd be good with some consensus on the topic to keep disagreeable edits out.
*'''Option A:''' <code>[[Suicide by hanging]]</code> without qualifiers or adjectives
*'''Option B:''' <code>Ruled [[suicide by hanging]]</code>
*'''Option C:''' <code>[[Suicide by hanging]] (disputed)</code>
*something else
This would apply <u>both</u> to the articles [[Jeffrey Epstein]] and [[Death of Jeffrey Epstein]]. And once again to clarify, this is only for the infobox text. [[User:Gaioa|<span style="color:#0000ff;">Gaioa</span>]] ([[User talk:Gaioa|T]] [[Special:Contributions/Gaioa|C]] [[Special:Log/Gaioa|L]]) 11:54, 5 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_03F8629|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2022-01-11 16:01 ===
* Id: 03F8629
* User: rsjaffe
* Date: 2022-01-10 21:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1064953954|PROP 1064953954}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1065058324|PROP 1065058324}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
EP Today (eptoday.com) is identified as a fake news site both in a Wikipedia article ([[Fake_news_in_India#Fake_news_against_Pakistan]]) and in a report (https://www.disinfo.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/20191213_InfluencingPolicymakers-with-Fake-media-outlets.pdf) by the EU Disinformation Task Force. This was discussed briefly in an earlier [[Reliable Sources diWikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 281#Indian fake media outletsscussion|Reliable Sources discussion]] without any resolution.

:I propose that eptoday be blacklisted.

Currently, EPToday is referenced in 10 articles (one being the Fake News in India wiki article). Some of the references appear to have legitimate sources, but the topics are outside my expertise, so I don't think I'm the right person to fix these references. Using the search term "insource:eptoday.com" the articles are

# [[Religion in Pakistan]]<blockquote>The focus of Islamic principles creates a system of institutionalised discrimination that filters down into society. Moreover, the Constitution sets up the [[Council of Islamic Ideology]], tasked with ensuring Islamic ideology is followed in governmental decisions, actions and policy making.</blockquote>
# [[Syed Ali Shah Geelani]]<blockquote>After record voting percentage in Kashmir, Geelani, along with other separatists, were criticised by Indian media for misleading people of Kashmir and for not representing true sentiments of Kashmiri people.</blockquote>
# [[Fake news in India]]
# [[All Parties Hurriyat Conference]]
# [[Rod Rosenstein]]
# [[Religious discrimination in Pakistan]]
# [[Mark Hendrick]]
# [[Religious Minorities in Pakistan]]
# [[Edward McMillan-Scott]]
# [[Forced conversion of minority girls in Pakistan]]  
<span style="border-radius:9em;padding:0 5px;background:#3366cc">[[User:rsjaffe|<b style="color:white">rsjaffe</b>]]&nbsp;[[User talk:rsjaffe|<b style="color:white">üó©</b>]]&nbsp;[[Special:Contribs/rsjaffe|<b style="color:white">üñâ</b>]]</span> 21:09, 10 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Radical Party (France)#rfc_5E0CDFC|Talk:Radical Party (France)]] expired 2022-01-14 15:01 ===
* Id: 5E0CDFC
* User: Helper201
* Date: 2021-12-15 14:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1060442624|POL 1060442624}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1065632820|POL 1065632820}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Proposal to remove the historical ideologies, political positions and national affiliations from the infobox as it makes it far too cluttered and difficult for people to easily read and navigate. This information and the corresponding citations should definitely still be included on the page, just incorporated into the main text with the corresponding citations rather than being placed in the infobox. The infobox can then be kept to what can be cited as the party's current ideologies, current political position and current national affiliation. I'd be more confident if the historical information could be incorporated into the main body by another editor who can read French and/or has more knowledge of the party than myself though. [[User:Helper201|Helper201]] ([[User talk:Helper201|talk]]) 14:10, 15 December 2021 (UTC)}}

* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1065518641|PROP 1065518641}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1065681222|PROP 1065681222}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Currently, there is a dispute on article [[Battle of Peshawar (1758)]] where the user keeps adding unreliable sources. So I would like to have a Yes or No vote from all editors whether the source is reliable or not according to your opinion. These sources are:
'''Book: Chhatrapati Shivaji The Maratha Warrior and His Campaign By Jeneet Sorokhaibam ¬∑ 2013'''<br>and<br>'''Book: Third Battle of Panipat by Abhas Verma ISBN 9788180903397 Bharatiya Kala Prakashan'''

Article [https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Potentially_unreliable_sources/Books_that_plagiarize_Wikipedia], under section "Others" shows that author Jeneet Sorokhaibam is not reliable. This is what it says:

''Chhatrapati Shivaji: The Maratha Warrior and His Campaign by Jeneet Sorokhaibam (Vij Books, 2013)For example, see page 139: "Afzal Khan felt that the ensuing battle..." Copied from the 2012 version of the Wikipedia article on Afzal Khan (general).''

Also author Abhas Verma is not reliable as he has no professional expertise in the historical academic area and is actually an IT professional working for a company in Bangalore, India. He stated that he is writer by choice. Also the writer is a regular user on quora as well and a blogger. Here is his profile, [https://trunicle.com/author/abhas/]. Also this user's/author's account was banned on quora [https://www.quora.com/profile/Abhas-Verma] but rejoined with a new account [https://www.quora.com/profile/Abhas-Verma-9?q=abhas%20verma]. 

Please provide your opinion(s) with Yes or No on the reliability, so that the dispute about the above references can be resolved? [[User:MehmoodS|MehmoodS]] ([[User talk:MehmoodS|talk]]) 23:32, 13 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_407F671|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2022-01-16 16:01 ===
* Id: 407F671
* User: Kyohyi
* Date: 2022-01-12 15:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1065252364|POLICY 1065252364}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1071245829|POLICY 1071245829}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is a current discrepancy between how WP: V covers self published sources for BLP's and how WP: BLP covers self published sources for BLP's.

The current text on [[WP:V]] (at [[WP:SPS]]) is {{tqq|'''Never''' use self-published sources as [[WP:IS|third-party sources]] about living people, even if the author is an expert, well-known professional researcher, or writer.}}

The current text on [[WP:BLP]] (at [[WP:BLPSPS]]) is {{tqq|Never use [[Wikipedia:Identifying and using self-published works|self-published sources]]‚Äîincluding but not limited to books, [[zine]]s, websites, blogs, and tweets‚Äîas sources of material about a living person, unless written or published '''by the subject of the article'''.}}

The key difference being WP: V says "as third-party sources" and WP: BLP saying "as sources of material".

The question is should we change the text of one to match the other, and if so which one.

'''Option A''' No change to either policy text

'''Option B''' Change WP: BLP to match WP: V

'''Option C''' Change WP: V to match WP: BLP

'''Option D''' Some other change

--[[User:Kyohyi|Kyohyi]] ([[User talk:Kyohyi|talk]]) 15:05, 12 January 2022 (UTC)}}

Which version of the first pillar of [[WP:5P1]] is better?

*'''Option B''' would be to retain the new wording "Wikipedia combines many features of general and specialized encyclopedias and other reference works." === [[Talk:Poaceae#rfc_4955EC4|Talk:Poaceae]] expired 2022-01-18 09:01 ===
* Id: 4955EC4
* User: Ortizesp
* Date: 2022-01-17 22:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1066341971|SCI 1066341971}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1066424173|SCI 1066424173}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I think that the page [[Poaceae]] and [[Grass]] should be separated. This was merged by [[User:Plantsurfer]] in a small vote of 4 to 1 on 26 February 2016. The reasons are below:
# 5 votes is not enough for such a fundamental page. The voting process should have been much larger, and opened up to the greater public for more comments and arguments.
# I think the concept "grass" is much more ubiquitous that Poaceae, and has many more uses beyond just the scientific. Poaceae should refer to just the scientific classification, and grass to the non-scientific group. They have some overlap, but are also very distinct.
# I started the move request above, and the reality is that Poaceae and grasses are not synonymous or exactly equivalent. Grasses tends to refer to certain strains, some of which "(rushes, sedges)" are not in Poaceae at all, so you can say that grass is a non-diffusing category.
At worst, there should be a DAB page at the base name, although I contend grass should probably have a page for itself. I don't think it makes sense for the more popular and universally used concept of grass to have been the merged into the more specific poaceae.--[[User:Ortizesp|Ortizesp]] ([[User talk:Ortizesp|talk]]) 22:05, 17 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Non-fungible token#rfc_29FE1AA|Talk:Non-fungible token]] expired 2022-01-18 21:01 ===
* Id: 29FE1AA
* User: A._C._Santacruz
* Date: 2022-01-18 11:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1066448378|ECON 1066448378}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1066448381|SCI 1066448381}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1066448383|MEDIA 1066448383}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1066448389|SOC 1066448389}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1066536255|ECON 1066536255}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1066536262|SCI 1066536262}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1066536272|MEDIA 1066536272}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1066536275|SOC 1066536275}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Is the style of the current "Uses" section detrimental to covering the topic in an encyclopedic manner?

'''Survey'''

*'''Yes, as starter''' ‚Äî I believe that the current uses section reads like a list of news items/headlines rather than a comprehensive analysis of how NFTs are used. Additionally, as all criticism is left for the "Issues and criticisms" section at the bottom of the article rather than throughout the article, it means that readers that come across the section are not given a concise understanding of how NFTs are used.{{pb}}Additionally, having separate subsections for things like games and media does not make much sense to me as, from my understanding, there is not much difference in what the NFTs of these mediums are (a certificate of authenticity/ownership and not the work itself). [[User:A._C._Santacruz|A. C. Santacruz]] &#8258; [[User talk:A._C._Santacruz|Please ping me!]] 11:07, 18 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Oxford High School shooting#rfc_5DE1B4F|Talk:Oxford High School shooting]] expired 2022-01-19 02:01 ===
* Id: 5DE1B4F
* User: Love of Corey
* Date: 2021-12-20 01:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1061167702|POL 1061167702}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1061167709|SOC 1061167709}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1066576541|POL 1066576541}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1066576545|SOC 1066576545}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the "Copycat threats and arrests" section include paragraphs on specific cases and trials regarding copycat threats, as depicted [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Oxford_High_School_shooting&diff=next&oldid=1061031082 here]? === [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject American football#rfc_18003EE|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject American football]] expired 2022-01-19 05:01 ===
* Id: 18003EE
* User: GoodDay
* Date: 2022-01-08 15:04:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1064481127|SOC 1064481127}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1066601249|SOC 1066601249}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hello. As you may (or may not) know, we've got season articles & championship game articles in full-name form for the AFL & abbreviated form for the NFL. Examples: <br>
*[[1965 American Football League season]] & [[1965 American Football League Championship Game]]
*[[1965 NFL season]] & [[1965 NFL Championship Game]]
Now I've heard the argument that we shouldn't change to AFL, because of the [[Australian Football League]]. But don't we also have the [[National Football League (Ireland)]], called the NFL? So here's my suggestion. <br>
:Let's page move the aforementioned '''Year American Football League season''' & '''Year Championship Game''' titles to '''Year AFL season''' & '''Year AFL Championship Game''', to match up with their NFL counter-parts. [[User:GoodDay|GoodDay]] ([[User talk:GoodDay|talk]]) 15:04, 8 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Notability (sports)#rfc_127C950|Wikipedia talk:Notability (sports)]] expired 2022-01-21 18:01 ===
* Id: 127C950
* User: RandomCanadian
* Date: 2022-01-20 14:11:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1066871201|POLICY 1066871201}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1067093877|POLICY 1067093877}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Proposal: replace the following sentence of [[WP:NSPORTSEVENT]]
:{{talk quote|Some games or series are '''inherently''' notable, [...]}}
with the following
:{{talk quote|Some games or series are '''likely or almost certain to be considered''' notable, [no change to rest]}}

Rationale: simple enough, [[WP:NINHERENT|nothing is "inherently" notable]] and fixing this little poor choice of vocabulary (which gives a misleading impression) should never have required yet another RfC. [[User:RandomCanadian|RandomCanadian]] ([[User talk:RandomCanadian|talk]] / [[Special:Contributions/RandomCanadian|contribs]])  14:11, 20 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Category talk:Expatriates#rfc_B633145|Category talk:Expatriates]] expired 2022-01-21 19:01 ===
* Id: B633145
* User: Herostratus
* Date: 2021-12-22 18:25:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1061607812|BIO 1061607812}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1061607822|STYLE 1061607822}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1067102753|BIO 1067102753}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1067102758|STYLE 1067102758}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Currently, this page says at the top "For more information, see '''[[Expatriate]]'''". The strong implication is "if you are unsure whether or not to place a give biography in (some sub-category) of [[:Category:Expatriates]], see the article [[Expatriate]] for definitions and guidance", n'est-ce pas? The question on the table is whether this should be changed.

*'''A:''' No. 
*'''B:''' Yes, and "see '''[[Expatriate]]'''" should be replaced/supplemented, at the top of this page and/or other places as appropriate (eg, on subcategory pages or whatever), and the guidance should read:
**'''B1''' Something along the lines of "'Expatriate', ''for the purposes of categorization'' is usually taken to mean: 1) A person who (more or less) permanently relocated to a different country(s) than her native country, 2) A person who moved from her native country and is no longer a citizen of that country, 3) A person who moved from her native country and has explicitly (even if not legally) renounced her citizenship or attachment to that country, or 4) a person who lived ten years [or whatever] in a country(s) other than thier native country, or 5) a person with generally similar experience. Exceptions may apply as appropriate."
**'''B2:''' Other (explain).
*'''C:''' Other (explain).
[[User:Herostratus|Herostratus]] ([[User talk:Herostratus|talk]]) 18:25, 22 December 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Nezak Huns#rfc_29D2942|Talk:Nezak Huns]] expired 2022-01-24 12:01 ===
* Id: 29D2942
* User: TrangaBellam
* Date: 2022-01-24 10:37:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1067623581|HIST 1067623581}}
* RFC Text:

At the [[Nezak_Huns#Decline:_Rashidun_and_Umayyad_invasions|start of the Decline section]], we have:{{talkquote|In 653 CE, a Tang diplomatic mission recorded that the crown-prince of Jibin had become the new king; this prince is assumed to be Ghar-ilchi. He was again confirmed as Governor of Jibin under the newly formed Chinese Anxi Protectorate (the "Protectorate of the Western Regions"), in 661 CE.}}
At the section on [[Nezak_Huns#Literature|sources in literature]], do we (again) need:{{talkquote|The same ruler Hexiezi (Ghar-ilchi) had been formally installed as king of Jibin (ÁΩΩÂÆæÂõΩ, former Kapisi/ Kabulistan) by the Chinese Tang Dynasty emperor in 653 CE, and was again confirmed as Governor of Jibin under the newly formed Chinese Anxi Protectorate, the "Protectorate of the Western Regions", in 661 CE.}}
'''Or''', will:{{talkquote|Other Chinese sources comment on unnamed rulers of Kapisi (also Jibin; erstwhile Cao) from the sixth to the mid-seventh century; historians assume them to be referring to the Nezak Huns.}}
suffice <u>in itself</u> as a pointer?

'''Option 1''' - Preserve the redundancy for XYZ reasons; no need for the ''or'' option.

'''Option 2''' - Do away with the redundancy for XYZ reasons; the ''or'' option is sufficient.

'''Option 3''' - Preserve the redundancy as well as the ''or'' option (that is, maintain status quo) for XYZ reasons.

'''Option 4''' - Some other resolution for XYZ reasons.

Please provide your valuable opinions. Thanks, [[User:TrangaBellam|TrangaBellam]] ([[User talk:TrangaBellam|talk]]) 10:37, 24 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:God#rfc_9316C6F|Talk:God]] expired 2022-01-25 20:01 ===
* Id: 9316C6F
* User: Djhbrown
* Date: 2022-01-25 00:57:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1067757287|HIST 1067757287}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1067757292|SCI 1067757292}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1067757296|POL 1067757296}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1067757298|RELI 1067757298}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1067757301|SOC 1067757301}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1067912835|HIST 1067912835}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1067912840|SCI 1067912840}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1067912843|POL 1067912843}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1067912846|RELI 1067912846}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1067912848|SOC 1067912848}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This request for comment pertains to the deletion, on spurious or quibbling grounds, by two other users, of a contribution to the page entitled "God" by the undersigned.

https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=God&type=revision&diff=1067723405&oldid=1067722697

There is possibly no more contentious and politically fraught subject in the history of the sociology of humanity than the notion of "God". For milennia, the concept of God has been the cause-celebre of wars, genocides, and every imaginable abuse of human rights, so Wikipedia bears a heavy responsibility to ensure it does not allow itself to be abused by propagandists censoring scientific archaeological and historical political objectivity.

That heavy responsibility must not be taken lightly and allow technical argument to blockade an objective and verifiable scientific fact: the fact that human cultures around the world had notions of the concept of God (even of a single omnipotent God) long before the Christian Bible was written.

My [deleted] contribution identifies that fact as a linear thread that runs throughout prehistory and history, citing sources which cite other sources, providing objectively verifiable evidence for the existence of that thread, which (somewhat astonishingly) is so simple and clear that it can be written on a single A4 page! 
https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Hog.png
[[User:Djhbrown|Djhbrown]] ([[User talk:Djhbrown|talk]]) 00:57, 25 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Catholicism#rfc_6D8181F|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Catholicism]] expired 2022-01-26 00:01 ===
* Id: 6D8181F
* Date: 2022-01-25 01:44:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1067854308|RELI 1067854308}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1067949004|RELI 1067949004}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The long standing article titled "[[Catholic (term)]]" was [[WP:Bold]]ly moved to "[[History of Catholicity]]". I have concerns, as the article is largely about development and usage of the word "catholic" rather than history of catholic beliefs (ie catholicity). The page has has already been moved several times ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=History_of_Catholicity&diff=1067683773&oldid=1065547781 here] and [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=History_of_Catholicity&diff=1067684380&oldid=1067684161 here]), so before things get muddy, I'd like a clear consensus to be developed. ‚Äì[[User:Zfish118|Zfish118]]<sup>‚ãâ[[User_talk:Zfish118|talk]]</sup> 01:44, 25 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Text formatting#rfc_1FBD1D2|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Text formatting]] expired 2022-01-26 09:01 ===
* Id: 1FBD1D2
* User: Mitch Ames
* Date: 2021-12-27 08:58:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1062253872|SOC 1062253872}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1062253874|STYLE 1062253874}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1068032102|SOC 1068032102}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1068032105|STYLE 1068032105}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the words "bold" and "italics" be formatted in bold/italics in article text that describes the usage of that formatting in a table. E.g. (from [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Will_Davison&oldid=1061745079#Complete_A1_Grand_Prix_results]) which is correct?
# (Races in '''bold''' indicate pole position) (Races in ''italics'' indicate fastest lap)
# (Races in bold indicate pole position) (Races in italics indicate fastest lap)

Note that this RFC question is about the formatting of the words "bold" and "italics" themselves in the legend, not the use of bold or italics in the table to denote (for example) pole position, fastest lap.

For previous discussions, see {{section link|User talk:Mitch Ames|Removal of "unnecessary self-referential text formatting"}} and {{section link|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Text formatting|Use of bold and italics in the legend for a table}}.
[[User:Mitch Ames|Mitch Ames]] ([[User talk:Mitch Ames|talk]]) 08:58, 27 December 2021 (UTC)}}

'''Option 2, Change wording:''' Various academics have suggested that legislation passed following the EU membership referendum, including the United Kingdom Internal Market Act 2020, has undermined and restricted the authority of the devolved legislatures in both Scotland and Wales.

'''Option 3, Remove sentence'''

=== [[Talk:Kurds#rfc_607E5D7|Talk:Kurds]] expired 2022-01-27 18:01 ===
* Id: 607E5D7
* User: SkyEditor85
* Date: 2021-12-28 17:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1062476403|POLICY 1062476403}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1068302781|POLICY 1068302781}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
An ethnic flag has been added to the article, but the flag actually belongs to the Iraqi Kurdistan, an autonomous region inside Iraq. The flag doesn't belong to all Kurds, neither it's universally agreed as a common flag by Kurds. There are no single source proving the flag is an ethnic flag of the Kurds. Thus I believe it should be deleted. Requesting neutral opinion or instructions how to continue from this point. [[User:SkyEditor85|SkyEditor85]] ([[User talk:SkyEditor85|talk]]) 17:40, 28 December 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Manchester#rfc_F579981|Talk:Manchester]] expired 2022-01-31 12:01 ===
* Id: F579981
* User: Metrolink123
* Date: 2022-01-01 11:04:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1063128298|HIST 1063128298}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1069050575|HIST 1069050575}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I think it would be valuable re-evaluate the need to dismiss one aspect of population data included on the lead paragraph for several reasons :
# The data is too old, when newer data is available
# Other UK cities lead paragraphs use population data that takes into account the conurbation and not just the immediate city centre population  
# There is more than 6 different population stats to choose from when measuring the size of the city, so why choose this particular data set without a thorough discussion of the other available data given by the ONS?
# Consensus was not achieved in previous edit disputes and unilateral action was taken. 
# There is evidence from the Birmingham article talk page that there is a minor edit war between Manchester and Birmingham articles and thus some editors maybe pandering to a covert bias by choosing certain population data over others for advantatious reasons. 
[[User:Metrolink123|Metrolink123]] ([[User talk:Metrolink123|talk]]) 11:04, 1 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of Shakespeare authorship candidates#rfc_2F073B9|Talk:List of Shakespeare authorship candidates]] expired 2022-01-31 18:01 ===
* Id: 2F073B9
* User: Faktorovich
* Date: 2022-01-29 18:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1068674782|LANG 1068674782}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1069112621|POLICY 1069112621}}
* RFC Text:

 Should Author-Publishers be distinguished from self-publishers; should we avoid dismissing scholarly texts with new ideas without first reading them; and should the definition of "expert" be specified with measurable parameters; and should self-citation be distinguished from citation-correction of a citation made by somebody else of one's own research? [[User:Faktorovich|Faktorovich]] ([[User talk:Faktorovich|talk]]) 18:52, 29 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Nicki Minaj#rfc_5BA4609|Talk:Nicki Minaj]] expired 2022-01-31 20:01 ===
* Id: 5BA4609
* User: Cornerstonepicker
* Date: 2022-01-30 00:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1068736016|BIO 1068736016}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1068736025|MEDIA 1068736025}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1069137437|BIO 1069137437}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1069137443|MEDIA 1069137443}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I have two proposed changes for the article:
*In the lead section, it is claimed that "{{tq|She is known for her versatility as an artist, her animated flow and lyricism in her rapping and her usage of alter egos and accents.}}" However, not a single reliable source claims that lyricism is what she '''is known for''', the word should be removed to avoid pov pushing. while every artist is known for their song lyrics, there's not a difference to make here.
*The July mid-year critics lists on the body: the article features the following lists: {{tq|"[the song] appeared on the mid-year "Best Hip Hop Songs of 2021 (So Far) critics list by HipHopDX.[228][229] Minaj's verse on "Fractions" from Beam Me Up Scotty appeared on the mid-year "Best Rap Verses of 2021 So Far" critics list from Complex.[230]}}. These lists published in July do not hold weight compared to the actual year-end lists, posting them is just fillers. while there isn't an specific policy to remove mid-year lists, it is just an indiscriminate collection of information. [[User:Cornerstonepicker|Cornerstonepicker]] ([[User talk:Cornerstonepicker|talk]]) 00:18, 30 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Biblical canon#rfc_93BFA78|Talk:Biblical canon]] expired 2022-02-01 08:01 ===

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_B1B3A42|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2022-02-01 09:01 ===
* Id: B1B3A42
* User: Hunan201p
* Date: 2022-01-29 01:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1068550027|SCI 1068550027}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1069242740|SCI 1069242740}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There has been much discussion about pre-print repositories, such as [[bioRxiv]], here at RSN. Several times, people have come here asking if they are reliable sources, and in each instance, most people seem to agree that they are not: 

[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_304#bioRxiv_%28discussion_on_RS_for_haplogroups%29 Example 1] [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard#Is_a_preprint_quoted_in_an_article_by_someone_not_a_DNA_specialist_ok_as_a_source_for_DNA? 2]

Despite the widespread acknowledgement among elite editors that we should rely on peer-reviewed secondary sources, [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?search=Biorxiv&title=Special:Search&profile=advanced&fulltext=1&ns0=1 citations of bioRxiv content remain hugely popular,] particularly at articles relating to human ethnicity or human genetic origins. Most of these articles are patrolled by smart people, who simply aren't noticing the problem. 

By no means is it my intention to single out bioRxiv. I have nothing against them or their mission, and there are definitely other pre-print repositories just like them which are also cited on Wikipedia. Websites like preprints.org, thesiscommons, peerj.com, and the osf.io repository should be considered here as well. 

The only point I am trying to make is that these types of sources evidently fail WP:RS, yet are widespread on Wikipedia. It looks to me like deprecation is a viable solution, so I'd like to hear all of your thoughts. [[User:Hunan201p|Hunan201p]] ([[User talk:Hunan201p|talk]]) 01:52, 29 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_D1FBF5B|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2022-02-01 09:01 ===
* Id: D1FBF5B
* User: Tayi Arajakate
* Date: 2022-01-15 02:44:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1065746250|PROP 1065746250}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1069242748|PROP 1069242748}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Srivastava Group is a holding company registered in India which was found to be operating a disinformation network with at least 265 identified fake news websites. The websites either use bought out domains of defunct news publishers, domains pretending to be associated with newspapers that don't exist (e.g timesofgeneva.com) or misleading domains which are pretending to be websites of mainstream newspapers (e.g timesoflosangeles.com). To provide more credibility to their websites and to inflate their content, they also plagiarise from other news publishers in violation of copyright. Read these articles for additional context; [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-50749764 BBC 1] [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-55232432 BBC 2] [https://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/india-fake-news-sites-canada-1.5366591 CBC] [https://www.thequint.com/news/politics/265-fake-media-outlets-run-by-indian-group-linked-to-modi-mep-meet-report Quint 1] [https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/ani-srivastava-group-used-disinformation-to-aid-government-study Quint 2] (Primary sources: [https://www.disinfo.eu/publications/indian-chronicles-deep-dive-into-a-15-year-operation-targeting-the-eu-and-un-to-serve-indian-interests/ EU Disinfo Lab], [https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/viewer?ll=2.171532852531854,0&z=2&mid=1-_KpPuAyLGUhz_R84V12Hu5C_i2oJPSs Interactive Map])

The main websites of the network are {{duses|newdelhitimes.com}}, {{duses|eptoday.com}}, {{duses|timesofgeneva.com}} 

I propose the following:
* Blacklisting of the above mentioned websites
* Blacklisting of other identified websites by referring them at [[WT:BLIST]] on an ad hoc basis (this will prevent the need for repeated RSN discussions for each individual website)
<span style="background-color:#B2BEB5;padding:2px 12px 2px 12px;font-size:10px">[[User:Tayi Arajakate|<span style="color:#660000">'''Tayi Arajakate'''</span>]] <sub>[[User talk:Tayi Arajakate|<span style="color:#660000">'''Talk'''</span>]]</sub></span> 02:44, 15 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Turkey#rfc_0642A44|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Turkey]] expired 2022-02-01 19:01 ===
* Id: 0642A44
* Date: 2022-01-02 18:22:00

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_3D8F739|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2022-02-02 21:01 ===
* Id: 3D8F739
* User: David Gerard
* Date: 2022-01-11 18:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1065084360|PROP 1065084360}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1069544870|PROP 1069544870}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The Counterpunch deprecation RFC appeared to have multiple contributors who were fresh editors/accounts. [[WP:RFC]]s have conventionally allowed all contributors, including IPs. Is this appropriate to deprecation RFCs?

*'''Option 1:''' Keep open to all contributors, as per [[Wikipedia:Requests for comment#Responding to an RfC|WP:RFC]].
*'''Option 2:''' Require autoconfirmed status from contributors.
*'''Option 3:''' Similar requirements to extended confirmed protection: 30 days, 500 edits.
*'''Option 4:''' something else.

- [[User:David Gerard|David Gerard]] ([[User talk:David Gerard|talk]]) 18:40, 11 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_E6FBD08|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2022-02-05 12:01 ===
* Id: E6FBD08
* User: Kaleeb18
* Date: 2022-02-04 16:17:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|1069989024|UNSORTED 1069989024}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|1070052315|UNSORTED 1070052315}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
What is the reliability of [https://www.behindthevoiceactors.com/ ''Behind the Voice Actors''] (BTVA)? They are not user-generated content and they try to distinguish themselves from websites like IMDB and it also looks like they fact-check/verify their information with the primary source with a green tick. Past discussions here look like there is no clear consensus on BTVA. After this RfC, {{strikethrough|I think we should consider putting it on [[WP:RSP]]}}. Here are the past discussions [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 153#Behind the Voice Actors|[1]]], [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 277|[2]]], [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 136#Behind the Voice Actors site for use in Batman: Arkham City|[3]]], and [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 86#Behind the Voice Actors.com RS?|[4]]].

*'''Option 1:''' Generally reliable for the voice or actor of a character/entertainment news
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply
*'''Option 3:''' Generally unreliable for factual news
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information and should be deprecated
‚Äï [[User:Kaleeb18|<b style="background:#000;color:#f07b3a;padding:1q;border-radius:5q;">Kaleeb18</b>]][[User talk:Kaleeb18|<sup>Talk</sup>]]<sub style="position:relative;right:20q;margin-right:-15px;">Caleb</sub> 16:17, 4 February 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Queen Latifah#rfc_B14C5C7|Talk:Queen Latifah]] expired 2022-02-06 14:01 ===
* Id: B14C5C7
* User: Cornerstonepicker
* Date: 2022-01-31 09:47:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1069035274|BIO 1069035274}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1069035289|MEDIA 1069035289}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1070249094|BIO 1070249094}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1070249096|MEDIA 1070249096}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
As the article Nicki Minaj has added the sentence "[She] has been referred to as the 'Queen of Rap'" to its lead section, I was reading some of the reasoning on [[Talk:Justin_Bieber/Archive_7#Request_for_comment|Bieber's 'Prince of Pop' discussion]], and there's a point on these mentioned nicknames not being exclusive, not essential to just one person, and actually being passed around. And newer artists have already started to get the nickname within the press.

Aside from the mentioned, there's two other articles that have the nickname "Queen of Rap" on their lead sections:
*Queen Latifah
*[[Missy Elliott]]
Both widely covered

{{small|(Also [[Lil' Kim]] and [[MC Lyte]] have the same nickname within their articles)}}

Seeking uniformity and integration in Wikipedia, I'm proposing their lead (of the three) go from

*[Name] has been referred to as "the Queen of Rap" by several media outlets
to
*[Name] is among the women that have been cited as the "Queen of Rap" by multiple media outlets. 

Open to suggestions. [[User:Cornerstonepicker|Cornerstonepicker]] ([[User talk:Cornerstonepicker|talk]]) 09:47, 31 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Abortion#rfc_DF4E463|Talk:Abortion]] expired 2022-02-06 17:01 ===
* Id: DF4E463
* User: NightHeron
* Date: 2022-01-07 16:17:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1064297179|SCI 1064297179}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1070277044|SCI 1070277044}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Are the terms ''safe'' and ''safety'' used correcty in this article? [[User:NightHeron|NightHeron]] ([[User talk:NightHeron|talk]]) 16:17, 7 January 2022 (UTC)}}

This article's title has been subject to demands for a change to another name that is more appropriate, often due to complaints of [[wp:synth|synthesis]].

The purpose of this RfC is to address and hopefully resolve the highlighted issue above, or, at the very least, narrow down to only a few choices of names that are appropriate for the article. === [[Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (country-specific topics)#rfc_03899B8|Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (country-specific topics)]] expired 2022-02-08 07:01 ===
* Id: 03899B8
* Date: 2022-01-09 06:41:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1064604540|POL 1064604540}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1064604542|STYLE 1064604542}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1070583747|POL 1070583747}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1070583748|STYLE 1070583748}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which title format should articles discussing bilateral relations use:<br>
'''A'''. Use the adjectival or adjectival compound form of the countries name when they are available and natural (eg, German-Icelandic relations, Franco-German relations)<br>
'''B'''. Use the nounal form of the countries name throughout (eg, Germany-Iceland relations)<br>
'''C'''. Consider each article's [[WP:COMMONNAME|common name]]; do not apply a uniform format<br>

06:41, 9 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Writing#rfc_91FDA70|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Writing]] expired 2022-02-08 18:01 ===
* Id: 91FDA70
* User: Breadyornot
* Date: 2022-02-07 23:13:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1070532811|POLICY 1070532811}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1070678052|POLICY 1070678052}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 

I am requesting a comment on a deleted draft of [[User:Rhhslv|User:Rhhslv's]] [[User:Rhhslv/sandbox|sandbox]] for a new draft article on holistic scoring due to [[Wikipedia:Criteria_for_speedy_deletion#U5|U5: Misuse of Wikipedia as a webhost]]. The article was deleted due to one citation Dr. [[User:Rhhslv|Richard H. Haswell]] used of his own work. 

How does this go against [[WP:SELFPUB]] and [[WP:SELFCITE]]? Specifically, self-citation is allowed on Wikipedia only when "produced by an established subject matter expert, whose work in the relevant field has previously been published by reliable, independent publications" and the article "should not place undue emphasis on your work" (WP:SELFPUB, WP:SELFCITE). Would one citation of his work be considered self-promotion on a topic that he has widely published on by reliable publications and the work itself is critical to a comprehensive understanding of the topic? The article contributed to a more complete understanding of [[Holistic grading]] and contributes to the efforts of [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Writing|WikiProject Writing]]. 

See talk page discussion on [[User_talk:Bbb23/Archive_55#blocking%20of%20an%20uncompleted%20draft%20of%20a%20new%20arictle|User:Bbb23's talk page]] for our prior discussion on the issue. We are requesting comment now to receive greater response and concensus on the issue. 

I welcome comments from other WikiPorject Writing participants on this matter as well. [[User:Breadyornot|Breadyornot]] ([[User talk:Breadyornot|talk]]) 23:13, 7 February 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Vision therapy#rfc_993D4D3|Talk:Vision therapy]] expired 2022-02-11 12:01 ===
* Id: 993D4D3
* User: 2406:5A00:329C:4600:6496:382F:F297:11C5
* Date: 2022-02-06 06:04:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1070199206|SCI 1070199206}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1071211809|SCI 1071211809}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Vision Therapy is an umbrella term for many practices, some of them fraudulent, but many of them - based on my own and several family-members' experiences - ''not'' fraudulent. Going by the rest of the talk page, I am far from the only one who's upset that this whole entire field of medicine is being framed as a pseudoscience - but the fact that most of the existing sources are sneerish handwringing about the efficacy studies which have been done, makes it hard to actually edit the thing. People just revert it for "removing sourced content". I need help.[[Special:Contributions/2406:5A00:329C:4600:6496:382F:F297:11C5|2406:5A00:329C:4600:6496:382F:F297:11C5]] ([[User talk:2406:5A00:329C:4600:6496:382F:F297:11C5|talk]]) 06:04, 6 February 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:House system at the California Institute of Technology#rfc_277D910|Talk:House system at the California Institute of Technology]] expired 2022-02-14 04:01 ===
* Id: 277D910
* User: Antony-22
* Date: 2022-01-15 03:42:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1065754008|HIST 1065754008}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1065754012|SCI 1065754012}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1065754016|STYLE 1065754016}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1071741005|HIST 1071741005}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1071741009|SCI 1071741009}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1071741014|STYLE 1071741014}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The names of two buildings, the South Houses and North Houses, have been capitalized in this article since it was created in 2005.  There have recently been discussions and edits proposing that these terms should be lowercase.  The disagreement arises from whether these building names are proper nouns, and whether the sources using capitals constitute a "substantial majority".  

According to [[MOS:CAPS]], "In English, [[Proper noun|proper names]], which can be either single words or phrases, are typically capitalized," and "Wikipedia relies on sources to determine what is conventionally capitalized; only words and phrases that are consistently capitalized in a substantial majority of independent, reliable sources are capitalized in Wikipedia."  This RfC applies to this article as well as the related articles [[History of the Caltech house system]], [[Campus of the California Institute of Technology]], and [[California Institute of Technology]].

Please !vote whether to retain '''uppercase''' or change to '''lowercase'''. [[User:Antony-22|Antony&ndash;'''''22''''']] (<sup>[[User talk:Antony-22|talk]]</sup>‚ÅÑ<sub>[[Special:Contributions/Antony-22|contribs]]</sub>) 03:42, 15 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:All Lights Fucked on the Hairy Amp Drooling#rfc_0D3F36B|Talk:All Lights Fucked on the Hairy Amp Drooling]] expired 2022-02-14 07:01 ===
* Id: 0D3F36B
* Date: 2022-02-10 18:28:00

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_28CF78F|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2022-02-15 03:01 ===
* Id: 28CF78F
* User: TheGEICOgecko
* Date: 2022-01-17 23:37:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1066350758|PROP 1066350758}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1072296072|PROP 1072296072}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should Daily NK ([https://www.dailynk.com/english/ website link]) be considered an unreliable source? I noticed that Daily NK is used a lot in the article [[COVID-19 pandemic in North Korea]], and noticed that it seemed to somewhat contradict the World Health Organization about Covid-19 in North Korea during April 2020, not a complete contradiction, but Daily NK reported a positive case from a dead North Korean defector, while a WHO representative reported 100% negative cases. Additionally, I could not find any other sources that confirmed North Korea is lying about cases, implying that Daily NK has not been able to show definitive evidence of anything.

Doing some more research into Daily NK, I found this article that also points to the unreliability of Daily NK and it's influence on misinformation in the Western world: [https://www.aljazeera.com/opinions/2020/5/6/why-the-western-media-keeps-getting-north-korea-wrong Al Jazeera article].

Additionally, here are some Snopes articles, all which points to the unreliability of Daily NK: [https://www.snopes.com/news/2020/04/25/kim-jong-un-near-death/ Heart surgery], [https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/north-korea-ban-skinny-jeans/ Skinny jeans], [https://www.snopes.com/news/2020/04/10/north-korea-insists-it-has-no-coronavirus/ Coronavirus]

While it appears that Daily NK is not often being debunked, it appears that there is also no reason to particularly trust them as a reliable source. They use anonymous sources without further fact-checking (though I haven't found anything about them using defectors in particular as sources). While the number of sources that questions its reliability/call it unreliable seem a good bit limited, I have not been able to find a single source that confirms it as reliable. [[User:TheGEICOgecko|'''TheGEICOgecko''']] ([[User talk:TheGEICOgecko|talk]]) 23:37, 17 January 2022 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_7863DB5|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2022-02-15 03:01 ===
* Id: 7863DB5
* User: A loose necktie
* Date: 2022-01-16 02:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1071927909|PROP 1071927909}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Am wondering if the website ''[[Next Avenue]]'' can be considered a reliable source for information within a BLP.  Article: [[Morrison Polkinghorne]], url of source is [https://www.nextavenue.org/cambodia-second-act-business/ here].  Appears to have an editorial staff, is published by [[Public Broadcasting Service|PBS]], and claims to adhere to the [https://www.pbs.org/standards/ PBS Standards and Practices] (which looks like it means this source qualifies as generally reliable). I was not able to find any discussion of it in the archives.  What do others think?  [[User:A loose necktie|A loose necktie]] ([[User talk:A loose necktie|talk]]) 02:52, 16 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Climate change in the United States#rfc_F56DB14|Talk:Climate change in the United States]] expired 2022-02-15 20:01 ===
* Id: F56DB14
* User: RCraig09
* Date: 2022-01-16 19:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1066096691|SCI 1066096691}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1072066380|SCI 1072066380}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The narrow question is: ''which one of the following two [[Traditional ecological knowledge]] (TEK) '''''<u>sections</u>''''' is most appropriate for a Wikipedia article on the topic of '''[[Climate change]]''':''
# The [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Climate_change_in_the_United_States&oldid=1064705095#Traditional_Ecological_Knowledge_(TEK) 9 Jan 2022 version (which has been reverted)], versus
# The current (16 Jan) version, {{blue|[[Climate change in the United States#Traditional Ecological Knowledge (TEK)]]}}
''The following issues are raised:''
* [[WP:NEUTRAL]] Point of View
* [[WP:NOTAFORUM]]
* [[WP:Minority viewpoints]] (esp. re breadth interpreting the term, "[[climate change adaptation|climate change ''adaptation'']]")
* Direct [[WP:RELEVANCE]] to [[climate change adaptation]] (distinguish from [[WP:UNDUE]] weight re background topics such as relative virtues of TEK in general, power politics of getting TEK accepted, etc.)
* [[WP:WIKIVOICE]] and general [[WP:PROMOTION]]al tone 
The debate is not about editors' "world views", personal "expertise", underlying righteousness of a cause, etc. ‚Äî<span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:100%;color:dark blue;background-color:transparent;;">[[User:RCraig09|RCraig09]] ([[User talk:RCraig09|talk]])</span> 19:40, 16 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_5363378|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2022-02-17 00:01 ===
* Id: 5363378
* User: Kaleeb18
* Date: 2022-02-04 16:17:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1070052311|PROP 1070052311}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1075595340|PROP 1075595340}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
What is the reliability of [https://www.behindthevoiceactors.com/ ''Behind the Voice Actors''] (BTVA)? They are not user-generated content and they try to distinguish themselves from websites like IMDB and it also looks like they fact-check/verify their information with the primary source with a green tick. Past discussions here look like there is no clear consensus on BTVA. After this RfC, {{strikethrough|I think we should consider putting it on [[WP:RSP]]}}. Here are the past discussions [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 153#Behind the Voice Actors|[1]]], [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 277|[2]]], [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 136#Behind the Voice Actors site for use in Batman: Arkham City|[3]]], and [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 86#Behind the Voice Actors.com RS?|[4]]].

*'''Option 1:''' Generally reliable for the voice or actor of a character/entertainment news
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply
*'''Option 3:''' Generally unreliable for factual news
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information and should be deprecated
‚Äï [[User:Kaleeb18|<b style="background:#000;color:#f07b3a;padding:1q;border-radius:5q;">Kaleeb18</b>]][[User talk:Kaleeb18|<sup>Talk</sup>]]<sub style="position:relative;right:20q;margin-right:-15px;">Caleb</sub> 16:17, 4 February 2022 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:Assumption of Mary#rfc_91C751A|Talk:Assumption of Mary]] expired 2022-02-17 06:01 ===
* Id: 91C751A
* User: Achar Sva
* Date: 2022-02-12 10:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1071392693|RELI 1071392693}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1072340862|RELI 1072340862}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The question is, which version is better, version 1 or version 2? Or perhaps some middle position?

# There is no historical evidence for Mary's assumption,{{sfn|Duffy|1989|p=17}} and it is generally agreed that it was unknown in the earliest ages of the Church.{{sfn|Cross|Livingstone|2005|p=118}}
# The earliest Dormition traditions all see Mary's death as special.{{sfn|Shoemaker|2002|p=14}}  [[Eamon Duffy]] argues that there is no historical evidence for Mary's assumption,{{sfn|Duffy|1989|p=17}} and it is generally agreed that it was unknown in the earliest ages of the Church,{{sfn|Cross|Livingstone|2005|p=118}} though the state of the sources concerning the Dormition and the Assumption is limited.{{sfn|Shoemaker|2002|p=26}} 

For the reasons we give for our preferred versions, please see the immediately preceding section. Please note also that the ISP and I are not hostile towards each other. [[User:Achar Sva|Achar Sva]] ([[User talk:Achar Sva|talk]]) 10:15, 12 February 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Opinion polling for the 2022 Australian federal election#rfc_48204ED|Talk:Opinion polling for the 2022 Australian federal election]] expired 2022-02-17 12:01 ===
* Id: 48204ED
* User: Bondegezou
* Date: 2022-01-18 11:55:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1066448385|POL 1066448385}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1072382822|POL 1072382822}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the table of polling results include rows commenting on particular events, ''e.g.'' the row that says, "31 October 2021: French President Emmanuel Macron calls Scott Morrison a liar", as has been being discussed above? The obvious options are '''No''', '''Yes minimally (only changes in party leaders and election results)''' (as was the model being used) or '''Yes maximally (commentary on many events)''' (as with the current version of the article). Editors may wish to add other options.

If '''yes''' to the last of those options, what items should be included and how should this be determined? Options here might include '''Any items receiving considerable RS coverage''' or '''Any items where RS discuss how the event may shift polling''' or '''Any items where RS say the event shifted polling'''. Again, editors may wish to add other options. We can presume that normal rules, [[WP:CONSENSUS]] ''etc.'', would apply. [[User:Bondegezou|Bondegezou]] ([[User talk:Bondegezou|talk]]) 11:55, 18 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)/Sports notability#rfc_EA06F26|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)/Sports notability]] expired 2022-02-18 17:01 ===
* Id: EA06F26
* User: RandomCanadian
* Date: 2022-01-19 16:13:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1067981570|SOC 1067981570}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1067981573|POLICY 1067981573}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1072626097|SOC 1072626097}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1072626098|POLICY 1072626098}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Abolish the current version of [[WP:NSPORTS|NSPORTS]]. This page, far from being {{tq|rules of thumb which some editors choose to keep in mind when deciding whether or not to keep an article}}, does not help the decision process, but actively hampers it. Examples are countless of one group of editors (whether it be football, olympics, or plenty of others) arguing that an article should be kept because (correctly or not) its subject "passes N[some random sport]" or that "sportsperson from long time ago, there [[WP:MUSTBESOURCES]]"; and others correctly arguing that the existing coverage is not sufficient to write an encyclopedia article ([[WP:NOTDATABASE|as opposed to a database entry]]). This leads to needless conflict, pointless AfDs and DRVs, and above all bureaucratic waste of time. Abolishing this guideline and falling back directly to GNG would also help in reducing issues of [[WP:BIAS]] and the disproportionate amount of (usually white, male, European) sports figures that are included, as well as make policy more understandable to newer and more experienced editors alike by avoiding issues of [[WP:CREEP]]. [[User:RandomCanadian|RandomCanadian]] ([[User talk:RandomCanadian|talk]] / [[Special:Contributions/RandomCanadian|contribs]])  16:13, 19 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:The CW#rfc_4B86D1E|Talk:The CW]] expired 2022-02-18 22:01 ===

=== [[Talk:List of online encyclopedias#rfc_7686A23|Talk:List of online encyclopedias]] expired 2022-02-19 18:01 ===
* Id: 7686A23
* User: Adam Harangoz√≥
* Date: 2022-01-20 17:02:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1066901531|MEDIA 1066901531}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1066901534|SOC 1066901534}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1072832428|MEDIA 1072832428}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1072832438|SOC 1072832438}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hi All,
I would like to expand this list with online encyclopedias that do not have¬† their own Wikipedia articles. I believe they are relevant to Wikipedia but don't necessarily need their own articles ([[List of 19th-century encyclopedias|other]] encyclopedia lists also have items without an article). I would use [https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Mix'n'match/Catalogues this list] compiled for Wikidata properties - plenty of important, academic encyclopedias. When I tried to start expanding the list, my edits were reverted by {{ping|MrOllie}}. See our discussion about this [[User_talk:MrOllie/Archive_15#List_of_online_encyclopedias|here]]. One of his concerns was that the list would be filled with fan wikis - this can be avoided easily that the list only includes non-open reference works. Anyway, could you chip in and tell if it's okay for me to expand the article? Thanks.
[[User:Adam Harangoz√≥|Adam Harangoz√≥]] ([[User talk:Adam Harangoz√≥|talk]]) 17:02, 20 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:COVID-19 lab leak theory#rfc_DE7704C|Talk:COVID-19 lab leak theory]] expired 2022-02-19 21:01 ===
* Id: DE7704C
* User: Le Marteau
* Date: 2022-01-20 20:46:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1066920294|SCI 1066920294}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1072860737|SCI 1072860737}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The second paragraph of the lead currently reads as follows:

{{talk quote block|The idea that the virus was released from a laboratory (accidentally or deliberately) appeared early in the pandemic.<ref name=":1"/><ref name="WeaponizedAtlanticCouncilReport"/> The theory gained popularity in America through promotion by conservative figures including president [[Donald Trump]] and other members of the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]] in the spring of 2020,<ref name="SuddenRiseNYer"/> fomenting tensions between the US and China.<ref name=npr983156340/> Many in American liberal media and political circles subsequently dismissed it as a [[conspiracy theory]].<ref name="FrutosMarch2021"/><ref name="BBCTakenSeriously"/>}}

'''QUESTION:''' Should the following sentence be added to the lead...

{{talk quote block|Some scientists initially supported the lab leak theory in early 2020, but later changed their stance.<ref name="TelegraphFauciEmails2022"/><ref name="NBCNewsFauciEmails"/>}}

... so that it reads ...

{{talk quote block|The idea that the virus was released from a laboratory (accidentally or deliberately) appeared early in the pandemic.<ref name=":1"/><ref name="WeaponizedAtlanticCouncilReport"/> '''Some scientists initially supported the lab leak theory in early 2020, but later changed their stance.<ref name="TelegraphFauciEmails2022"/><ref name="NBCNewsFauciEmails"/>''' The theory gained popularity in America through promotion by conservative figures including president [[Donald Trump]] and other members of the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]] in the spring of 2020,<ref name="SuddenRiseNYer"/> fomenting tensions between the US and China.<ref name=npr983156340/> Many in American liberal media and political circles subsequently dismissed it as a [[conspiracy theory]].<ref name="FrutosMarch2021"/><ref name="BBCTakenSeriously"/>}} [[User:Le Marteau|Le Marteau]] ([[User talk:Le Marteau|talk]]) 20:46, 20 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Lead section#rfc_F665CEF|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Lead section]] expired 2022-02-20 04:01 ===
* Id: F665CEF
* Date: 2022-01-21 03:03:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1066985994|HIST 1066985994}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1066986002|STYLE 1066986002}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1072921866|HIST 1072921866}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1072921872|STYLE 1072921872}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
How should [[Dual naming|dualled place names]] generally be presented in an articles lede and infobox, when the dual name is not the common name?
:'''A''': As at [[Uluru]] - Both individual names and dual name in the lede as [[WP:ALTNAMES]], with the title as the leading name. Both individual names in infobox.
:'''B''': As at [[Disentis]] - Both individual names and dual name in lede as [[WP:ALTNAMES]], with the title as the leading name. Dual name in infobox.
:'''C''': As at [[Bradshaw Sound]] - Only the dual name in lede, dual name in infobox.

The RFC is held at this central location as it affects articles about places in Australia, France, New Zealand, and Switzerland, but it is not intended to alter the MOS. The context of the RFC is ongoing debate about the ideal format, which this RFC is intended to resolve in a consistent manner. 03:03, 21 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Kanye West#rfc_701A07F|Talk:Kanye West]] expired 2022-02-20 19:01 ===
* Id: 701A07F
* User: 59.93.255.148
* Date: 2022-01-26 19:30:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1069722500|MEDIA 1069722500}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1073991587|MEDIA 1073991587}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 

West's influence extends far beyond rap, and several current musical acts have publicly expressed that they were influenced by him, or have multiple media outlets saying that their music is influenced by West (eg - Billie Eillish, Frank Ocean etc). He has a lot of influence in hip hop, but also on mainstream pop, RNB and other genres. I think we should change 'one of the most influential rappers of all time' to 'one of the most influential musical artists of all time'.

If that sounds too grandiose, 'one of the most influential musical artists of the 21st century' is also appriopriate. [[Special:Contributions/59.93.255.148|59.93.255.148]] ([[User talk:59.93.255.148|talk]]) 19:30, 26 January 2022 (UTC)}}

* Id: 45651B4
* User: Mhawk10 
* Date: 2022-01-30 20:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1068930482|HIST 1068930482}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1068930490|POL 1068930490}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1068930496|SOC 1068930496}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1074718583|POL 1074718583}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1074718588|SOC 1074718588}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1074727083|RELI 1074727083}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''What changes should be made to the first sentence of this article?'''
*'''Option A:''' Change the first sentence to {{tq|The '''Uyghur genocide''' is the series of ongoing human rights abuses committed by the government of China against Uyghurs and other ethnic and religious minorities in Xinjiang}}. 
*'''Option B:''' Change the first sentence to {{tq|"The Chinese government has committed a series of ongoing human rights abuses against Uyghurs and other ethnic and religious minorities in Xinjiang, often characterized as genocide."}}
*'''Option B2''' Change the first sentence to {{tq|"Since 2014, the Chinese government has committed a series of ongoing human rights abuses against Uyghurs and other ethnic and religious minorities in Xinjiang, often characterized as genocide."}}
*'''Option C:''' Change the first sentence to {{tq|The allegations of oppression of the Uighur ethnic group, that some Western academics have characterized as a genocide, constitute a series of alleged human rights abuses committed by the government of China against Uyghurs and other ethnic and religious minorities in Xinjiang}}
*'''Option D:''' Replace the current first sentence with some other descriptive sentence.
*'''Option E:''' Leave the first sentence as-is.
‚Äî [[User:Mhawk10|Mhawk10]] ([[User talk:Mhawk10 |talk]]) 20:49, 30 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Billion#rfc_0602B1D|Talk:Billion]] expired 2022-02-23 05:01 ===
* Id: 0602B1D
* User: Betty Logan
* Date: 2022-02-08 17:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1070678033|LANG 1070678033}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1070678039|SCI 1070678039}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1073526178|LANG 1073526178}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1073526184|SCI 1073526184}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is currently a dispute about how this article should be structured. Here are the two competing options:

# [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Billion&oldid=1070657022 Version 1], using bullet points to treat the definition on the two number scales equally and clearly.
# [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Billion&oldid=1070653570 Version 2], prioritising the modern-day definition in English speaking countries.

Other relevant considerations:
* [[#No, there are not two current definitions to the word in English]] ‚Äì the discussion above that led to this RFC
* The [[Trillion]] article
* [[Names of large numbers]] article
[[User:Betty Logan|Betty Logan]] ([[User talk:Betty Logan|talk]]) 17:16, 8 February 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Piano Quintet (Schumann)#rfc_25A6028|Talk:Piano Quintet (Schumann)]] expired 2022-02-23 07:01 ===
* Id: 25A6028
* User: Ravpapa
* Date: 2022-01-28 13:21:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1072208612|MEDIA 1072208612}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1073539571|MEDIA 1073539571}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
An anonymous editor has twice removed the word "funeral march" from the description of the slow movement. He has justified this by saying that the tempo marking on the movement only mentions "marcia" and does not mention funeral. However, the form is unquestionably that of a [[Funeral March]] and not of, for example, a military march, and it is universally referred to in the literature as a funeral march. When I restored the term funeral march to the article, I added a reference, but the anonymous editor removed it again.
I do not want to edit war with this editor, so I am referring to the hive mind to adjudicate the matter. I will abstain from editing for a few days while responses gather here like bees to a honeypot.

--[[User:Ravpapa|Ravpapa]] ([[User talk:Ravpapa|talk]]) 13:21, 28 January 2022 (UTC)}}
