=== [[Talk:Birth of the Cool#rfc_4A2A9F1|Talk:Birth of the Cool]] expired 2022-02-25 21:01 ===
* Id: 4A2A9F1
* User: Piotr Jr.
* Date: 2022-02-22 02:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1073313516|MEDIA 1073313516}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1073999166|MEDIA 1073999166}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
All right. Since I haven't gotten much response from the second party to this content dispute, particularly some key points, and instead gotten accusations of canvassing, I'm inviting others here in a completely unselective manner, although said party is still welcome to find further verification for his or hers (or their) position. Anyway! On with it. The second party's edit (which had remained, according to them for over a year here before I reverted it today) had made the release date in the infobox to claim "February or March 1957" and same in the lead, with multiple sources cited together, one claiming the March release and the other two or three claiming February. I reduced it to one source after seeing enough sources that made it in my mind a majority claim. After a bit back and forth, much off-topic, here we are. [[User:Piotr Jr.|Piotr Jr.]] ([[User talk:Piotr Jr.|talk]]) 02:08, 22 February 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:2022 Winter Olympics#rfc_79D1FA7|Talk:2022 Winter Olympics]] expired 2022-02-26 02:01 ===
* Id: 79D1FA7
* User: ErnestKrause
* Date: 2022-02-07 17:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1070482868|POL 1070482868}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1070482878|SOC 1070482878}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1074036019|POL 1074036019}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1074036024|SOC 1074036024}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
A significant amount of Talk page discussion and reverting has focused on the question of whether or not to include a summary of the subsection of the article dealing with Controversies in the lead section. The RFC is to determine if consensus among editors is that article should or should not include a summary of the Controversies section in the lead section, and what form it should take if consensus is that some version of a summary of the Controversies section should be included in the lead section.

:Option (A): The lead section should not include a summary of the subsection on Controversies in the lead section, since the article is ostensively about the sporting events taking place at the Olympics.

:Option (B): Include a neutral version of a summary of the subsection on Controversies which does not single out any of the nearly two dozen Controversies currently listed in the subsection on Controversies.

:Option (C): Include a version of the summary of the subsection on Controversies which lists the human rights issues and Ugyur controversies as examples of the many Controversies currently taking place at the Winter Olympics.

:Option (D): Other options. 

Editors are requested to await the conclusion of the RFC before adding further edits about Controversies into the lead section. [[User:ErnestKrause|ErnestKrause]] ([[User talk:ErnestKrause|talk]]) 17:07, 7 February 2022 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1073937326|HIST 1073937326}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1073937332|LANG 1073937332}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1073937336|POL 1073937336}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1074061346|HIST 1074061346}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1074061350|LANG 1074061350}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1074061353|POL 1074061353}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the political status of the territory of Taiwan as a province of China, which is the ROC's, PRC's, and US's official position, and as far as I know not questioned by any other state, be mentioned in the lede, perhaps in the first paragraph, and described in the article (It is currently not described as a province anywhere in this article)? ( In the Joint Communique, the United States recognized the Government of the People's Republic of China as the sole legal government of China, acknowledging the Chinese position that there is but one China and Taiwan is part of China. https://2009-2017.state.gov/r/pa/ei/bgn/35855.htm )  There are currently 2 articles [[Taiwan Province]] and [[Taiwan Province, People's Republic of China]], should they be linked to from this article?  There was a previous RFC [[RFC Talk:Taiwan/Archive_30#RfC:_Taiwan,_"country"_or_"state"]] which did not address this issue, but for some reason there is an info box on this page banning reference to Taiwan as a province based on that RFC. Should that info box be changed? '''[[User:L'Origine du monde|<span style="color:red; font-family:Edwardian Script ITC;font-size:15px; text-shadow: 0 0 .2">‚ô• L'Origine du monde ‚ô•</span>]]''' <sup><span style="color:blue">‚ô• [[User talk:L'Origine du monde|Talk]] ‚ô•</span></sup> 12:33, 25 February 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Weather#rfc_5069F57|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Weather]] expired 2022-02-26 14:01 ===
* Id: 5069F57
* User: Hurricane Noah
* Date: 2022-02-12 23:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1071501422|SCI 1071501422}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1071501427|POLICY 1071501427}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1071501433|TECH 1071501433}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1074115841|SCI 1074115841}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1074115849|POLICY 1074115849}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1074115853|TECH 1074115853}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which color scheme is more accessible?

The current colors have been used across weather for the past decade. I believe these colors are hard to distinguish between on track maps for the dots, particularly between the Category 1-4 range. There simply isn't enough contrast between the colors to tell them apart (C1 and C2, C2 and C3, C3 and C4). This has presented a challenge for me as a reader and editor with normal color vision and decent eyesight with glasses. I have to open the full resolution to tell the difference between the colors and even then it can be a challenge for some. This issue would be even worse for color-blind editors. On the grounds of [[WP:ACCESS]], I am proposing a change to the below SSHWS colors, which increase the contrast between the hurricane colors. Please place comments in the formal discussion section below. [[User:Hurricane Noah|<span style="white-space:nowrap;text-shadow:#009200 0.3em 0.4em 1.0em,#009200 -0.2em -0.2em 1.0em;color:#009200"><b>Noah</b></span>]]<sup>[[User talk:Hurricane Noah|<span style="color:#ff0000"><b>Talk</b></span>]]</sup> 23:33, 12 February 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_C79B28C|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2022-02-28 10:01 ===
* Id: C79B28C
* User: Thryduulf
* Date: 2022-01-29 09:37:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1068600902|TECH 1068600902}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1068600907|PROP 1068600907}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1074454317|TECH 1074454317}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1074454319|PROP 1074454319}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which icon should replace the currently used ones for PDF files? At [[#RFC: New PDF icon]] there was consensus to replace the current PDF icon ([[:File:Icons-mini-file acrobat.gif]] [[File:Icons-mini-file acrobat.gif|16px]]) with one that is not based on the Adobe Acrobat logo, but not on a specific replacement. At [[#Further discussion (PDF icon)]] all the public domain icons currently available at Wikimedia Commons that are not based on the Acrobat logo were considered and three identified as clearly better than the others, this RFC seeks to determine which of those options should be used. [[User:Thryduulf|Thryduulf]] ([[User talk:Thryduulf|talk]]) 09:37, 29 January 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion#rfc_F12528C|Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion]] expired 2022-03-05 04:01 ===
* Id: F12528C
* Date: 2022-02-03 03:25:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1069599432|POLICY 1069599432}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1075325824|POLICY 1075325824}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I screwed up and erroneously contested a reasonable CSD over the redirect [[Mike Hart (outfieldr, born 1951)]], instead causing it to be sent to RFD, wasting other editors' time. I did this because R3 contains the phrase "Implausible typo", which leads to the idea that plausible typos (such as forgetting a letter, as was the case in the CSD I contested) should be kept, or at least sent to RFD. After {{User|Tamzin}} told me about what I did wrong, I cast my non-vote as '''Delete''' and then proceeded to type this up.

Overall, the word "Typo" in R3 implies that redirects that are '''NOT''' plausible, intentional search terms, but are still likely to be accidentally typed, should be kept. This is not the case, and as such, I think we should remove the term "Typo" from the page. This both reduces confusion ''and'' sets a clear precedent for dealing with such redirects, as they are now "Implausible Misnomers" and can therefore be deleted. [[User:Plutonical|<span style="color:#d00">'''‚ò¢Ô∏èPlutonical‚ò¢Ô∏è'''</span>]][[User Talk: Plutonical|<span style="color:#d00">·∂ú·µí·µê·µê·µò‚Åø·∂¶·∂ú·µÉ·µó·∂¶·µí‚ÅøÀ¢</span>]] 03:25, 3 February 2022 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
Should a bot that adds AFC templates to drafts be made? &ndash; <span style="background-color:#414357">[[User:AssumeGoodWraith|<span style="color:Orange">'''AssumeGoodWraith'''</span>]]</span> <small>([[User talk:AssumeGoodWraith|talk]] <nowiki>|</nowiki> [[Special:Contributions/AssumeGoodWraith|contribs]])</small> 08:08, 15 February 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_3EDC437|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2022-03-07 16:01 ===
* Id: 3EDC437
* User: VickKiang
* Date: 2022-03-07 08:57:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1075734299|PROP 1075734299}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1075770057|PROP 1075770057}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[[Sky News Australia]] is a conservative news outlet from Australia. They have in the past made numerous misleading claims, [https://climatefeedback.org/?s=sky+news+australia especially their opinions and all talk shows,] but the news content also had numerous failed fact-checks and being stated as a [https://theconversation.com/is-sky-news-shifting-australian-politics-to-the-right-not-yet-but-there-is-cause-for-alarm-155356 partisan, inaccurate source]. For example, it cites numerous views clearly [http://web.archive.org/web/20220307081543/https://www.skynews.com.au/australia-news/new-sundriven-cooling-period-of-earth-not-far-off/video/fea568019f085eccb33e4a6653d84518 not adhering to the IPCC consensus for climate change as straight news]. Furthermore, Sky uses sensationalist headlines for [https://www.skynews.com.au/australia-news/president-trump-has-huge-win-following-powerful-endorsement/video/291ca3dbe24a305f53b547f41c11c972 politics] (with unreliable opinion cited directly from the editorial board) and publishes inaccurate information on the [https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2021/08/02/australia-fox-covid-murdoch/ coronavirus both for opinion] and [https://www.skynews.com.au/australia-news/this-is-not-a-pandemic-it-is-a-catastrophic-state-government-failure-alan-jones/video/ed047491b248d4f365d783fe8423dde5. news] (publishing fringe views from its editor quoting that the coronavirus was 'not a pandemic' despite WHO suggesting otherwise). There were also numerous [https://www.theguardian.com/media/2018/nov/02/ross-cameron-sacked-from-sky-news-after-racist-comments-about-chinese-people  additional incidents in the past for its opinion sections]. Please also refer to WP: [[Sky News Australia]] for a more detailed list of criticism. Nevertheless, this is a popular source frequently cited in WP. [[User:VickKiang|VickKiang]] ([[User talk:VickKiang|talk]]) 08:57, 7 March 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Persian Gulf#rfc_227DC45|Talk:Persian Gulf]] expired 2022-03-11 16:01 ===
* Id: 227DC45
* User: Firefangledfeathers
* Date: 2022-02-09 15:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1070849467|HIST 1070849467}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1070849473|POL 1070849473}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1070849477|STYLE 1070849477}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1076532248|HIST 1076532248}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1076532255|POL 1076532255}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1076532257|STYLE 1076532257}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should 'Arabian Gulf' be included as an alternative name in the first sentence, and if so how? {{blist|{{strong|Option A}}: {{tq|sometimes called the {{strong|Arabian Gulf}} ({{lang-ar|ÿßŸéŸÑŸíÿÆŸéŸÑŸêŸäŸíÿ¨Ÿè Ÿ±ŸÑŸíÿπŸéÿ±Ÿéÿ®ŸêŸäŸèŸë|Al-Khalƒ´j al-ÀÅArabƒ´}})}}|{{strong|Option B}}: {{tq|referred to in Arab countries as the {{strong|Arabian Gulf}} ({{lang-ar|ÿßŸéŸÑŸíÿÆŸéŸÑŸêŸäŸíÿ¨Ÿè Ÿ±ŸÑŸíÿπŸéÿ±Ÿéÿ®ŸêŸäŸèŸë|Al-Khalƒ´j al-ÀÅArabƒ´}})}}|{{strong|Option C}}: Exclude from the lead|{{strong|Option D}}: {{tq|The '''Persian Gulf''' ({{lang-fa|ÿÆŸÑ€åÿ¨ ŸÅÿßÿ±ÿ≥|translit=xalij-e f√¢rs|lit=Gulf of [[Persis|Fars]]}}, {{IPA-fa|x√¶liÀêd íe f…íÀê…æs|pron}}) ({{lang-ar|ÿßŸÑÿÆŸéŸÑŸêŸäŸêÿ¨Ÿè ÿßŸÑÿπŸéÿ±Ÿéÿ®ŸêŸäŸë|translit=Al-Khalƒ´j al- øArabi|lit=The Arabian Gulf}})}}}} 
This article has experienced over a decade of slow back-and-forth editing to add/remove 'Arabian Gulf' in the lead. There have been numerous discussions, usually short, and one [[Talk:Persian_Gulf/Archive_6#RFC%3A_Should_"Arabian_Gulf"_be_mentioned_in_the_intro%3F|RfC in 2007]], which was not formally closed, and it's not readily apparent what the consensus was. Whichever way this RfC lands, it would be helpful to have a solid consensus to point to when editors add or remove 'Arabian Gulf' from the lead. [[User talk:Firefangledfeathers|Firefangledfeathers]] 15:49, 9 February 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of fictional characters with disabilities#rfc_90BDC00|Talk:List of fictional characters with disabilities]] expired 2022-03-12 12:01 ===
* Id: 90BDC00
* User: A._C._Santacruz
* Date: 2022-02-10 11:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1071010946|MEDIA 1071010946}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1071010950|SOC 1071010950}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1076686844|MEDIA 1076686844}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1076686847|SOC 1076686847}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Wikipedia's interests in increasing the visibility of both disabilities and LGBTQ+ identities while diminishing the possibility of demeaning or hurtful presentations of these minorities sometimes may cause tension that is difficult to resolve. Issues arising in this area must be addressed with a high sensitivity to the competing concerns and editors must remain civil and continue to assume good faith from others in the discussion. This RfC is an effort to address such an issue on this page. A previous discussion happened above in [[Talk:List_of_fictional_characters_with_disabilities#Sexual_orientation_and_disabled_characters|this section]], but an involved editor disputed the consensus from this discussion based on how few editors were involved. Thus,  I have started this RfC to gain more involvement as low participation is a valid concern.
# The list should not include this information and limit itself just to describing the disability of the character(s); (Table 1)
# Add an additional column to the list titled "Character Notes" to include this information and other character descriptors that readers might find interesting or relate to, keeping the disability information in a "Disabilities" column; (Table 2)
# The list should include this information in the "Notes" section (status quo) (Table 3)
<small> Notifying previously involved editors: {{reply to|Historyday01|Trystan|Tamasys|Dodger67|Erik|Dimadick|‚±Æ|p=.}}</small> [[User:A._C._Santacruz|A. C. Santacruz]] &#8258; [[User talk:A._C._Santacruz|Please ping me!]] 11:22, 10 February 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_3F92E49|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2022-03-12 15:01 ===
* Id: 3F92E49
* User: Liuxinyu970226
* Date: 2022-02-16 02:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1077766851|PROP 1077766851}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
We have consensus to deprecate Baidu Baike, but as of now we really don't have any consensus for another Baidu product, the Baidu Tieba. Two months ago {{ping|Â§ßÁå©Áå©Âüé}} modified [[Line 6 (Tianjin Metro)]] with frivolous mentions of Line 8 stations, and when I asked for sources supporting them to modify so, [[Singular they|they]] pointed [https://tieba.baidu.com/p/7636663652] to me, claimed that their members asked NDRC and provided reasons for saying Line 6 instead of Line 8.

My suggestion is to also deprecate Baidu Tieba, or even we should add it to spam blacklist due to mass user-generated contents, mass copy-paste of copyvio contents and mass release of republic of fake news.

See also: [[Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_174#Can_we_use_blogs_to_show_that_a_subject_is_discussed_in_cyberspace?]]. --[[User:Liuxinyu970226|Liuxinyu970226]] ([[User talk:Liuxinyu970226|talk]]) 02:10, 16 February 2022 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:Military academies in Russia#rfc_715AC1E|Talk:Military academies in Russia]] expired 2022-03-12 17:01 ===
* Id: 715AC1E
* User: K8M8S8
* Date: 2022-03-12 11:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1076693458|HIST 1076693458}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1076693462|POL 1076693462}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1076731224|HIST 1076731224}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1076731229|POL 1076731229}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I suggest to split the article into two articles: "Military academies in Russia" and "Military schools and institutions in Russia" on the basis of the following justification:
* Higher military schools and military institutions prepare career commissioned officers for active duty service as platoon/company commanders and at equivalent positions (tactical level). It is the first level of higher military education. Any citizen who graduated from secondary school can entry military school or institution.
* Military academies improve skills of commissioned officers to allow them to be appointed to battalion/regiment/brigade commander or equivalent positions (operational-tactical level). It is the second level of higher military education. Officer can entry military academy only after several years of active duty service as commissioned officer. In addition, there is [[Military Academy of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Russia]], which is the third level of higher military education. (strategic level).

I think it would be better to avoid the mixing of military educational institutions accessible to all citizens without officer's rank for enrolment and military educational institutions accessible to career commissioned officers only.

Also, I'm totally against the inclusion in the article's text of  Suvorov, Nakhimov and similar schools. These schools don't prepare military personnel at all. These schools are usual secondary schools, just with a military focus, which graduates can choose either military or civilian way of life. So, we need a separate article for these schools. [[User:K8M8S8|K8M8S8]] ([[User talk:K8M8S8|talk]]) 11:07, 12 March 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Chinese government response to COVID-19#rfc_C2B74A1|Talk:Chinese government response to COVID-19]] expired 2022-03-13 01:01 ===
* Id: C2B74A1
* User: Adoring nanny
* Date: 2022-02-15 17:58:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1072047219|SCI 1072047219}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1072047228|POL 1072047228}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1077691753|SCI 1077691753}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1077691760|POL 1077691760}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Please give your opinion as to which is a better first paragraph:
#'''Option A:''' [[Special:Permalink/1071748852|current wording]]: {{tq|During the [[COVID-19 pandemic in mainland China]], the [[government of China]] has followed a [[zero COVID]] strategy to prevent the spread of [[COVID-19]].<ref name=doi10.1038d41586-022-00191-7 /> After discovery of a cluster of patients with [[pneumonia]] of unknown [[Cause (medicine)|etiology]] in [[Wuhan]], [[Hubei Province]], a public notice on the outbreak was distributed on 31 December 2019.<ref name="Science-Tian-2020"/> On 8 January 2020, a new [[coronavirus]] ([[Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2|SARS-CoV-2]]) was announced by Chinese scientists as the cause of the new disease.<ref name=wsj11578485668 />}}
#'''Option B:''' {{tq|During the [[COVID-19 pandemic in mainland China]], the [[government of China]] pursued a [[zero-COVID]] strategy to prevent the domestic spread of [[COVID-19]]. The government of China has also responded to the pandemic with censorship,<ref name=nyt20201219 /><ref name=bbc55355401 /> secrecy,<ref name=ap24fbadc58cee3a40bca2ddf7a14d2955 /><ref name=pbschinas-covid-secrets /> and misinformation.<ref name="NYT 2020-04-22" /><ref name=doi10.37016mr-2020-025 />}}
#'''Option Z:''' {{tq|During the [[COVID-19 pandemic in mainland China]], the [[government of China]] pursued a [[zero-COVID]] strategy to prevent the domestic spread of [[COVID-19]]. Aspects of the response have been controversial, with the zero-COVID approach being praised<ref name="Lancet-ID-Burki-2020"/><ref name="Policy Design and Practice"/> and the government's lack of transparency<ref name=ap24fbadc58cee3a40bca2ddf7a14d2955 /><ref name=pbschinas-covid-secrets />, censorship<ref name=nyt20201219 /><ref name=bbc55355401 />, and spread of misinformation<ref name=doi10.37016mr-2020-025 /> being criticized}}
#Something else (please specify).
[[User:Adoring nanny|Adoring nanny]] ([[User talk:Adoring nanny|talk]]) 17:58, 15 February 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Notability (sports)#rfc_DC04F02|Wikipedia talk:Notability (sports)]] expired 2022-03-14 23:01 ===
* Id: DC04F02
* Date: 2022-02-12 22:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1071494309|SOC 1071494309}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1071494311|POLICY 1071494311}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1077181293|SOC 1077181293}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1077181296|POLICY 1077181296}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
For each of the sports below, should participation in the Olympics be removed as an indicator of presumed notability? There is one survey for each sub-guideline that includes this presumption, in order to allow each sport to be treated individually.

This is a follow up to the [[Wikipedia_talk:Notability_(sports)/Archive_43#Formal_proposal:_Olympic_athletes|2021 RFC that removed the general presumption of notability for Olympic athletes]], and will have no impact on Olympic athletes who medalled, as they are presumed notable under [[WP:NOLYMPIC|NOLYMPIC]]. 22:23, 12 February 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Article titles#rfc_E5F57D5|Wikipedia talk:Article titles]] expired 2022-03-16 16:01 ===
* Id: E5F57D5
* User: Crouch, Swale
* Date: 2022-03-10 22:47:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1076399508|POLICY 1076399508}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1077487262|POLICY 1077487262}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should [[WP:NATURAL]] and [[WP:NCDAB]] be rewritten to reflect that natural disambiguation should generally only be used to settle titles where there are near equal choices such as [[Chinese whispers]] v [[Telephone (game)]] ([[Talk:Chinese whispers#Requested move 28 October 2020|RM]]) and [[Handa Island]] v [[Handa, Scotland]] ([[Talk:Handa Island#Requested move 7 February 2020|RM]]) and not generally allow significantly less common titles trump the most common such as [[Bus (computing)]] v [[Computer bus]] ([[Talk:Bus (computing)#Requested move 14 January 2022|RM]]) and [[Fan (machine)]] v [[Mechanical fan]] ([[Talk:Fan (machine)#Requested move 3 August 2018|RM]])? In the 2nd sentence at [[WP:NATURAL]] I propose to change {{tq|"Do not, however, use obscure or made-up names."}} to {{tq|"Natural disambiguation can generally be used where there are titles that are near equal choices (such as [[French language]] v [[French (language)]]), where its otherwise disputed such is best (like [[Chinese whispers]] v [[Telephone (game)]]) or where adding a qualifier is difficult or impossible like [[Sarah Jane Brown]] where plain [[Sarah Brown]] is ambiguous. In general qualified titles are preferred to natural disambiguation if the choice is not near equal even if the title would be understood, thus [[New York (state)]] is preferred to [[New York State]] and [[Bray, Berkshire]] is preferred to [[Bray on Thames]], in particular do not, use obscure or [[WP:NOTNEO|made-up names]]".}} I don't mind if all or some of this is in a footnote if this is too long and I welcome any suggestions for better examples. {{Ping|Born2cycle|Amakuru|RGloucester}} '''[[User:Crouch, Swale|<span style="color:Green">Crouch, Swale</span>]]''' ([[User talk:Crouch, Swale|<span style="color:Blue">talk</span>]])  22:47, 10 March 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Amantadine#rfc_E85A344|Talk:Amantadine]] expired 2022-03-16 21:01 ===
* Id: E85A344
* User: Szmenderowiecki
* Date: 2022-02-14 20:58:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1071881414|SCI 1071881414}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1071881418|POL 1071881418}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1077538295|SCI 1077538295}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1077538299|POL 1077538299}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The edit [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Amantadine&type=revision&diff=1071744599&oldid=1071737220&diffmode=source has been] [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Amantadine&type=revision&diff=1071839938&oldid=1071838994&diffmode=source reverted] [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Amantadine&type=revision&diff=1071840199&oldid=1071839938&diffmode=source twice], the first time with the summary "Already covered in COVID-19 section" (there has been none before) and the other saying that it fails [[WP:NOTJOURNAL]] and notability ("not a substantial part of history").

Should the information about the research on the drug about COVID-19 and the rise of popularity of the drug in Poland be included? The model text is quoted [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Amantadine&type=revision&diff=1071839938&oldid=1071838994&diffmode=source] [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Amantadine&type=revision&diff=1071840199&oldid=1071839938&diffmode=source] in these two diffs (for the visual version, see [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Amantadine&oldid=1071838994 here]). Some minor modifications are of course possible. See also [[w:pl:Amantadyna#COVID-19|Polish Wikipedia]]. I am able to provide translations from Polish, if needed. [[User:Szmenderowiecki|Szmenderowiecki]] ([[User talk:Szmenderowiecki|talk]]) 20:58, 14 February 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:2022 Hungarian LGBTQ in education referendum#rfc_E065462|Talk:2022 Hungarian LGBTQ in education referendum]] expired 2022-03-16 22:01 ===
* Id: E065462
* User: Helper201
* Date: 2022-02-14 21:29:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1071889885|POL 1071889885}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1077547275|POL 1077547275}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
What evidence do we have of the reliability of Sz√°zadv√©g as a pollster? Do they fairly poll respondents across a broad range of all ages and demographics, weight age and sex of respondents etc and ask questions in a neutral manner? For example, if the questions were worded exactly how they are set to be in the proposed changes set out in the referendum, then there could be accusations levelled against their neutrality and wording. Do they have any links to the Hungarian government? I think it is also important that we note how the questions in the poll were worded, the number of people polled and the demographics of those who were polled. Preferably we should also include polls from more than one pollster/polling organisation. [[User:Helper201|Helper201]] ([[User talk:Helper201|talk]]) 21:29, 14 February 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_CAB662B|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2022-03-17 09:01 ===
* Id: CAB662B
* User: Mike Peel
* Date: 2022-02-19 20:38:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1072860747|SOC 1072860747}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1077683200|SOC 1077683200}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I was surprised to discover that we have [[:Category:Swiss footballers]] with a subcategory of [[:Category:Swiss women's footballers]] yesterday, since this seems to contradict [[Wikipedia:Categorization/Ethnicity, gender, religion and sexuality#Gender]], specifically "sportsperson categories should be split by gender, except in such cases where men and women participate primarily in mixed-gender competition". I think that we need to have "men's" subcategories to match "women's". It seems that this is a systematic problem with footballer categories, and the CfD at [[Wikipedia:Categories for discussion/Log/2022 February 18#Category:Swiss footballers]] had a lot of procedural opposes since this needs a wider discussion. Hence this RfC - '''should we have "men's footballers" categories to match the "women's footballers" categories that already exist?''' Thanks. [[User:Mike Peel|Mike Peel]] ([[User talk:Mike Peel|talk]]) 20:38, 19 February 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Effects of climate change#rfc_E05288C|Talk:Effects of climate change]] expired 2022-03-17 18:01 ===
* Id: E05288C
* User: Femkemilene
* Date: 2022-02-15 17:02:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1072075692|SCI 1072075692}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1077691753|SCI 1077691753}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
We've been discussing the use of [[WP:excerpt]]s a lot, but haven't really come to a conclusion about when their advantages outweight their disadvantages. I'm starting an RfC to establish consensus about when to use them, to get a broader input. I hope that we can develop best practises, that may also be used outside of this particular article.

* '''A''' No particular restrictions
* '''B''' Only use them when the original text is (1) fully cited & a comment is place in the original article that cites should not be removed (some editors prefer leads to be citation-free, which is allowed per [[WP:LEADCITE]])
* '''C''' Only use them as above + (2) the text is either recently reviewed (GA/FA), or reviewed by the person replacing article text with an excerpt for basic accuracy + prose quality. 
* '''D''' Only use them as above + (3) also make sure there is no duplication of information with rest of article. 
[[User:Femkemilene|Femke]] ([[User talk:Femkemilene|talk]]) 17:02, 15 February 2022 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1077879372|SOC 1077879372}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Q: Should this '''biography article''' be censored by redacting a written statement of this leading physicist on the contentious topic of [[global warming]], or is a bio article the right (the only; a normal/usual) place for such a quote to be stated. The discussion has attracted only a [[Wikipedia:Why_Wikipedia_is_not_so_great#Controlling_problematic_users_vs._allowing_wide_participation|gang of editors]] who fiercely advocated the former view, but who stopped ganging up after a notice to that effect was posted. Wikipedia officially does not censor, and the [[Wikipedia:Biographies_of_living_persons#Recently_dead_or_probably_dead|Biography of Living Persons]] policy does not apply since the scientist has died (extensions apply only under special circumstances like threat of suicide for his/her family member, which clearly does not apply here). [[User:Yreuq|Yreuq]] ([[User talk:Yreuq|talk]]) 15:39, 18 March 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Weather#rfc_DA2344E|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Weather]] expired 2022-03-18 19:01 ===
* Id: DA2344E
* User: Hurricane Noah
* Date: 2022-02-26 15:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1074133075|SCI 1074133075}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1074133081|POLICY 1074133081}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1074133085|TECH 1074133085}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1077887981|SCI 1077887981}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1077887985|POLICY 1077887985}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1077887989|TECH 1077887989}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the above colors for the maps also be adopted for infoboxes and other weather templates using the same scale? Should the timeline background color be changed for all weather articles?

It has been brought to my attention that the above RfC may not have been clear about the entire scope of the changes. Given that consensus was achieved above to remove links from infoboxes for colored regions, that contrast aspect is no longer an issue. However, two issues still remain. Some people have mentioned above that they want to keep consistency between the maps and the infoboxes as it could be confusing if there are differences between the two. Additionally, the color blindness issue still remains for those who use colors to tell apart different statuses as the same contrast issue between colors exists, especially when multiple statuses are in an infobox for different agencies. This proposal increases the contrast between colors in infoboxes and other templates which use the same scale to match the maps which were changed in the above RfC. I recently also discovered a serious breach of MOS:ACCESS on the timelines where the TS color blends in with the background for folks who possess a color blindness. Another header is added below to provide a change that in conjunction with the new colors will fix that issue as well. [[User:Hurricane Noah|<span style="white-space:nowrap;text-shadow:#009200 0.3em 0.4em 1.0em,#009200 -0.2em -0.2em 1.0em;color:#009200"><b>Noah</b></span>]]<sup>[[User talk:Hurricane Noah|<span style="color:#ff0000"><b>Talk</b></span>]]</sup> 15:33, 26 February 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Rotherham child sexual exploitation scandal#rfc_279AD3B|Talk:Rotherham child sexual exploitation scandal]] expired 2022-03-24 08:01 ===
* Id: 279AD3B
* User: Colgated
* Date: 2022-02-22 07:04:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1073348000|POL 1073348000}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1078967677|POL 1078967677}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Some content is under dispute, with me, @[[User:AllSaintsNext|AllSaintsNext]] and @[[User:80.6.178.12|80.6.178.12]] disagreeing on various sentences, as per discussions above. The proposed content has been slightly modified for readability and suggestions made above.

# Should the section "Issues of ethnicity" contain the following sentence, with a reference to the [https://www.rotherham.gov.uk/downloads/file/279/independent-inquiry-into-child-sexual-exploitation-in-rotherham Jay report], p. 147? {{diff|Rotherham child sexual exploitation scandal||1064332964|Original removal diff}}
#:The inquiry's report stated that "agencies should acknowledge the suspected model of localised grooming of young white girls by men of Pakistani heritage, instead of being inhibited by the fear of affecting community relations."
# Should the section "''The Times'' investigation", subsection "Background" contain the following, with a reference to this [https://archive.fo/Dg2Cq 2014 Times article] (non-paywall link)?
#:Groups of men would flatter young girls in public places, offering them alcohol, cigarettes and lifts in fancy cars. One man would become the "boyfriend", and soon the girls were expected to have sex with the whole group, including contacts out of town. Norfolk writes that most sex offenders in the UK are white men and lone offenders; according to Norfolk, these cases were distinctive because most of the men had "Muslim names" and were working in groups.
# Should the section "''The Times'' investigation", subsection "Background" contain the following, with a reference to the same 2014 Times article?
#:The cases involved two or more men who had groomed young girls they had met on the street. Several cases resembled Rotherham, with girls being passed around groups. According to Norfolk, of the 56 perpetrators, 53 were Asian, with 50 of those having "Muslim names" and mostly Pakistani heritage - the other three were white.

[[User:Colgated|Colgated]] ([[User talk:Colgated|talk]]) 07:04, 22 February 2022 (UTC)}}

* Id: B1B9B43

{{rfcquote|text=
There have been two sections now discussing Shane's status in WWE and whether or not we should say he was fired after the 2022 Royal Rumble. These discussions do not appear to have reached a consensus nor a conclusion, and there seems to be a bit of a stalemate. As this is a [[WP:BLP]] I think we should formalise this discussion as an RfC and reach a definitive conclusion. 

I haven't participated in the discussions above and am presently undecided on the matter, so the very neutral question is, ''what should we write regarding Shane McMahon's status with WWE?''. ‚Äî '''[[User:Czello|<i style="color:#8000FF">Czello</i>]]''' 20:05, 23 February 2022 (UTC)}}

I want to establish a consensus regarding removing CorenSearchBot from tools section. The bot is no longer active, and it has last edited almost 6 years ago. === [[Talk:Temple (LDS Church)#rfc_0636E30|Talk:Temple (LDS Church)]] expired 2022-03-27 08:01 ===
* Id: 0636E30
* User: Cu√±ado
* Date: 2022-03-26 23:14:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1079481288|RELI 1079481288}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1079529583|RELI 1079529583}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
{{requested move/dated|answered=yes
|current1=Chicago Illinois Temple|new1=Chicago Mormon Temple|current2=Logan Utah Temple|new2=Logan Mormon Temple|}}

* [[:Chicago Illinois Temple]] ‚Üí {{no redirect|Chicago Mormon Temple}}
* [[:Logan Utah Temple]] ‚Üí {{no redirect|Logan Mormon Temple}}
‚Äì There are at least 265 LDS temples listed at [[List of temples of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints]]. They all use the same naming convention of <city> <state or country> Temple. They all fail [[WP:PRECISION]]. The titles need something to distinguish what kind of temple they are. See for example the disambiguation page [[Chicago temple]] and the various types of temples in that city. Each one has an unambiguous title, but the [[Chicago Illinois Temple]] seems to only lack disambiguation because someone chose to include the state in the title. 
The acceptable options I see are [[Chicago Illinois Mormon Temple]], [[Chicago Mormon Temple]], [[Chicago Illinois LDS Temple]], or [[Chicago LDS Temple]]. If there is an agreement on format, this needs to be applied across hundreds of articles. [[User:Cu√±ado|<b style="color:#AF7817">Cu√±ado</b>]] ‚òº - [[User talk:Cu√±ado|<span style="font-size:x-small">Talk</span>]] 23:14, 26 March 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Record charts#rfc_F7F44F4|Wikipedia talk:Record charts]] expired 2022-03-28 18:01 ===
* Id: F7F44F4
* User: Ojorojo
* Date: 2022-02-26 17:57:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1074150826|MEDIA 1074150826}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1074150833|POLICY 1074150833}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1079801760|MEDIA 1079801760}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1079801770|POLICY 1079801770}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should ''[[New Zealand Listener]]'' record charts from 1966 to 1975 be considered suitable for inclusion in WP articles? The relevant guideline and ''Listener'' info is highlighted in green:

[[:WP:CHARTS#Suitable charts]] includes:
{{Blockquote|A chart is normally considered suitable for inclusion if it meets all of the following characteristics:
#It is published by a recognized reliable source. This includes any IFPI affiliate, ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' magazine, or any organization with the support of [[Nielsen SoundScan]]. Recognized national measurement firms, such as [[Crowley Broadcast Analysis]] for Brazil or [[Monitor Latino]] for Latin America, are legitimate sources of charts.
#{{tq|It covers sales or broadcast outlets from multiple sources.}}
#It is static, that is, the data in the chart cannot change. This excludes dynamic "all-time" charts, such as the ones published by Hung Medien.}}

The ''Listener'' info page includes:[http://www.flavourofnz.co.nz/index.php?qpageID=NZ%20listener%20charts%20more#n_view_location]
{{Blockquote|Between 1961 and 1975, there were (to my knowledge) no sales-based music charts in New Zealand. In an attempt to depict what pop music was in vogue in NZ in the period 1966 to 1975, I have used the weekly music charts published in the NZ Listener.<br>{{tq|These weekly charts were compiled from voting coupons sent in by readers of the NZ Listener. Only Listener readers would vote.}} The charts underwent a few name changes during this decade, but were always published weekly in the Listener.}}
Please indicate '''Include''', '''Don't include''', or '''Comment''' along with your comments. ‚Äî[[User:Ojorojo|Ojorojo]] ([[User talk:Ojorojo|talk]]) 17:57, 26 February 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Flag of Alabama#rfc_7D20A47|Talk:Flag of Alabama]] expired 2022-03-29 01:01 ===
* Id: 7D20A47
* User: Desertambition
* Date: 2022-03-26 21:46:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1079456276|HIST 1079456276}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1079456283|POL 1079456283}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1079862404|HIST 1079862404}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1079862408|POL 1079862408}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the [[MOS:LEAD]] say that the [[flag of Alabama]] is based on the [[Confederate battle flag]]?

'''A''': Yes, there is a general consensus among reliable sources that the state flag of Alabama is based on the Confederate battle flag and therefore this should be included in the lead.

'''B''': No, there is disagreement over the origins of the state flag among reliable sources and therefore no mention of claimed Confederate (or Spanish, or other) origins or symbolism should be included in the lead
:'''(i)''' and neither should the fact that there is disagreement.
:'''(ii)''' although the fact that there is disagreement should be mentioned.
'''C''': No, the state flag is based on the Spanish colonial flag; and therefore this Spanish origin should be included in the lead instead.

[[User:Desertambition|Desertambition]] ([[User talk:Desertambition|talk]]) 21:46, 26 March 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Mammals#rfc_070F51A|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Mammals]] expired 2022-03-29 20:01 ===
* Id: 070F51A
* User: Kaldari
* Date: 2022-02-27 19:47:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1074347475|SCI 1074347475}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1080001534|SCI 1080001534}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This RFC affects the following articles: [[cattle]], [[aurochs]], [[taurine cattle]], [[zebu]], ''[[Bos]]''.

Currently, these articles show contradictory and inconsistant information about the taxonomy of cattle. This is due to the fact that the different types of cattle were recently re-established as separate species after previously being considered sub-species of a single species. Both taxonomies are contentious and neither is universally accepted by reliable sources. Wikipedia, however, needs to choose one or the other and implement it consistantly. Please indicate which taxonomy you believe Wikipedia should follow:

'''Taxonomy A'''<br>
According to MSW3, the taxonomy of cattle is:[http://www.departments.bucknell.edu/biology/resources/msw3/browse.asp?id=14200687]

*''Bos taurus'' (domestic cattle)
*''Bos taurus taurus'' (taurine cattle)
*''Bos taurus indicus'' (zebu)
*''Bos taurus primigenius'' (aurochs, the undomesticated ancestor)
In this case, the [[cattle]] article would correspond with the taxon ''Bos taurus''.

'''Taxonomy B'''<br>
According to Mammal Diversity Database, the taxonomy of cattle is:[https://www.mammaldiversity.org/taxa.html]

*''Bos taurus'' (taurine cattle)
*''Bos indicus'' (zebu)
*''Bos primigenius'' (aurochs, the undomesticated ancestor)
In this case, the [[cattle]] article would correspond with the subgenus ''Bos'' (not to be confused with the genus ''[[Bos]]'').

<small>''This RFC does not affect the classication of Bison and does not serve as a referendum on the overall use of MDD or MSW3 on Wikipedia. It's scope is limited to domestic cattle and aurochs.''</small><br>
[[User:Kaldari|Kaldari]] ([[User talk:Kaldari|talk]]) 19:47, 27 February 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Layout#rfc_A80A104|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Layout]] expired 2022-03-30 03:01 ===
* Id: A80A104
* User: Novem Linguae
* Date: 2022-02-28 02:37:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1074405928|STYLE 1074405928}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1074405929|POLICY 1074405929}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1080060548|STYLE 1080060548}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1080060551|POLICY 1080060551}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The maintenance templates {{t|Improve categories}} and {{t|Uncategorized}} are unique because their documentation pages state they are allowed to be placed at the bottom of articles. Should {{t|Improve categories}} and {{t|Uncategorized}} be included in [[MOS:ORDER]]? If so, where?
*'''Option A'''. Do not include either.
*'''Option B'''. Include only {{t|Improve categories}}. Include it second to last (below "Categories")
*'''Option C'''. Include only {{t|Improve categories}}. Include it last (below "Stub templates")
*'''Option D'''. Include {{t|Improve categories}} and {{t|Uncategorized}}. Include them second to last.
*'''Option E'''. Include {{t|Improve categories}} and {{t|Uncategorized}}. Include them last.
*'''Option F'''. Include {{t|Improve categories}} and {{t|Uncategorized}}. Include them second to last, with a note stating "(These can alternatively be placed with other maintenance templates before the article content)" as [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Layout&oldid=1074436478 here]
‚Äì[[User:Novem Linguae|<span style="color:limegreen">'''Novem Linguae'''</span>]] <small>([[User talk:Novem Linguae|talk]])</small> 02:37, 28 February 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Non-free content#rfc_5C435D6|Wikipedia talk:Non-free content]] expired 2022-04-02 00:01 ===

=== [[Talk:Nicki Minaj#rfc_131C770|Talk:Nicki Minaj]] expired 2022-04-03 08:01 ===
* Id: 131C770
* User: Cornerstonepicker
* Date: 2022-03-04 07:56:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1075165954|BIO 1075165954}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1075165955|MEDIA 1075165955}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1080757922|BIO 1080757922}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1080757927|MEDIA 1080757927}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
(RFC per [[Talk:Nicki_Minaj#Discussion|previous discussion]])

In the opening sentence of the lead section, it is claimed that the subject is known "{{tq|for her lyricism}}". However, not a single reliable source has stated that lyricism is what she is known for. Artists may stand out for their song lyrics (which is not the same as lyricism), but there isn't any important difference to push that here. Some sources may mention it as an ability, describing it with an adjective, or what a group of fans think, but others also mention is has been overshadowed by other aspects of her or her music.[https://www.standard.co.uk/culture/music/nicki-minaj-best-lyrics-verses-songs-features-queen-album-release-a3908781.html] It is a strong claim for an opening sentence that is only found in this Wiki; the word should be removed to avoid pushing minority pov and wp:synt. 

These are examples of sources stating someone is actually known for their lyricism:

*[https://www.complex.com/music/2019/08/rapsody-says-jay-z-nfl-partnership-isnt-about-colin-kaepernick Complex] Rapsody is known for her lyricism..
*[https://www.pastemagazine.com/music/noname/noname-single-rainforest/ Paste] Noname, known for her lyricism..
*[https://www.huffpost.com/entry/kendrick-lamar-versus-j-coledo-i-have-to-choose_b_5908a1b8e4b084f59b49fce0 HP] J Cole, although Kendrick is also known for his lyricism
*[https://www.indulgexpress.com/culture/music/2017/nov/15/watch-two-musicians-use-actual-heartbeats-to-compose-a-song-4747.html Indian Express] Brodha V Known for his lyricism.
*[https://www.billboard.com/music/rb-hip-hop/kendrick-lamar-songs-best-hits-list-8097320/ Billboard] Kendrick.. lyrical acclaim.
*[https://www.sun-sentinel.com/news/fl-xpm-2006-12-01-0611290629-story.html Sentinel] Jay known for his lyrical

[[User:Cornerstonepicker|Cornerstonepicker]] ([[User talk:Cornerstonepicker|talk]]) 07:56, 4 March 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Flavan-3-ol#rfc_0245A16|Talk:Flavan-3-ol]] expired 2022-04-03 23:01 ===
* Id: 0245A16
* User: Ggux
* Date: 2022-04-03 21:57:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1080858908|ECON 1080858908}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1080865513|ECON 1080865513}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There are two aspects of the article, Zefr and I cannot agree on:
* Scientific consensus suggests that the primary mode of action of flavan-3-ols is via improving vascular function - that is stated in reference 13. They should therefore be included in the text at least as prominent as the effect on blood lipids.
* Flavan-3-ols have been investigated in a large (n=20,000 subjects, 3.5 yr) clinical trial and shown to have a beneficial effect on cardiovascular-diseases. While this is primary research, it is a large study that provides considerably more evidence for a potential health effect than all other cited evidence as it uses hard endpoints. I therefore belief it has sufficient relevance to be at least mentioned.
[[User:Ggux|Ggux]] ([[User talk:Ggux|talk]]) 21:57, 3 April 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Russian-occupied territories#rfc_957A377|Talk:Russian-occupied territories]] expired 2022-04-05 08:01 ===
* Id: 957A377
* User: CentreLeftRight
* Date: 2022-04-04 22:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1081038357|POL 1081038357}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1081092490|POL 1081092490}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Can we get a consensus on the purpose and scope of this article? Is this article a list of
# All territories considered by another country to be "occupied" by Russia, or
# All territories considered by the United Nations and several UN countries to be ''militarily'' occupied by Russia?

The first sentence of this article is "Russian-occupied territories include ''the lands outside of Russia's internationally recognized borders which have been designated by the United Nations and most of the international community as under a Russian military occupation''." (emphasis mine) This wording implies the latter categorisation, but the [[Kuril Islands dispute]] between Russia and Japan does not fit that criteria (evidenced by the sources given), nor do the territorial disputes between Estonia and Russia as discussed above; they do, however, fit the former categorisation.

'''TL;DR:''' The purpose and scope of this article is unclear because some of the article's content contradicts the lead. In particular, the example of the Kuril Islands dispute between Russia and Japan contradicts the criteria set out in the first sentence of the article. '''Thus, should the content in this article meet the criteria outlined in 1. or 2.?''' [[User:CentreLeftRight|<span style="font-family:ar julian; color:#E06666">Centre</span><span style="font-family:ar julian; color:#F4A460">Left</span><span style="font-family:ar julian; color:#6495ED">Right</span>]] [[User talk:CentreLeftRight|‚úâ]] 22:05, 4 April 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Bauhaus (band)#rfc_264760B|Talk:Bauhaus (band)]] expired 2022-04-06 05:01 ===
* Id: 264760B
* User: Woovee
* Date: 2022-03-07 04:54:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1075693674|MEDIA 1075693674}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1081235939|MEDIA 1081235939}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which version should we use ?

Version 1 : 
{{xt|<br />Peter Murphy said he felt their contemporaries had a larger hand in solidifying what became goth.[97] <br />Likewise, Kevin Haskins felt that other bands were more influential to goth subculture than themselves and mentioned that Bauhaus were "...more three dimensional, more art rock".[98]}} 

or

Version 2 :
{{xt|<br />Peter Murphy said he felt contemporary bands like the Cure had a larger hand in solidifying what became goth [97] <br />Likewise, Kevin Haskins felt that bands such as Siouxsie and the Banshees were more influential to goth subculture than themselves and mentioned that Bauhaus were "...more three dimensional, more art rock".[98]}}

Referring to the footnotes of references 97 and 98 which both include the entire quotes of the musicians, inside the brackets: 

[97] : "[Peter Murphy:] We were more aligned to The Clash than anything else that was going around. The Cure and those people really solidified what became goth, I suppose".

[98] : "[Kevin Haskins:] I‚Äôve always felt though that Siouxsie and the Banshees, who came before us, were more of an influence on the Goth movement. We chose to wear black, and our first single was vampire themed and the press tagged us. I can relate to it to a certain degree, but I feel that Bauhaus were more three dimensional, more art rock". [[User:Woovee|Woovee]] ([[User talk:Woovee|talk]]) 04:54, 7 March 2022 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1081271490|POL 1081271490}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I think it is dangerous and irresponsible to claim in an authorial voice that the Azov Battalion is a neo-Nazi group. Azov representatives have publicly stated on multiple occasions that they are not a neo-Nazi group and reliable sources back this up.<ref>https://www.ft.com/content/7191ec30-9677-423d-873c-e72b64725c2d</ref><ref>https://www.bbc.com/news/av/world-europe-60853404</ref><ref>https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2022/04/06/ukraine-military-right-wing-militias/?utm_source=dlvr.it&utm_medium=%5Btwitter%5D&utm_campaign=%5Brogue_corq%5D</ref> Russia is committing genocide in the Ukraine right now based on false claims that Ukraine is a neo-Nazi country.<ref>https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2022/04/05/russia-is-committing-genocide-in-ukraine/</ref><ref>https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/ukraine-bucha-war-crimes-genocide-b2050897.html</ref> Russia uses the word Nazi to mean "doesn't want to be part of Russia."<ref>https://ukrainianpost.com/opinions/272-what-should-russia-do-with-ukraine?fbclid=IwAR1qyK87g-SEqf36HSqDFHVAVZjT03DKpp490jEOjKUDbHc_PXnm2lT9R8I</ref> I think that in this situation it might be important to avoid authorial-voiced claims that support the propaganda of a country currently committing genocide based on that propaganda.<ref>https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2022/04/05/russia-is-committing-genocide-in-ukraine/</ref><ref>https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/ukraine-bucha-war-crimes-genocide-b2050897.html</ref>
:Please read [[WP:RFCNEUTRAL]] and try again. [[User:BSMRD|BSMRD]] ([[User talk:BSMRD|talk]]) 05:50, 6 April 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Did you know#rfc_A364C37|Wikipedia talk:Did you know]] expired 2022-04-08 22:01 ===
* Id: A364C37
* User: Venkat TL
* Date: 2022-04-08 08:30:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1081577265|PROP 1081577265}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1081669741|PROP 1081669741}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should users without successful DYK Nominations be asked to judge other DYK Nominations?<br>
Until now, users who submitted DYK nominations were asked to judge a DYK Nomination '''if''' the nominator had 5 or more 'successful DYK Credits' (aka 'DYK credits' checked using [https://betacommand-dev.toolforge.org/cgi-bin/dyk.py this tool]). A proposal to change this rule was made on 4 April at [[#QPQ freebies]], where it was proposed that users with 5 or more DYK nominations (Successful or unsuccessful or pending) be asked to start judging DYK noms that others have filed. This RfC is to ratify [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia%3ADid_you_know&type=revision&diff=1081556143&oldid=1072019505&diffmode=source this change]. This proposal, if approved will demand users with 5 unsuccessful nominations, to start judging DYK nominations. Asking people with failed nominations to judge is a major change in [[WP:DYKRULES]] and deserves wider community consensus before implementation. 

'''Currently being followed''' 
:  Review requirement (QPQ) ‚Äì For every nomination you make you must review one other nomination (unrelated to you){{mdashb}}this is called ''[[quid pro quo]]'' or QPQ. The review must address all five criteria listed here.<br />''Exception:'' If, at the time a nomination is promoted to the main page, its nominator has fewer than five <u>[[Wikipedia:List of Wikipedians by number of DYKs|DYK credits]]</u> (whether or not self-nominated) then the nominator is exempt from QPQ.
'''Proposed changes'''
:''Exception:'' If <u> you have previously nominated fewer than five articles</u> (whether self-nominated or otherwise), no QPQ is required. [[User:Venkat TL|Venkat TL]] ([[User talk:Venkat TL|talk]]) 08:30, 8 April 2022 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the lead of the article [[Kosovo]] say:
:'''A:''' Kosovo "is bordered by the uncontested part of the territory of Serbia to the north and east ..."
:'''B:''' Kosovo "is bordered by Serbia to the north and east ..."
:'''C:''' Kosovo "is bordered by [[Central Serbia]] to the north and east ..."
:'''D:''' Kosovo "is bordered by (the rest of) Serbia to the north and east ..."
RFC posted 19:00, 14 March 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Ferdinand Marcos#rfc_CA78B9E|Talk:Ferdinand Marcos]] expired 2022-04-14 15:01 ===
* Id: CA78B9E
* User: Jay.zero21 9911
* Date: 2022-03-15 14:42:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1077287564|BIO 1077287564}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1082697360|BIO 1082697360}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Ferdinand Marcos is a controversial figure, recently there's been disagreement whether or not to use the term "kleptocrat" in the opening paragraph of this article, especially in a first-person tone. I find it disconcerting that other figures who can be compared to Marcos as similar such as Suharto has no mention of "kleptocrat" in any part of the article. Other figures in listed in the example section of the Kleptocracy wiki ([[Kleptocracy#Examples]]) has little or no mention of the term "kleptocrat" in their respective wikis as such I find this wiki odd. Another point I have raised is the term has become a pejorative in common parlance and I have discouraged its use when there are neutral alternatives of the term and I find its use in an encyclopedia unsuitable.

See section [[Talk:Ferdinand Marcos#Consistency with Wikipedia's use of the term "kleptocrat"]] for reference for the current discussion on the issue: Consistency with Wikipedia's use of the term "kleptocrat" [[User:Jay.zero21 9911|Jay.zero21 9911]] ([[User talk:Jay.zero21 9911|talk]]) 14:42, 15 March 2022 (UTC)}}

* '''Case-by-case'''
* Something else?

In other words, which does best at satisfying [[WP:NFCC]]?

=== [[Talk:List of countries and dependencies by population#rfc_6132892|Talk:List of countries and dependencies by population]] expired 2022-04-15 06:01 ===
* Id: 6132892
* User: ·ûñ·üí·ûö·üá·ûò·û†·û∂·ûÄ·üí·ûü·ûè·üí·ûö·ûö·û∂·ûá
* Date: 2022-04-04 02:55:00

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1080899443|HIST 1080899443}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1082804224|HIST 1082804224}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
It appears there's a problem with [[User:RayAdvait]]. This editor has started to edit Wikipedia since March 27, and has made many edits in this article as well as in various "demographics" articles (such as [[Demographics of the United Kingdom]], [[Demographics of the United States]], etc) which appear unsubstantiated and/or unsourced. For example changing the population of the UK in this article, and replacing it with a "June 2021" figure coming from God knows where (the [[Office for National Statistics|ONS]] has not published mid-2021 population figures yet, they will do it only in September 2022), while not even bothering to change the source which still links to the mid-2020 population that this editor has now removed from the article and replaced with his "2021" figure: [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_countries_and_dependencies_by_population&diff=1079500922&oldid=1079434210]. Same at the [[Demographics of the United States]] article, lots of new figures without new sources (the editor left the sources unchanged, they still refer to the figures deleted by this user). I haven't checked all the changes yet, but it doesn't look good. [[User:·ûñ·üí·ûö·üá·ûò·û†·û∂·ûÄ·üí·ûü·ûè·üí·ûö·ûö·û∂·ûá|·ûñ·üí·ûö·üá·ûò·û†·û∂·ûÄ·üí·ûü·ûè·üí·ûö·ûö·û∂·ûá]] ([[User talk:·ûñ·üí·ûö·üá·ûò·û†·û∂·ûÄ·üí·ûü·ûè·üí·ûö·ûö·û∂·ûá|talk]]) 02:55, 4 April 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Infobox musical artist#rfc_774DBFD|Template talk:Infobox musical artist]] expired 2022-04-15 20:01 ===
* Id: 774DBFD
* User: ILIL
* Date: 2022-03-16 19:36:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1077527716|BIO 1077527716}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1077527722|MEDIA 1077527722}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1077527730|TECH 1077527730}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1082902685|BIO 1082902685}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1082902686|MEDIA 1082902686}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1082902692|TECH 1082902692}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Since it seems likely that {{para|associated_acts}} will soon be removed from this template ([[Template talk:Infobox musical artist#Remove associated acts?|see here]]), is it finally time to add {{para|spouse}} and {{para|partner}}? Upon a cursory search of the archives, it seems that we [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Template_talk:Infobox_musical_artist/Archive_11#Spouse,_partner,_and_children_support last had an RfC about this matter exactly 10 years ago, by which time the parameters had been requested over 23 times.] The requests have not stopped since then, and I've failed to uncover any new extended discussion regarding the matter.

There's many famous examples of musical acts with notable marriages/relationships to other notable individuals. In many of those examples, both individuals are often collaborators of each other. Just to name a few:
{{div col}}
* [[John Lennon]] and [[Yoko Ono]] ([[Plastic Ono Band]])
* [[Cher]] and [[Sonny Bono]] ([[Sonny & Cher]])
* '''[[Bruce Springsteen]]''' and [[Patti Scialfa]] ([[E Street Band]])
* '''[[Bob Marley|Bob]]''' and [[Rita Marley]] ([[Bob Marley and the Wailers|The Wailers]])
* [[Brian Wilson|Brian]] and [[Marilyn Wilson]] ([[The Honeys]], [[American Spring]])
* [[Paul McCartney|Paul]] and [[Linda McCartney]] ([[Wings (band)|Wings]])
* [[Phil Spector|Phil]] and '''[[Ronnie Spector]]''' ([[The Ronettes]])
* '''[[Tatsuro Yamashita]]''' and '''[[Mariya Takeuchi]]'''
* [[David Bowie|David]] and [[Angie Bowie]]
* '''[[David Gilmour]]''' and [[Polly Samson]]
* [[Loudon Wainwright III]] and [[Kate McGarrigle]]
* [[Paddy McAloon]] and [[Wendy Smith (singer)|Wendy Smith]] ([[Prefab Sprout]])
{{div col end}}
'''Bold''' denotes that the article currently combines {{t|Infobox musical artist}} with {{t|Infobox person}} to forcibly apply the parameters in question. Some of the other articles do this as well, but either to add {{para|children}}, or because the individual is also notable for non-musical pursuits. [[User:ILIL|ili]] ([[User talk:ILIL|talk]]) 19:36, 16 March 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Patrisse Cullors#rfc_D5AECA0|Talk:Patrisse Cullors]] expired 2022-04-17 23:01 ===
* Id: D5AECA0
* User: 108.34.231.7
* Date: 2022-04-17 19:53:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1083231826|BIO 1083231826}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1083231835|SOC 1083231835}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1083257227|BIO 1083257227}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1083257232|SOC 1083257232}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In the past week new documents concerning allegations of misused nonprofit funds have been published and reported by NY Mag, Snopes, Jezebel, The Independent, and other RS. Many other non-RS have picked up on this. The culprit, from the documents unearthed, is Mrs. Patrisse Cullors and she is being directly accused as the beneficiary of over $6 million dollar homes with misused BLM funds. After a request for protection on this page was granted, [[user:Slatersteven|Slatersteven]] and [[user:FDW777|FDW777]], two editors who collaborate together frequently as seen by visiting FDW777's talk page, have refused to add any of these RS sources. FDW777 going so far as accusing all these RS of orchestrating a smear campaign and only referring to year-old articles from these same sources to argue for non-inclusion. After requesting an outsider to take a look at this, Slatersteven directed me to the Admin's noticeboard and told me not to post anything there in what could be (mis)understood as a menacing tone. I would humbly request to community to read this Talk Page recent issues and chime in. [[Special:Contributions/108.34.231.7|108.34.231.7]] ([[User talk:108.34.231.7|talk]]) 19:53, 17 April 2022 (UTC)}}

[[:Cithara]] ‚Üí ? ‚Äì What latinization should be primarily used for the ancient Greek seven-stringed professional version of the lyre:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the following statement be included in Rick Caruso's article:

In 2016, according to multiple sources, a YouTube video of white [[Brentwood School (Los Angeles)|Brentwood School]] students chanting rap lyrics with racial slurs aboard Caruso's $100&nbsp;million [[yacht]], Invictus,<ref name="Invictus">[https://www.superyachtfan.com/yacht-invictus.html Invictus] at Super Yacht Fan.com</ref> went viral, prompting an investigation from the school, and condemnation from celebrities including [[Major League Baseball]] player [[Barry Bonds]].<ref name="BRENTWOOD SCHOOL INVESTIGATING RAUCOUS PARTY ABOARD RICK CARUSO'S BOAT">{{cite news |last1=Aron |first1=Hillel |title=BRENTWOOD SCHOOL INVESTIGATING RAUCOUS PARTY ABOARD RICK CARUSO'S BOAT |url=https://www.laweekly.com/brentwood-school-investigating-raucous-party-aboard-rick-carusos-boat/ |agency=LAWeekly.com |date=24 May 2016}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web |last1=ABC Staff |title=Video of students rapping creates controversy at elite Brentwood school |url=https://abc7.com/rap-offensive-lyrics-profane-brentwood-school/1344541/}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web |last1=Kohli |first1=Sonali |title=White students rapping a racial slur stirs posh Brentwood School |url=https://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-brentwood-school-video-20160518-snap-story.html |publisher=Los Angeles Times}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web |last1=Williams |first1=Mary |title=Brentwood School's n-word problem: "Is this what $40k worth of private education gets you?" |url=https://www.salon.com/2016/05/19/brentwood_schools_n_word_problem_is_this_what_40k_worth_of_private_education_gets_you/ |publisher=Salon}}</ref>

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Weather#rfc_FE51D49|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Weather]] expired 2022-04-20 23:01 ===
* Id: FE51D49
* User: United States Man#top
* Date: 2022-04-12 22:47:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1082391147|SCI 1082391147}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1082391156|STYLE 1082391156}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1082391158|POLICY 1082391158}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1087515586|SCI 1087515586}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1087515598|STYLE 1087515598}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1087515601|POLICY 1087515601}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
An ongoing discussion as to whether bolding the descriptive article title of tornado outbreaks and winter storms is compliant with [[MOS:BOLDTITLE]] and [[WP:SBE]] requires comment from others. As it stands now, tornado outbreak articles typically have the event type followed by the date while and winter storm articles have the date preceding the event type: [[Tornado outbreak and floods of April 28 ‚Äì May 1, 2017]], [[Tornado outbreak of April 4‚Äì7, 2022]], [[January 14‚Äì17, 2022 North American winter storm]], or [[January 2022 North American blizzard]].
:Per WP:SBE, bolding these titles in the opening line "{{tq|gives undue weight to the chosen title, implying that it is an official term, commonly accepted name, or the only acceptable title; in actuality, it is just a description and the event or topic is given many different names in common usage.}}"
:Per MOS:BOLDTITLE, 
:{{tq|If an article's title is a formal or widely accepted name for the subject, display it in bold as early as possible in the first sentence.}}
:These titles are descriptive and not formal names.
:{{tq|Otherwise, include the title if it can be accommodated in a natural way.}}
:These titles require the whole sentence to be written around them, such as {{tq|The '''January 2022 North American blizzard''' was a powerful and disruptive [[blizzard]] that impacted the...}}. This would also fail MOS:BOLDTITLE.

Input from others is requested. [[User:United States Man|United States Man]] ([[User talk:United States Man#top|talk]]) 22:47, 12 April 2022 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Weather#rfc_95C238F|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Weather]] expired 2022-04-20 23:01 ===
* Id: 95C238F
* User: Hurricane Noah
* Date: 2022-03-21 22:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1078507694|SCI 1078507694}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1078507699|POLICY 1078507699}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1078507702|TECH 1078507702}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1083822052|SCI 1083822052}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1083822057|POLICY 1083822057}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1083822058|TECH 1083822058}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which color scheme is more accessible? Which color scheme balances accessibility and aesthetics?

The current colors have been used across weather for the past decade. I believe these colors are hard to distinguish between on track maps for the dots, particularly between the Category 1-4 range. There simply isn't enough contrast between the colors to tell them apart (C1 and C2, C2 and C3, C3 and C4). This has presented a challenge for me as a reader and editor with normal color vision and decent eyesight with glasses. I have to open the full resolution to tell the difference between the colors and even then it can be a challenge for some. This issue would be even worse for color-blind editors. We also have issues with the TS color and the timeline background for red color blindness (demonstrated in the above RfC). On the grounds of [[WP:ACCESS]], I am proposing a change to the below colors, which increases the contrast between the weather colors. Please place comments in the discussion section below.

As a compromise between keeping the old scale and improving for WP:ACCESS for color blind, I propose the following new scale. I would also like to make it very clear, '''Consensus was reached above to NOT have ANY links on colored backgrounds''' so the below colors only need to have AA contrast against black text. [[User:Hurricane Noah|<span style="white-space:nowrap;text-shadow:#009200 0.3em 0.4em 1.0em,#009200 -0.2em -0.2em 1.0em;color:#009200"><b>Noah</b></span>]]<sup>[[User talk:Hurricane Noah|<span style="color:#ff0000"><b>Talk</b></span>]]</sup> 22:08, 21 March 2022 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
Which option should be used to word the first bullet point in the discuss section?
*'''A''' - Original version. "If your bold edit was reverted, then do not re-revert to your version. If your reversion was reverted, then do not re-revert to your version."
*'''B''' - "Do not re-revert after somebody reverts your bold edit or revert."
*'''C''' -  "Do not re-revert to your preferred revision after somebody reverts you."
*'''D''' - Another option. Please specify exactly how you would like the text to be worded. [[Special:Contributions/2601:647:5800:1A1F:455:ADAB:CD27:8849|2601:647:5800:1A1F:455:ADAB:CD27:8849]] ([[User talk:2601:647:5800:1A1F:455:ADAB:CD27:8849|talk]]) 02:47, 22 March 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:VeraCrypt#rfc_CC6DA5C|Talk:VeraCrypt]] expired 2022-04-27 04:01 ===
* Id: CC6DA5C
* User: Chess
* Date: 2022-03-28 03:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1079693665|SCI 1079693665}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1079693667|POL 1079693667}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1084879916|SCI 1084879916}}
