=== [[Talk:American Revolutionary War#rfc_F38A22C|Talk:American Revolutionary War]] expired 2022-05-03 04:01 ===
* Id: F38A22C
* User: Gwillhickers 
* Date: 2022-04-19 22:27:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1083645506|HIST 1083645506}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1085915183|HIST 1085915183}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The issue of using the terms ''[[:mercenaries]]'' v ''[[:auxiliaries]]'' in reference to ''Hessian soldier'' has once again come to the ARW Talk page. To achieve a lasting neutrality it has been suggested that we remove all usages of both ''auxiliaries'' and ''mercenaries'', and just refer to the German soldiers as ''Hessian soldiers'' in a strictly neutral fashion. To help clarify matters we would include a footnote after the first usage of ''[[:Hessian (soldier)]]'' (see proposed footnote directly above) which simply points out that historians often use the two terms interchangeably, while others use either term and offer facts and ideas that lend support to both ''auxiliaries'' and ''mercenaries''. As this debate has occurred many times over the last several years, with no lasting agreement, it would seem this is the best way to put this issue to rest and come up with an article that doesn't leave half the readership disappointed or wondering about the integrity of WP editors.  -- [[User:Gwillhickers|''Gwillhickers'']] ([[User talk:Gwillhickers |talk]]) 22:27, 19 April 2022 (UTC)}}

She cited his provision of the Rose Scholarship as well as his coaching as instrumental in her success in [[Future Farmers of America]]. === [[Talk:Flavan-3-ol#rfc_BEC8A7E|Talk:Flavan-3-ol]] expired 2022-05-03 22:01 ===
* Id: BEC8A7E
* User: Ggux
* Date: 2022-04-03 21:57:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1080865515|SCI 1080865515}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1086050416|SCI 1086050416}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There are two aspects of the article, Zefr and I cannot agree on:
* Scientific consensus suggests that the primary mode of action of flavan-3-ols is via improving vascular function - that is stated in reference 13. They should therefore be included in the text at least as prominent as the effect on blood lipids.
* Flavan-3-ols have been investigated in a large (n=20,000 subjects, 3.5 yr) clinical trial and shown to have a beneficial effect on cardiovascular-diseases. While this is primary research, it is a large study that provides considerably more evidence for a potential health effect than all other cited evidence as it uses hard endpoints. I therefore belief it has sufficient relevance to be at least mentioned.
[[User:Ggux|Ggux]] ([[User talk:Ggux|talk]]) 21:57, 3 April 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Sports#rfc_48A10C1|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Sports]] expired 2022-05-05 20:01 ===
* Id: 48A10C1
* User: Ivan Milenin
* Date: 2022-05-03 04:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1085920699|POLICY 1085920699}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1085920700|PROP 1085920700}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1091094999|POLICY 1091094999}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1091095002|PROP 1091095002}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Do you agree or disagree with the proposal shown here for the notability criteria for association football (soccer)?{{ctop|Proposal}}
'''Significant coverage is likely to exist for association football (soccer) figures if they meet the following''':
*Have participated in a major senior level international competition (such as the FIFA World Cup with qualifiers, the continental championships with some qualifiers depending on which confederation, and the continental Nations Leagues), excluding friendlies
*Have participated in the playoff stages of major international club competitions (such as the UEFA Champions League, the UEFA Europa League, the Copa Libertadores or the Copa Sudamericana)
*Have participated in at least one of of the following leagues: Bundesliga (Germany), Premier League (England), La Liga (Spain), Serie A (Italy),  Ligue 1 (France), Major League Soccer (United States and Canada), Argentine Primera Divisi√≥n (Argentina), Campeonato Brasileiro S√©rie A (Brazil), and other [[Wikipedia:Notability (sports)/Association football#Proposed leagues that are deemed notable|proposed leagues that are deemed notable]]
Players and/or managers who do not meet the above may still be notable, although sources should not be assumed to exist without further proof. A listing of other competitions wherein participation may lead to significant coverage is maintained by the WP:FOOTY wikiproject, at [link].
{{cbot|}}

[[User:Ivan Milenin|Ivan Milenin]] ([[User talk:Ivan Milenin|talk]]) 04:32, 3 May 2022 (UTC)}}

:*The new map is higher in resolution and is easier to edit in SVG format.

=== [[Talk:Hermann G√∂ring#rfc_7D96620|Talk:Hermann G√∂ring]] expired 2022-05-06 22:01 ===
* Id: 7D96620
* User: Gamle Kvitrafn
* Date: 2022-05-06 20:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1086548888|BIO 1086548888}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1086696812|HIST 1086696812}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1086696815|POL 1086696815}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1091702612|BIO 1091702612}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1091702613|HIST 1091702613}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1091702618|POL 1091702618}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hi, everyone. There was recently some discussion regarding the article's infobox pic. I missed the first round of talks, but I think that this is a pretty important (and sensitive) issue which should be discussed at greater length with more diverse input. I think that the picture, as is the case for every other Nazi military leader and war criminal on Wikipedia, should show him in military dress; not to glorify him, but to show how he looked while he was most influential. Thank you all! [[User:Gamle Kvitrafn|Gamle Kvitrafn]] ([[User talk:Gamle Kvitrafn|talk]]) 20:10, 6 May 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Charlie Moore (basketball)#rfc_FE6F465|Talk:Charlie Moore (basketball)]] expired 2022-05-07 05:01 ===
* Id: FE6F465
* User: TonyTheTiger
* Date: 2022-04-07 04:51:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1081391107|BIO 1081391107}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1081391112|SOC 1081391112}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1086600737|BIO 1086600737}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1086600739|SOC 1086600739}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I see a couple of sources that refer to [[Charlie Moore (basketball)]] as "Suitcase Charlie" in reference to him playing basketball for 4 different colleges.  One is  [https://chicago.suntimes.com/2021/4/26/22404713/depaul-charlie-moore-miami-college-transfer-rules-college-basketball one of his hometown newspapers]. The other is [https://www.si.com/college/cal/basketball/pac-12-transfers-moore-in-sweet-16 an article printed in the Sports Illustrated domain space that does not seem to really be an SI article referring to the former reference]. I don't see this nickname anywhere else but mirrors of these. Should it be in his biography?--[[User:TonyTheTiger|TonyTheTiger]] <small>([[User talk:TonyTheTiger|T]] / [[Special:Contributions/TonyTheTiger|C]] / [[WP:FOUR]] / [[WP:CHICAGO]] / [[WP:WAWARD]])</small> 04:51, 7 April 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Draft talk:David Firth (animator)#rfc_922FC25|Draft talk:David Firth (animator)]] expired 2022-05-07 16:01 ===
* Id: 922FC25
* User: Throast
* Date: 2022-05-06 17:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1086527697|BIO 1086527697}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1086663580|BIO 1086663580}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is disagreement about which [[MOS:ROLEBIO]] should be chosen for [[Draft:David Firth|David Firth]]. The term "animator" by itself is used by seven out of the thirteen sources currently used in the draft ([https://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&AN=505211778 ''Animation Magazine''], [https://www.dailydot.com/unclick/salad-fingers-new-episode-david-firth/ ''The Daily Dot''], [https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/tv/news/salad-fingers-new-episode-glass-brother-youtube-animation-david-firth-a8757791.html ''The Independent''], [https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-55497353 ''BBC''], [https://pitchfork.com/thepitch/flying-lotus-kuso-film-review/ ''Pitchfork''], [https://www.factmag.com/2016/10/27/flying-lotus-brainfeeder-films-london/ ''Fact Magazine''], [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AmeGJ0xWNbc ''BBC'']). The term "online animator" is used once ([https://spotlightmagazine.our.dmu.ac.uk/2021/03/30/where-comedy-meets-creepy-inside-the-mind-of-david-firth/ ''Spotlight'']). The term "independent animator" and "screenwriter" are used by zero sources currently used in the draft, and I can't find any other reliable sources that refer to him this way. [[User:Throast|Throast]] ([[User talk:Throast|talk]] &#124; [[Special:Contributions/Throast|contribs]]) 17:19, 6 May 2022 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
To meet the guideline of [[WP:TOOLONG]], I want to propose that the content from the formation of Greece in 1822 until the dissolution of the Ottoman Empire is made into a new article, [[Greece‚ÄìOttoman Empire relations]]. In effect, it uses the [[Treaty of Lausanne]] as the start of modern relations and where this article starts. The content removed will be summarised for the key points and referred to this new page. [[User:Eliasbizannes|Elias]] ([[User talk:Eliasbizannes|talk]]) 17:22, 6 May 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Orania, Northern Cape#rfc_88165F4|Talk:Orania, Northern Cape]] expired 2022-05-08 21:01 ===
* Id: 88165F4
* User: CaptainEek
* Date: 2022-04-08 20:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1081662821|HIST 1081662821}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1081662824|POL 1081662824}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1086865495|HIST 1086865495}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1086865499|POL 1086865499}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The first sentence of this article has been extensively fought over. This RfC aims to find a consensus and end the edit wars. What should fill the gap in {{tq|'''Orania''' (<small>Afrikaans pronunciation:</small> [[Help:IPA/Afrikaans|[ ä…ôÀàr…ëÀênia]]]) is . . . in [[South Africa]].}}?
*'''Option A''': {{tq|an all-white [[Afrikaner]]-only town}}
*'''Option B''': {{tq|a [[Racial segregation|white-Afrikaner-only]] town}}
*'''Option C''': {{tq|a [[Racial segregation|whites-only]] town}}
*'''Option D''': {{tq|an [[Racial segregation|Afrikaner-only]] town}}
*'''Option E''': {{tq|a [[White people|whites]]-only [[Afrikaner]]-only town}}
*'''Option F''': {{tq|a [[Racial segregation|racially segregated]] town}}
*'''Option G''': {{tq|a predominantly [[Afrikaner]] town}}
*'''Option H''': {{tq|an [[Afrikaner]] town}}
*'''Option I''': {{tq|a [[White people|white]] town}}
*'''Option J''': {{tq|a [[White people|whites]]-only town founded by [[Afrikaners]]}}
*'''Option K''': {{tq|a [[White_supremacy#White_separatism|white separatist]] town founded by [[Afrikaners]]}}
*'''Option L''': {{tq|a town founded by [[Afrikaners]]}}
*'''Option M''': {{tq|a town}}
Please no other options or suggestions, this summarizes months of disputes and possibilities. If listing multiple choices, please list your choices in order, but list no more than three. Smooth sailing, [[User:CaptainEek|<span style="color:#6a1f7f">'''CaptainEek'''</span>]] <sup>[[User talk:CaptainEek|<span style="font-size:82%"><span style="color:#a479e5">''Edits Ho Cap'n!''</span></span>]]</sup>[[Special:Contributions/CaptainEek|‚öì]] 20:33, 8 April 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:African wild dog#rfc_866A681|Talk:African wild dog]] expired 2022-05-09 10:01 ===
* Id: 866A681
* User: BrightOrion
* Date: 2022-04-09 09:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1081909011|SCI 1081909011}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1086943459|SCI 1086943459}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I would like to add a statement saying that African wild dogs cannot crossbreed with domestic dogs or wolves. I made this edit but (bringing in @[[User:Mariomassone|Mariomassone]]) someone reverted it saying "already implied in taxonomy". Wikipedia is not just for scientists and since the species is called African wild '''dog''' it isn't clear to the average reader whether or not it can crossbreed -- hence, adding such a statement would be helpful. Anyone else have any comments on this? If there are no more opinions, I'll look for [[Wikipedia:Third opinion]] [[User: BrightOrion|<b style="color:green">Bright</b><b style="color:blue">Orion</b>]] ([[User talk:BrightOrion|talk]]) 09:32, 9 April 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Lead section#rfc_D8663C2|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Lead section]] expired 2022-05-10 20:01 ===
* Id: D8663C2
* User: Mathglot
* Date: 2022-05-07 00:28:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1086577936|POLICY 1086577936}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1086756598|BIO 1086756598}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1087167560|BIO 1087167560}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1087167569|POLICY 1087167569}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In section [[Wikipedia_talk:Manual_of_Style/Lead_section#Citations|#Citations]] (shortcut [[MOS:LEADCITE]]), in the third paragraph (starting "Because the lead will usually repeat information.."), alter the last two sentences by removing text as follows:
: {{xt|The necessity for citations in a lead should be determined on a case-by-case basis <s>by editorial [[Wikipedia:Consensus|consensus]].</s> Complex, current, or controversial subjects may require many citations; others, few or none. <s>The presence of citations in the introduction is neither required in every article nor prohibited in any article.</s>}}

A vote to "Support", means, remove the text in <s>strikeout type</s> above from the third paragraph. <small>(boldly replaced lengthy, original Rfc statement on behalf of OP {{noping|2ple}} per multiple requests; [[User:Mathglot|Mathglot]] ([[User talk:Mathglot|talk]]) &#x31;&#x38;&colon;&#x30;&#x32;&#44; &#x37; May 2022 (U–¢–°))</small>

Do you think that [[MOS:CITELEAD]] should be changed to the text above, or a variation of it? [[User:2ple|2ple]] ([[User talk:2ple|talk]]) 00:28, 7 May 2022 (UTC)}}

* User: Bookworm857158367
* Date: 2022-05-10 20:54:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1087175139|LANG 1087175139}}
* RFC Text:

*See the above discussion for backgound. I want to add Mya as a spelling variant to the text of this article along with statistics from the Social Security Administration giving the popularity of this variant. I have provided citations in support of the name‚Äôs popularity and in support of it being a spelling variant, which [[User:JesseRafe]] has reverted. His main objection appears to be simply that he does not consider it worth adding and I made formatting errors, which I tried to correct but he claims show incompetence. The information is accurate, as are the references used. Any citation errors can be fixed. I would appreciate more people weighing in on this topic. [[User:Bookworm857158367|Bookworm857158367]] ([[User talk:Bookworm857158367|talk]]) 20:54, 10 May 2022 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Both me and one other editor have been in favor of this being hatnoted at the top ‚Äúnot to be confused with [[USAA]]‚Äù as a potential mistargeted search where ‚ÄúUSA‚Äù is typed.

One other editor has been opposed.

I would like to hear the perspective of other uninvolved editors + the greater outside WP community with regard to this.

See [[Wikipedia:Hatnote]] and [[Wikipedia:Hatnotes are cheap]] to assess it from the Wikipedia policy side and judge for yourself, and offer an informed statement based on that information.

* User: 0xDeadbeef
* Date: 2022-05-10 04:03:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1087073128|MEDIA 1087073128}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1087073132|POL 1087073132}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1087244122|POL 1087244122}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
How should CNN's potential political bias/positioning be covered?

# '''Do nothing'''. Article is fine as-is.
# '''Audience'''. We should acknowledge CNN's audience as mostly democrats, or that CNN appeals to a leftist audience.
# '''Bias'''. We should describe CNN as having a left-leaning or liberal bias.
# '''Other'''. Please comment below. [[User:0xDeadbeef|<span style="font-family:Fira Mono,Courier New,monospace">0x<span style="text-transform:uppercase">Deadbeef</span></span>]] <span style="font-family: serif">([[User talk:0xDeadbeef|T]] [[Special:Contributions/0xDeadbeef|C]])</span> 04:03, 10 May 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Taiwan#rfc_A4ED019|Talk:Taiwan]] expired 2022-05-14 09:01 ===
* Id: A4ED019
* User: 142.112.224.106
* Date: 2022-05-13 23:45:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1087692142|HIST 1087692142}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1087692147|POL 1087692147}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1087754002|HIST 1087754002}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1087754003|POL 1087754003}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I‚Äôm renewing a subject that [[User:Stephen Balaban]] began two years ago. Because Stephen had use the term ‚Äúcountry‚Äù, can we renew the debate whether it‚Äôs a ‚Äúcountry‚Äù, ‚Äústate‚Äù or ‚Äúpartially recognized state‚Äù? The term ‚Äúcountry‚Äù seems to be used by the [[Democratic Progressive Party]] and the [[Taiwan independence movement]], but I prefer ‚Äúpartially recognized state‚Äù to be more neutral because the Republic of China only controls Taiwan, Penghu and the two small islands of Fujian Province while claiming the territories controlled by the People's Republic of China.

On a contrary, the article‚Äôs name ‚ÄúTaiwan‚Äù is getting out of hand. Because Taiwan is the island controlled by the Republic of China, its status is still controversial since 1945 since that regime fled the mainland in 1949. There has been much debate and no consensus formed over whether to use the name of the article "Taiwan" or the "Republic of China" when referring to the ROC-controlled territories.

Sound off below.  -[[Special:Contributions/142.112.224.106|142.112.224.106]] ([[User talk:142.112.224.106|talk]]) 23:45, 13 May 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Music#rfc_1FDA811|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Music]] expired 2022-05-17 06:01 ===
* Id: 1FDA811
* User: ILIL
* Date: 2022-04-26 20:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1084827011|BIO 1084827011}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1084827014|MEDIA 1084827014}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1090007889|BIO 1090007889}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1090007892|MEDIA 1090007892}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This RfC is in response to [[Talk:Supertramp#English vs British|a recent edit war regarding Supertramp]], a band that formed in London and had a mix of English, Scottish, and American members. What default position should we take when a band is formed in one country, but contains members who are from elsewhere?
# Band nationality determined by '''place of formation''' ("Supertramp was an Englsh rock band formed in London [...]")
# Band nationality determined by '''nationalities of members''' ("Supertramp was an Anglo-American rock band formed in London [...]")
# as above, but limited to '''nationalities of core or founding members''' (in the Supertramp example, we would be accounting just [[Roger Hodgson]] and [[Rick Davies]], who are both English)
# Band nationality '''ignored''' ("Supertramp was a rock band formed in London [...]")

Some other bands to consider are [[the Velvet Underground]] (American, even though [[John Cale]] is Welsh), [[the Monkees]] (no nationality given), and [[Fleetwood Mac]] (British-American). [[User:ILIL|ili]] ([[User talk:ILIL|talk]]) 20:33, 26 April 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Music#rfc_0BB1953|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Music]] expired 2022-05-17 06:01 ===
* Id: 0BB1953
* User: X750
* Date: 2022-04-17 05:37:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1083128006|MEDIA 1083128006}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1083128012|TECH 1083128012}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1088291937|MEDIA 1088291937}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1088291941|TECH 1088291941}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
As the title of the section suggests, should navigational templates for bands, such as [[Template:Megadeth]] have items that do not have their own ''dedicated'' pages or are simply redirects to the respective artists' discography (such as) <nowiki>[[Deathstars#Discography|Decade of Debauchery]]</nowiki>? Obviously redlinks in navboxes are prohibited, but is it okay to include a non-wikilinked item? The subject of this is [[Template:Eisbrecher]], where I have attempted to add a compilation album (best hit album) section for their best hits album Ewiges Eis - 15 Jahre Eisbrecher, but it has been reverted by [[User:Jax 0677]], firstly under the grounds of WTAF, which is not valid since band members who do not have have their respective articles have remained (don't tell me notability reasons, Ewiges Eis charted on German charts) and previous albums that did not have articles (namely Schicksalsmelodien, which I created myself), remained intact. Following a short discussion which Jax has decided to ignore, citing BRD (how is this change even bold??), I have come to here to settle this. He has violated 3RR and I cannot be bothered reporting this to WP:AN/3RR. Interested to hear your thoughts [[User:X750|X-750]] <sub>[[User talk:X750|I've made a mistake, haven't I?]]</sub> 05:37, 17 April 2022 (UTC)}}

I am requesting an additional viewpoint in relation to this issue. Both involved parties (including myself) disagree as to the title of the article. While I don‚Äôt have the right to discuss the other parties reasons, my own reasoning is that Jat is the common name of the topic of discussion and that peripatetic refers to a number of groups that are not necessarily Jats hence I am of the opinion that the article name should be kept as is. Most sources including the Encyclopaedia Iranica article and Aparana Rao‚Äôs seminal work which I have referenced also use the term Jat.[[User:RuudVanClerk|RuudVanClerk]] ([[User talk:RuudVanClerk|talk]]) 12:40, 12 May 2022 (UTC)}}

* Date: 2022-04-25 22:21:00

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1084677619|POLICY 1084677619}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1089838685|POLICY 1089838685}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
What should be done with the bolded sentence, that is:

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Music#rfc_CDB485F|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Music]] expired 2022-05-26 21:01 ===
* Id: CDB485F
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1088967682|MEDIA 1088967682}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1093988965|MEDIA 1093988965}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
A

=== [[Wikipedia_talk:WikiProject_Music#RfC_on_whether_Navigational_templates_should_have_articles_that_do_not_have_their_own_dedicated_article,_or_are_a_redirect_to_their_artists_discography|recently closed RfC]] expired 2022-05-26 21:01 ===
* Id: 
* User: Chubbles
* Date: 2022-05-21 02:05:00
* RFC Text:
here at WikiProject Music established consensus that navboxes of musician articles should not include discographical entries (albums, songs) that do not have their own articles, as these are not navigable links and so are outside the functional purview of the navbox. It was pointed out in this discussion that many band/ensemble navboxes also include names of bandmembers, even when those bandmembers are not linked to their own independent articles, and [[WP:EXISTING]] currently has a single exception for bandmembers. (I was unable to find any discussion on the insertion of this guideline, only [[Wikipedia_talk:Navigation_template#Fourth_point_under_"Navigation_templates_provide_navigation_between_existing_articles"|this discussion challenging it in 2012]].) Should unlinked or redirect bandmembers be included in navboxes (keeping [[WP:EXISTING]] as is), or should the consensus on discographical materials be extended to cover bandmembers as well, and [[WP:EXISTING]] be updated? [[User:Chubbles|Chubbles]] ([[User talk:Chubbles|talk]]) 02:05, 21 May 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:People Before Profit#rfc_631FA2A|Talk:People Before Profit]] expired 2022-05-31 07:01 ===
* Id: 631FA2A
* User: CeltBrowne
* Date: 2022-05-01 06:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1085564862|POL 1085564862}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1090765022|POL 1090765022}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
How should the article describe the political ideology of [[People Before Profit]]?

* '''Option A:''' "People Before Profit '''''are''''' a Trotskyist political party"
* '''Option B:''' "People Before Profit are '''''generally considered''''' a Trotskyist political party"
* '''Option C:''' "People Before Profit are '''''sometimes described as''''' a Trotskyist political party"
* '''Option D:''' The article should not describe People Before Profit as a Trotskyist party
* '''Option E:''' The lead is kept neutral and not weighted in any particular direction or towards any one ideology and simply states "People Before Profit (Irish: Pobal Roimh Bhrab√∫s, PBP) is a political party formed in October 2005."

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_E4034FC|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2022-05-31 21:01 ===
* Id: E4034FC
* User: Szmenderowiecki
* Date: 2022-05-14 16:37:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1087806436|PROP 1087806436}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1092952714|PROP 1092952714}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should points 10 and 11 of [[:ru:–í–∏–∫–∏–ø–µ–¥–∏—è:–ö –ø–æ—Å—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤—É/–£–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω–∞|rules for mediation in Ukraine-related topics on Russian Wikipedia]], as modified here, be implemented for the purposes of the 2022 invasion of Ukraine?
*Do not use the mass media materials of outlets based physically or online in Russia, Belarus or Ukraine [RUBYUA] that appeared after the beginning of the Russian invasion of Ukraine to describe the invasion itself and related events. Some usages may be allowed if a ''specific edit request is made, only if independent secondary reliable coverage from outside these countries on the topic requested is unavailable, is published in what would otherwise be a generally reliable source at least two days after the event's occurrence (with the exception of official statements of government entities), and there is consensus to introduce it. In particular, avoid using sources liable to censorship by [[Roskomnadzor]].''
*The official statements of the sides shall be described according to independent, secondary, ''reliable'' sources ''[further mentioned as ISRS]'', limiting the scope of mentioning of the official position by the extent to which these positions are expounded on in these sources. Military advances should not be stated as fact unless confirmed by both sides of the conflict, either as separate statements as quoted in ISRSs, or by summary of the statements in ISRSs. All mentions of these positions shall be added with appropriate attribution, in a neutral form, without excessive citations and preserving due weight to them. The addition of the positions of the officials from one side that are not mentioned in ISRSs in order to balance the mentions of the positions of officials mentioned in ISRSs is forbidden, nor should independent assessments of ISRSs be balanced by the statements of officials denying said assessments. [[User:Szmenderowiecki|Szmenderowiecki]] ([[User talk:Szmenderowiecki|talk]]) 16:37, 14 May 2022 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:Hospitality Club#rfc_AD23F96|Talk:Hospitality Club]] expired 2022-06-01 15:02 ===
* Id: AD23F96
* User: Flexman
* Date: 2022-05-02 14:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1085805907|SOC 1085805907}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1086153799|POLICY 1086153799}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1090987604|SOC 1090987604}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1090987606|POLICY 1090987606}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The problem is that Hospitality Club does not really work anymore. But there hasn't been any official statment, because the creator(s) of the project just abandoned it. So, no one takes care about the portal anymore, since February 2021 the login did not work anymore, and since April 2022 the page is even offline. The service already lost its popularity in the years before, and there is no media coverage anymore. The result is, that there is no undisputed source which we could use for citation. I did add the information that the service is not functional anymore and used the [[Wayback Machine]] and some Uptime-Portal for citation, but this was considered as [[WP:OR]]. Otherwise the initiation was changed from "is" to "was" but without citation. So the question here is: Is it really [[WP:OR]], and if yes, will we find another way to get more specific about the current situation of the project, or won't we be able to do any updates unless some media will report about this? - [[User:Flexman|Flexman]] ([[User talk:Flexman|talk]]) 14:10, 2 May 2022 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1087194141|HIST 1087194141}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1087194144|POL 1087194144}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1087194147|RELI 1087194147}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1087194150|STYLE 1087194150}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1087194153|POLICY 1087194153}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1091510385|HIST 1091510385}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1091510390|POL 1091510390}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1091510392|RELI 1091510392}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1091510398|STYLE 1091510398}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
We need a ''whole'' bunch more eyes on this article, ''its framing'', and its intervention in other Wikipedia articles on this topic if any of y'all have better blood pressure medicine or deeper knowledge of this topic than I do. It may be fine that the current lede of [[settler colonialism]] involves accusations of genocide or that this title is completely differently formatted for every other section link coming off of [[settler colonialism]]. I really don't know and I do appreciate that the current editors on this new page have been formatting well and finding sources to build their page. An intro "graph" of exactly 4 data points seems like an excellent example of how lazy and partisan "sources" on this topic can be, however, and I'd be much more comfortable with wider community involvement from both sides plus plenty of neutrals.&nbsp;‚Äî&nbsp;[[User talk:LlywelynII|<span style="text-shadow:#BBBBBB 0.1em 0.1em 0.1em; class=texhtml">Llywelyn<span style="color: Gold;">II</span></span>]] 23:15, 10 May 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:United States#rfc_1CC6027|Talk:United States]] expired 2022-06-05 04:01 ===
* Id: 1CC6027

=== [[Talk:Ideological bias on Wikipedia#rfc_06349BA|Talk:Ideological bias on Wikipedia]] expired 2022-06-05 09:01 ===
* Id: 06349BA
* User: Endwise
* Date: 2022-05-06 08:37:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1086460906|BIO 1086460906}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1086460914|POL 1086460914}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1091609236|BIO 1091609236}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1091609240|POL 1091609240}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should Larry Sanger's criticisms of alleged ideological bias on Wikipedia be included in [[Ideological bias on Wikipedia#Claims of bias|Claims of bias section]]? Sources discussing Sanger's criticisms include [https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/larry-sanger-i-wouldnt-trust-wikipedia-and-i-helped-to-invent-it-cflrhmdhx The Times], [https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/wikipedia-founder-larry-sanger-democrats-b1885138.html The Independent], and [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-news/2021/07/16/wikipedia-dominated-left-wing-establishment-version-truth-co/ The Telegraph], among others. There has been discussion in the [[Talk:Ideological bias on Wikipedia#Larry Sanger's Criticism|above section]], at [[Wikipedia:Neutral point of view/Noticeboard#Ideological bias on Wikipedia and Larry Sanger|NPOVN]], and a [[Talk:Ideological bias on Wikipedia/Archive 3#RfC: Should Larry Sanger's views be included?|previous RfC]] on the matter. [[User:Endwise|Endwise]] ([[User talk:Endwise|talk]]) 08:37, 6 May 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:People's Mojahedin Organization of Iran#rfc_2D8BC86|Talk:People's Mojahedin Organization of Iran]] expired 2022-06-05 13:01 ===
* Id: 2D8BC86
* User: Fad Ariff
* Date: 2022-05-27 12:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1090109967|POL 1090109967}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1095115872|POL 1095115872}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the following paragraph be shortened and move some parts to more relevant sections?  

{{talkquote|According to a RAND Corporation policy report, while in Paris, Massoud Rajavi began to implement an "ideological revolution", which required members an increased study and devotion that later expanded into "near religious devotion to the Rajavis". After its settlement in Iraq, however, it experienced a shortfall of volunteers. This led to the recruitment of members including Iranian dissidents, as well as Iranian economic migrants in countries such as Turkey and the United Arab Emirates, through "false promises of employment, land, aid in applying for asylum in Western countries, and even marriage, to attract them to Iraq". MEK also gave free visit trips to its camps to the relatives of the members. According to the RAND report, the recruited members were mostly brought by MEK into Iraq illegally and then were asked to submit their identity documents for "safekeeping", an act which would "effectively trap" them. With the assistance of Saddam's government, MEK also recruited some of its members from the Iranian prisoners of the Iran-Iraq war.{{sfn|Goulka|Hansell|Wilke|Larson|2009|p=38}} During the second phase of [[#Ideological revolution and women's rights|the ideological revolution]], all members were forced to surrender their individuality to the organization.<ref name="Barker" />|}}

[[User:Fad Ariff|Fad Ariff]] ([[User talk:Fad Ariff|talk]]) 12:09, 27 May 2022 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:People's Mojahedin Organization of Iran#rfc_4ACC398|Talk:People's Mojahedin Organization of Iran]] expired 2022-06-05 13:01 ===
* Id: 4ACC398
* User: Fad Ariff
* Date: 2022-05-06 12:54:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1086488137|POL 1086488137}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1091636452|POL 1091636452}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
All of the active editors in this talk page seem to agree that the article needs shortening, and this RFC suggests shortening the section "Removal of designation".

To avoid confusion that we faced in some past discussions, this RFC consists of 3 separate sections:

1) '''Discussion'''

2) '''Shortening proposals'''

3) '''Votes: which proposal you support and why'''

Please add your comment, shortening proposal (if any), or vote in the relevant section. [[User:Fad Ariff|Fad Ariff]] ([[User talk:Fad Ariff|talk]]) 12:54, 6 May 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_30B8119|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2022-06-09 05:01 ===
* Id: 30B8119
* User: ‡≤Æ‡≤≤‡≥ç‡≤®‡≤æ‡≤°‡≤æ‡≤ö‡≥ç ‡≤ï‡≥ä‡≤Ç‡≤ï‡≥ç‡≤£‡≥ä
* Date: 2022-05-10 04:31:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1087073134|PROP 1087073134}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1092259252|PROP 1092259252}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should a bot be used to blank old IP talkpages which:
* Have not received any messages in the last 5 years
* The IP is not under active blocks (including range blocks)
* There have been no edits from the IP in the last 5 years
Pages that meet this criteria will be blanked and replaced with {{tl|Blanked IP talk}}, which reads
{{Blanked IP talk}}
‚Äî[[User:‡≤Æ‡≤≤‡≥ç‡≤®‡≤æ‡≤°‡≤æ‡≤ö‡≥ç ‡≤ï‡≥ä‡≤Ç‡≤ï‡≥ç‡≤£‡≥ä|‡≤Æ‡≤≤‡≥ç‡≤®‡≤æ‡≤°‡≤æ‡≤ö‡≥ç ‡≤ï‡≥ä‡≤Ç‡≤ï‡≥ç‡≤£‡≥ä]] ([[User talk:‡≤Æ‡≤≤‡≥ç‡≤®‡≤æ‡≤°‡≤æ‡≤ö‡≥ç ‡≤ï‡≥ä‡≤Ç‡≤ï‡≥ç‡≤£‡≥ä|talk]]) 04:31, 10 May 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Consensus#rfc_93554DD|Wikipedia talk:Consensus]] expired 2022-06-10 01:01 ===
* Id: 93554DD
* User: 2ple
* Date: 2022-05-11 00:45:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1087201637|POLICY 1087201637}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1092390280|POLICY 1092390280}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Consensus is Wikipedia's friend. It is the backbone of discussion and the statute which decides all that is done here. However, sometimes I feel it fails to accurately represent the problem at hand. There are certain situations in which stalemates should be enough to continue with the implementation of guidelines/policies (see [[WP:LEADCITE]]).

WP: STALEMATE would address two issues: the relatively minor issue of what to do when stalemate happens, and the controversial issue of what to do when consensus isn't needed to proceed (WP:MINORCONSENT?) I think there is a need for a policy such as this, as sometimes stalemate proves that a problem is important enough to be addressed. This would apply only to specific policies and guidelines, and consensus would take precedent in most cases. What do yall think? Is it serious enough to pursue? [[User:2ple|2ple]] ([[User talk:2ple|talk]]) 00:45, 11 May 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:1922 Women's World Games#rfc_BB67520|Talk:1922 Women's World Games]] expired 2022-06-10 09:01 ===
* Id: BB67520
* User: Ssu
* Date: 2022-05-11 08:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1087271589|SOC 1087271589}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1092441276|SOC 1092441276}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
When translating this article to no-wiki, and establishing the first biography articles there, I find some information that I can not fit into the en-wiki results. This article says that 4√ó110 yds relay was won by UK, with France second. [http://www.gbrathletics.com/ic/fsfi.htm GBR athletics] also says this. But, reading about [[Camille Sabie]], I find two sources stating that USA came second in a '440 yard relay'[https://keanathletics.com/honors/hall-of-fame/camille-sabie/7][https://www.njsportsheroes.com/camillesabietf.html]. Is there error in GBR Athletics' results page? The relays results in GBR Athletics are a bit odd, as France is written one time, covering two years. Also, [https://yadda.icm.edu.pl/yadda/element/bwmeta1.element.agro-7b17d67a-1295-402f-b071-7ad707908c36/c/59-73.pdf this article] states that two outside games competitions were held; 100-m sprint, and the 4√ó100 m relay. I assume that the 4x100 m here equals 4x110y in the results in the en-wiki article. Does this mean that the 4x110y was not a part of the World Games per se? Any thoughs? [[User:Ssu|Ssu]] ([[User talk:Ssu|talk]]) 08:22, 11 May 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Requests for comment#rfc_E530C1A|Wikipedia talk:Requests for comment]] expired 2022-06-10 17:01 ===
* Id: E530C1A
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1087303516|POLICY 1087303516}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1092492039|POLICY 1092492039}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In the attempt to create an RFC for the ultratouchy subject which is "[[Zionism as settler colonialism]]",

=== [[Talk:Zionism_as_settler_colonialism#RFC_for_"Zionism_as_settler_colonialism"|several of the active editors]] expired 2022-06-10 17:01 ===
* Id: 
* User: LlywelynII
* Date: 2022-05-11 16:09:00
* RFC Text:
attempted to vote to kill the RFC before it could go active or be noticed on (currently) mistaken procedural grounds. [[WP:RFC]] currently ''recommends'' using short clear questions and avoiding open ended requests but there's nothing about either being ''mandatory'' and the ending policies assume that conversation be allowed to procede until there's consensus that the issues raised have been adequately addressed. The posters above on the other hand truly believed that it was fine to shut off requests for discussion that weren't narrowly tailored to individual questions. (This would seem to require multiple RFCs for a single page when the issues to be addressed, as here, are wide ranging.)

#'''Does WP:RFC need to be rewritten to end all RFCs that are not phrased as short questions?'''
#'''Does it need to be rewritten to ban all open-ended requests for comment?''' or 
#'''Does it need to be rewritten to more clearly explain that RFCs can't be "voted closed" by the group happy with the current page?'''

To my mind, it's clear that more involvement is always helpful, especially on ultrasensitive subjects. I know more recent wikipedians are more generally in favor of tighter gatekeeping, but do the admins really want cliques of local editors shutting out open requests for outside voices? If some specific person is being unhelpful or disruptive, that can be pointed out separately. On the otherhand, {{sc|[[wp:ownership]]}} used to be viewed as a bad thing, which RFC was a tool to help address without brigading or building up teams of allies (which just repeats the same problem at a higher level).&nbsp;‚Äî&nbsp;[[User talk:LlywelynII|<span style="text-shadow:#BBBBBB 0.1em 0.1em 0.1em; class=texhtml">Llywelyn<span style="color: Gold;">II</span></span>]] 16:09, 11 May 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:PBS#rfc_D536BFE|Talk:PBS]] expired 2022-06-11 06:01 ===
* Id: D536BFE
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1092582170|MEDIA 1092582170}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Even though a recent RfC about

=== [[Talk:List_of_United_States_over-the-air_television_networks#RfC_about_PBS's_status,_not_just_as_a_US_TV_network,_but_as_a_major_US_TV_network|this very issue]] expired 2022-06-11 06:01 ===
* Id: 
* User: 2600:1700:C960:2270:FD70:5AC:B762:C849
* Date: 2022-06-11 05:01:00
* RFC Text:
fairly quickly reached community consensus in favor of viewing PBS as not only a US TV network, but as a major US TV network as well, when I attempted to edit the article to reflect that very same community consensus, I was told ''need WP:RS not comments''. So then, I proceeded to cite the website for the [[Corporation for Public Broadcasting]] (CPB), which actually states: ''PBS is a private, nonprofit media enterprise owned by its member public television stations''. The response for that edit was ''please.discuss such changes on the talk page, and get a consensus first''. So, in an effort to satisfy the two editors ({{ping|Johnuniq|BilCat}}) who refused to accept the prior established community  consensus & reliable source from CPB concerning PBS's status as not just a US TV network, but also as a major US TV network, I am opening this RfC. And, I would like to invite the editors ({{ping|SMcCandlish|Huggums537|Mrschimpf|NMasiha}}) who commented on that prior RfC to comment on this one. [[Special:Contributions/2600:1700:C960:2270:FD70:5AC:B762:C849|2600:1700:C960:2270:FD70:5AC:B762:C849]] ([[User talk:2600:1700:C960:2270:FD70:5AC:B762:C849|talk]]) 05:01, 11 June 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Political correctness#rfc_E634170|Talk:Political correctness]] expired 2022-06-11 13:01 ===
* Id: E634170
* User: 49.185.74.204

{{rfcquote|text=
Is this article's content written from a [[WP:NEUTRAL]] point-of-view?

=== [[Wikipedia talk:In the news#rfc_30895F0|Wikipedia talk:In the news]] expired 2022-06-11 14:01 ===
* Id: 30895F0
* User: WaltCip
* Date: 2022-05-26 14:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1089956235|STYLE 1089956235}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1092627665|STYLE 1092627665}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I propose henceforth that, in the event of a recent death where the name of the decedent is shared by that of another living person: 

* If there is the possibility for [[Wikipedia:SURPRISE|confusion]] as a result of the living person being immediately recognizable to the reader, or
* If the living person comes up on an initial Wikipedia search where the link to the decedent is only available through a disambiguator at the top of the article,

Then under these circumstances, it is desirable and recommended to include a parenthetical indicator of the decedent, so as to properly identify to the reader who the decedent is.--'''[[User:WaltCip|WaltCip]]'''-''<small>([[User talk:WaltCip|talk]])</small>'' 14:22, 26 May 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Flavan-3-ol#rfc_85C9956|Talk:Flavan-3-ol]] expired 2022-06-12 19:01 ===
* Id: 85C9956
* User: Ggux
* Date: 2022-05-14 17:58:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1087653401|SCI 1087653401}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1092960053|SCI 1092960053}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Flavan-3-ols have been investigated in a large (n=20,000 subjects, 3.5 yr) clinical trial ([[Women's Health Initiative#COcoa Supplement and Multivitamin Outcomes Study (COSMOS)]] and shown to have a beneficial effect on cardiovascular-disease risk. This is a single intervention study - but the largest ever undertaken in this field. The results of the study support the conclusions from previous systematic reviews on a much larger scale. Is mentioning this study (with a link to [[Women's Health Initiative#COcoa Supplement and Multivitamin Outcomes Study (COSMOS)]]) appropriate according to [[WP:MEDPRI]]?

The relevant section in my opinion is:

''Determining weight of studies requires reliable secondary sources (not press releases or newspaper articles based on such sources). If conclusions are worth mentioning (such as large randomized clinical trials with surprising results), they should be described appropriately as from a single study.''

[[User:Ggux|Ggux]] ([[User talk:Ggux|talk]]) 17:58, 14 May 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Scott Jensen (Minnesota politician)#rfc_8D64C83|Talk:Scott Jensen (Minnesota politician)]] expired 2022-06-12 21:01 ===
* Id: 8D64C83
* User: MNBug
* Date: 2022-05-18 03:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1088459517|BIO 1088459517}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1088459520|POL 1088459520}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1092824888|BIO 1092824888}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1092824890|POL 1092824890}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should ‚Äú[[On the Issues]]‚Äù by [[Snopes]] to add information in this article‚Äôs lead about the subjects political stances? On the Issues‚Äôs reports that Jensen is still a ‚Äúmoderate Republican‚Äù citing his provided stances from his gubernatorial campaign website among other things. While the only current listed source says he has left behind his moderate stance completely and has moved right. Should OTI‚Äôs take be reflected in the article? See the following options:

Option A (current):  
According to the Star Tribune, Jensen was regarded as a moderate and maverick during his term in the legislature, but his views have shifted to the right after leaving the legislature.

Option B (change with On The Issues source): Jensen has been regarded as a moderate and as a political maverick, especially during his tenure in the legislature, but media outlets, such as the Star Tribune, have noted that his views have shifted to the right since leaving the legislature.

Thanks‚Äî[[User:MNBug|MNBug]] ([[User talk:MNBug|talk]]) 03:26, 18 May 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Dalida#rfc_388EB6F|Talk:Dalida]] expired 2022-06-14 22:01 ===

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1088041789|BIO 1088041789}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1088041796|MEDIA 1088041796}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1093152241|MEDIA 1093152241}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should Dalida's Italian birth nationality be listed in the first paragraph along with her acquired French nationality? [[User:Binksternet|Binksternet]] ([[User talk:Binksternet|talk]]) 21:05, 15 May 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Writing about fiction#rfc_561911E|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Writing about fiction]] expired 2022-06-16 14:01 ===
* Id: 561911E
* User: Argento Surfer
* Date: 2022-05-17 13:31:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1088346859|MEDIA 1088346859}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1093419857|MEDIA 1093419857}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This has been discussed at [[WT:Comics]] many times ([[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Comics/Archive 50#Essex in X-Men: Apocalypse|one]], [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Comics/Archive 49#Non-appearances|two]] [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Comics/Archive 47#Name-drops in other media|three]], [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Comics/Archive 47#Easter eggs in The Amazing Spider-Man 2|four]], [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Comics#Doctor Octopus would have been...|five]]), and I'm putting this here to get more/outside perspectives.

Over the last three decades, there have been many superhero films. During development, many characters are considered for inclusion, but not used. Some planned films die in [[Development hell]]. Some characters are alluded to in the film, but not actually present. Examples for your consideration include [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Darkhawk&type=revision&diff=1084164838&oldid=1084161765 a director tweeting that a character was considered], [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mister_Sinister&type=revision&diff=721015456&oldid=720946867 an obvious Easter Egg], [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Zzzax&type=revision&diff=1083766849&oldid=1082059594 unfilmed scripts], and [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Beta_Ray_Bill&type=revision&diff=810510009&oldid=810449546 visual references to the character].

With every new film, there is a wave a editors wanting to add these non-appearances to character articles. There is a large volume of websites catering to fans, and reasonably-acceptable sources can usually be located to support any Easter Egg. The best-sourced material of this kind is often included in franchise articles like [[Spider-Man in film]], but those pages do not always exist.

:::'''Is it appropriate to include a fictional character's non-appearance in a film in the character's article?''' [[User:Argento Surfer|Argento Surfer]] ([[User talk:Argento Surfer|talk]]) 13:31, 17 May 2022 (UTC)}}

Muslim critics accuse it of promoting teachings that are not authentically Islamic."

=== [[Talk:List of coups and coup attempts#rfc_FE612F4|Talk:List of coups and coup attempts]] expired 2022-06-18 05:01 ===
* Id: FE612F4
* Date: 2022-06-18 00:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1093654818|HIST 1093654818}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1093654822|POL 1093654822}}
* RFC Text:

Editing this list gets more complicated if we want to include not just verified coups and coup attempts, but also well-sourced allegations that such incidents have occurred (like [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_coups_and_coup_attempts&oldid=1093238216#Claimed_coups_and_coup_attempts_since_1950 these claims]).  If such alleged incidents are included in this list, then we could (1) amend the lead to unambiguously explain the list criteria so readers will understand that some of the listed items are only alleged incidents, and/or (2) put alleged incidents into a separate chronological section with an appropriate header instead of mixing them in with the verified incidents. '''So the RFC question is this: shall we omit from this list [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_coups_and_coup_attempts&oldid=1093238216#Claimed_coups_and_coup_attempts_since_1950 all unverified incidents] whenever step (1) or step (2) is not implemented?'''00:09, 18 June 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Aleksandr Dvornikov#rfc_5EA803A|Talk:Aleksandr Dvornikov]] expired 2022-06-18 11:01 ===
* Id: 5EA803A
* User: Shimbo
* Date: 2022-05-19 10:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1088655071|POL 1088655071}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1093712154|POL 1093712154}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
A dispute has arisen about whether General Dvornikov's nickname as 'The Butcher of Syria' should be included in this article or not. Opinion in favour is based on the fact that he is referred to using that nickname in multiple reliable sources. Opinion against is based on the sources being biased and the nickname originating with a retired US admiral whose opinion may not be definitive. --[[User:Shimbo|Shimbo]] ([[User talk:Shimbo|talk]]) 10:50, 19 May 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Walt Disney#rfc_82E8B0D|Talk:Walt Disney]] expired 2022-07-03 18:01 ===
* Id: 82E8B0D
* User: Titi68999
* Date: 2022-06-03 17:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1091340687|BIO 1091340687}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1091340691|HIST 1091340691}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1091340697|POL 1091340697}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1096316475|BIO 1096316475}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1096316479|HIST 1096316479}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1096316482|POL 1096316482}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should Disney's political affiliations be included in the infobox? The section "World War II and beyond: 1941‚Äì1950" explains in several sentences his partisan affiliation and allegiance. Here are some more sources on his political involvement: [https://worldofwalt.com/walt-disney-conservative-liberal.html 1], [https://www.discovery.org/e/5769/ 2], [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2006/nov/26/film.usa 3]. Disney was lightly involved in Democratic politics, but during The Second World War and the Cold War Disney became known for his conservative and staunchly anti-communist views. His brother [[Roy O. Disney|Roy]], who was also politically active, has his party in his own infobox.

I, personally, do not feel strongly one way or another about including this, but would love to gage other editors' opinions. -- [[User:Titi68999|Titi68999]] ([[User talk:Titi68999|talk]]) 17:09, 3 June 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Category talk:Flag template shorthands#rfc_91034CE|Category talk:Flag template shorthands]] expired 2022-07-03 21:02 ===
* Id: 91034CE
* User: Ftrebien
* Date: 2022-06-03 20:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1091363500|STYLE 1091363500}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1096339015|STYLE 1096339015}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
{{section link|Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Linking|What generally should not be linked}} says that <q>''major'' examples of</q> <q>countries</q> <q>which most readers will be at least somewhat familiar</q> <q>are usually not linked</q>, implying that some of these shorthands should use {{tl|flagu}} unstead of {{tl|flag}}. So I propose changing the shorthands of [[List of sovereign states#List of states|sovereign UN member states]] (except [[microstate]]s) to use the '''unlinked''' flag template while those of [[Dependent territory|dependent territories]] and other non-sovereign entities (perhaps except the [[Template:UNO|United Nations]]) remain linked as they are now. --[[User:Ftrebien|Fernando Trebien]] ([[User talk:Ftrebien|talk]]) 20:15, 3 June 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Tytus Woyciechowski#rfc_A466B2D|Talk:Tytus Woyciechowski]] expired 2022-07-04 11:02 ===
* Id: A466B2D
* User: Smerus
* Date: 2022-07-01 09:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1095942724|BIO 1095942724}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1096422324|BIO 1096422324}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
An editor is seeking consistently to add this article (imo) excessive citations, for sources which may not be considered reliable, relsting to corrspondence between [[Fredieric Chopin]] and Woychiechowski. The issue relates to some sentences in a letter from Chopin which contain references which can be costrued as homoerotic on Chopin's part, although the consensus of Chopin scholars is that this is, at best "not proven". Some of the above comments on this talk page relate to this. No evidence exists of any sort to suggest that Woychiechowski was homosexual at any time in his life. To stress Chopin's correspondnce with Woychiechowski in this article is [[WP:UNDUE]] and certainly not [[WP:NPOV]]. The issue of Chopin's homosexuality itself was addressed in an [[Talk:Fr√©d√©ric_Chopin/Archive_23#RFC:_Chopin_and_Sexuality|RfC at Frederic Chopin]] which editors are invited to consult. I should be glad of editors' opinions.--[[User:Smerus|Smerus]] ([[User talk:Smerus|talk]]) 09:40, 1 July 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Suicide by jumping from height#rfc_56EFE08|Talk:Suicide by jumping from height]] expired 2022-07-06 19:01 ===
* Id: 56EFE08
* User: TransporterMan
* Date: 2022-06-06 18:59:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1091846652|BIO 1091846652}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1091846658|HIST 1091846658}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1096805756|BIO 1096805756}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1096805761|HIST 1096805761}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should this article about a particular method of suicide continue to include (i.e. keep) a list of specifically-named notable people who have died by this particular method? Does such a list have substantial value to explain or illustrate the topic of this article? Or should the existing list be removed (i.e. remove) with the consensus that it not be replaced without a new future consensus to do so?

The list in question is, [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Suicide_by_jumping_from_height&oldid=1091839275 as of this writing], the list beginning with "Prominent examples of autodefenestration include..." followed by a list of linked names.

''What this RFC is not:'' This is not on the question of whether such a list should not be included (a) due to concerns about either sensitivity for the surviving friends and relatives of people on the list, (b) due to concerns about whether such a list publicizes suicide in a way that might empower or encourage living individuals to kill themselves by this method of suicide or in general, or (c) similar concerns. This RFC is also not about the sentence beginning "The highest documented suicide jump..."

''What this RFC is:'' This is only about whether the list benefits this article under ordinary Wikipedia principles for inclusions of lists of things in articles.

Please weigh in by beginning with '''Keep '''or '''Remove '''or '''Other ''' meaning, respectively, '''Keep '''the existing list in the article, '''Remove '''the existing list from the article and do not replace it without a new future consensus to do so, or '''Other''' and explain.

Regards, [[User:TransporterMan|<span style="font-family:Trebuchet MS; color:blue; font-variant:small-caps;">'''TransporterMan'''</span>]] ([[User talk:TransporterMan|<span style="font-family:Trebuchet MS; font-size: x-small;">TALK</span>]]) 18:59, 6 June 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Jessica Cisneros#rfc_8F5C8BF|Talk:Jessica Cisneros]] expired 2022-07-07 18:01 ===
* Id: 8F5C8BF
* User: GRuban
* Date: 2022-07-07 15:31:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1096933867|BIO 1096933867}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1096933873|POL 1096933873}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1096947710|BIO 1096947710}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1096947715|POL 1096947715}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should either or both of the following images (they're basically the same image, one is a crop of the other), be included in the article [[Jessica Cisneros]]?
<gallery>
File:Jessica Cisneros, 2014 internship (cropped).jpg | Jessica Cisneros, 2014 internship 
File:Jessica Cisneros and Henry Cuellar, 2014 internship (cropped).jpg | Jessica Cisneros and Henry Cuellar, 2014 internship
</gallery>

* I think yes. Slight preference to both, but either will do, really. My arguments can be found both above, and [[Wikipedia:Biographies of living persons/Noticeboard#Image for Jessica Cisneros|at the BLPN]], but basically Zaereth said it best at BLPN - this image is a thousand times better than no image. We are here to improve the article, not to act as Cisneros's PR agency. Now that doesn't mean we should harm her, we shouldn't, we should certainly try to find a middle ground between that and improving the article - but leaving information, this image, ''out'' either because she looks young in it, or because it draws too much attention to the fact that she ran twice against the guy she formerly interned for, is bending too far over backwards in a misguided attempt to improve her political career. We don't do that. Arguing that an image that was fine when it was taken, then becomes a BLP violation a few years later is ... let's say overstating the case. This is the image we have, and it is a fair one. If we get a better one, great: we worked hard to look for one, we asked her representatives, they didn't respond, we found another one, it was deleted; until we get a better one, it will do, and if we never get a better one, it will also do. --[[User:GRuban|GRuban]] ([[User talk:GRuban|talk]]) 15:31, 7 July 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Pluperfect#rfc_5C8B462|Talk:Pluperfect]] expired 2022-07-08 11:01 ===
* Id: 5C8B462
* User: Steve Quinn
* Date: 2022-07-08 03:59:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1097014212|LANG 1097014212}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1097059156|LANG 1097059156}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The term "Past perfect" redirects here. Should the redirect go to [[Past perfect (disambiguation)|Past perfect disambiguation page]] instead of this page?

*'''Yes''' it should. As nominator I will explain my rationale. First, it seems more likely someone would plug in "past perfect" as a Wikipedia search term to look for a book title, a film title, an album title or some other kind of media. Check out the linked disambiguation page above for more clarity on that. It is true that the [[OED]], says "past perfect" is a synonym for "pluperfect." 

:However, this does not mean that it as widely used as the term "past perfect." For instance, in school I learned about "past perfect" but  "pluperfect" was never brought to my attention. I have to say "pluperfect" must be close to being archaic, even though the OED does say this word is in current use. Also, I just noticed even this article says, "'pluperfect' [is] usually called 'past perfect' in English" - first line of the intro. ---[[User:Steve Quinn|Steve Quinn]] ([[User talk:Steve Quinn|talk]]) 03:59, 8 July 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Balochistan, Pakistan#rfc_63B07D8|Talk:Balochistan, Pakistan]] expired 2022-07-08 18:01 ===
* Id: 63B07D8
* User: Rahman1212#top
* Date: 2022-06-19 13:14:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1093896555|LANG 1093896555}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1097106385|LANG 1097106385}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
An editor has added false information about the demographics of Balochistan claiming that:

1. Baloch make up 60% in the province
 
2. There are Turks living in the area

In support of the first point a random newspaper article is claimed source (whose numbers are contrary to any official source). While for the second point only imagination has been used. 

I first tried to update the numbers to 2017 census (latest census) i.e. Baloch make up 35% and there are no Turks in the area. But after discussing with other editors I came to know that there is no official definition of "Baloch ethnicity", and numerous Barahvi, Pashto, Sindhi and Seraiki speaking communities also identify as Baloch. So in that effect I preferred to remove that information to keep the article clean of imaginations, and just stick to facts.

All of my edits were removed by the editor who added the baseless numbers in the first place, claiming that his version WP:STATUSQUO

Also, there is no such thing as 2008 census. The 2008 data is based on 1998 census in which Pashtuns were underrepresented (see discussion), while in 2017 their representation was restored (and hence the jump in their numbers). [[User:Rahman1212|Rahman1212]] ([[User talk:Rahman1212#top|talk]]) 13:14, 19 June 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:2022 Muhammad remarks controversy#rfc_26F36AA|Talk:2022 Muhammad remarks controversy]] expired 2022-07-09 15:01 ===
* Id: 26F36AA
* User: Mossad3
* Date: 2022-07-06 00:30:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1096682555|POL 1096682555}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1096682558|RELI 1096682558}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1097242516|POL 1097242516}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1097242520|RELI 1097242520}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the sentence "{{tq|Some traditional hadith sources state that Aisha was six years of age when she was married to Muhammad, and he consummated that marriage when she was nine years old.<ref name="Sunnah.com">{{cite web | title=Sahih al-Bukhari 3896 - Merits of the Helpers in Madinah (Ansaar) - ŸÉÿ™ÿßÿ® ŸÖŸÜÿßŸÇÿ® ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸÜÿµÿßÿ± - Sayings and Teachings of Prophet Muhammad (ÿµŸÑŸâ ÿßŸÑŸÑŸá ÿπŸÑŸäŸá Ÿà ÿ≥ŸÑŸÖ) | website=Sunnah.com | url=https://sunnah.com/bukhari:3896 | language=la | access-date=2022-07-06}}</ref>,  others say she was betrothed to Muhammad at the age of 6 or 7;<ref name=spellberg40>{{harvnb|Spellberg|1994|pp=39‚Äì40}}</ref> and she was 9 when she had a small marriage ceremony.<ref name=armstrong157>{{harvnb|Armstrong|1992|p=157}}</ref>}}" be added to the lead or under Naveen Jindal's tweet in the Comments about Muhammad section? [[User:Mossad3|Mossad3]] ([[User talk:Mossad3|talk]]) 00:30, 6 July 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of coups and coup attempts#rfc_3512BCD|Talk:List of coups and coup attempts]] expired 2022-07-10 21:01 ===
* Id: 3512BCD
* User: Anythingyouwant
* Date: 2022-06-18 04:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1093688211|HIST 1093688211}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1093718097|POL 1093718097}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1098929679|HIST 1098929679}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1098929683|POL 1098929683}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Editing this list gets more complicated if we want to keep including not just verified coups and coup attempts, but also well-sourced allegations that such incidents have occurred (like [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_coups_and_coup_attempts&oldid=1093238216#Claimed_coups_and_coup_attempts_since_1950 these items]).  If alleged incidents are included or retained in this list, then we could (1) amend the lead to unambiguously explain the list criteria so readers will understand that some of the listed items are unverified by reliable secondary sources as actual coups or actual coup attempts.  We could also avoid undue weight and confusion by (2) putting alleged incidents into a separate chronological section with an appropriate header (like [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_coups_and_coup_attempts&oldid=1093238216#Claimed_coups_and_coup_attempts_since_1950 this for example]) instead of mixing them in with the verified incidents.  '''So the RFC question is this: should step (1) and/or step (2) be implemented?'''[[User:Anythingyouwant|&#32;Anythingyouwant]] ([[User talk:Anythingyouwant|talk]]) 04:33, 18 June 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of coups and coup attempts#rfc_52B9DD6|Talk:List of coups and coup attempts]] expired 2022-07-10 21:01 ===
* Id: 52B9DD6
* User: Drbogdan
* Date: 2022-06-10 20:21:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1092663850|POL 1092663850}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1097457399|POL 1097457399}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Seems the use of the phrase '''"attempted coup"''' in this and related articles requires "[[WP:CONSENSUS]]" - adding "[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_coups_and_coup_attempts&diff=1092488777&oldid=1092486626 this edit]" (also, see copy below) has been "[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_coups_and_coup_attempts_by_country&diff=1092504101&oldid=1092490371 reverted]" due to a lack of "[[WP:CONSENSUS]]" - there has not been "Consensus" for ''removing'' the edit either - nonetheless - a "[[WP:CONSENSUS]]" discussion is sought.

"{{tq|Seems quoting an official USA Congressional Select Committee authority source, Committee Chairman [[Bennie Thompson]], at one of the highest government levels currently active in the USA government today, and as reported by one of the world's foremost [[WP:RS|Reliable Sources]], ''[[The New York Times]]'', is a [[WP:AGF|good faith]] and sufficient edit addition regarding the use of the phrase, '''"attempted coup"'''.}}" - [[User:Drbogdan|Drbogdan]] ([[User talk:Drbogdan|talk]]) 20:21, 10 June 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Hypothetical Axis victory in World War II#rfc_E9B9A2C|Talk:Hypothetical Axis victory in World War II]] expired 2022-07-11 05:01 ===
* Id: E9B9A2C
* User: 2804:248:f650:6600:86f:165c:bba5:8f4
* Date: 2022-06-11 04:51:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1092576964|HIST 1092576964}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1092576967|MEDIA 1092576967}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1097514928|HIST 1097514928}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1097514933|MEDIA 1097514933}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Recently there was controversy over what map or other image, if any, should be placed in the article's lead, eventually an RfC was held, with the conclusion that there was consensus against the proposed maps due to concerns over original research, but given that the only users who took part in it were ones who were already involved in the dispute, I thought it was appropriate to at least have further discussion on this issue.

I made some proposals which were already mentioned above:

# The world map based on The Man in the High Castle, which was recently removed: [[c:File:The Man in the High Castle Plausible World Map.png]]
# A world map based on Fatherland: [[c:File:Fatherland.png]]
# Another map based on Fatherland, but this time of Europe only, this was the one originally in the lead: [[c:File:Fatherland's 1964 Europe.jpg]]
# A model of the Volkshalle, which was to be built if Germany won: [[c:File:Bundesarchiv Bild 146-1986-029-02, "Germania", Modell "Gro√üe Halle".jpg]]
# A broader model of "Germania", the planned rebuilding of Berlin: [[c:File:Bundesarchiv Bild 146III-373, Modell der Neugestaltung Berlins ("Germania").jpg]]

Other suggestions would be welcomed. -- [[Special:Contributions/2804:248:f650:6600:86f:165c:bba5:8f4|2804:248:f650:6600:86f:165c:bba5:8f4]] ([[User talk:2804:248:f650:6600:86f:165c:bba5:8f4|talk]]) 04:51, 11 June 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:What Wikipedia is not#rfc_5974B53|Wikipedia talk:What Wikipedia is not]] expired 2022-07-11 19:01 ===
* Id: 5974B53
* User: Selfstudier
* Date: 2022-07-11 17:21:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1097613464|POL 1097613464}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1097613466|SOC 1097613466}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1097622078|POL 1097622078}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1097622080|SOC 1097622080}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
RFCbefore [[Wikipedia talk:What Wikipedia is not#NOTMEMORIAL and its application to lists of victims within articles]]
Previous discussions: [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Village_pump_(policy)/Archive_138#WP%3ANOTMEMORIAL_and_victim_lists_in_tragedy_articles 2017] [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Village_pump_(proposals)/Archive_149#WP:NOTMEMORIAL_Victim_lists_in_mass_tragedy_articles_-_Round_2 2018] [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Village_pump_(idea_lab)/Archive_27#Victims_lists_are_becoming_a_source_of_constant_debate_and_argument 2018]
[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Village_pump_(policy)/Archive_150#Proposed_amendment_to_WP%3ALISTPEOPLE_regarding_the_inclusion_of_lists_of_non-notable_victims_in_articles_about_tragic_events 2019]
[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Village_pump_(idea_lab)/Archive_30#Victims%27_names_proposal_workshop 2019].
Three essays: [[Wikipedia:What NOTMEMORIAL is not]],  [[Wikipedia:Casualty lists]],  [[Wikipedia:Victim lists]].

Choose:
 
Option A) "Lists of victims of an event are inappropriate unless all listed victims have Wikipedia articles, or a section of an article, of their own" ( from the essay [[Wikipedia:Victim lists]]) or

Option B) "In events where people die by homicide or accident, it is appropriate to provide names and other minor details if our secondary sources provide such coverage." (from the essay [[Wikipedia:Casualty lists]]) or

Option C) Something else and say what it is in a sentence. [[User:Selfstudier|Selfstudier]] ([[User talk:Selfstudier|talk]]) 17:21, 11 July 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Comfort women#rfc_99982A4|Talk:Comfort women]] expired 2022-07-11 23:01 ===
* Id: 99982A4
* User: Eyagi
* Date: 2022-06-29 05:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1095583646|HIST 1095583646}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1097656948|HIST 1097656948}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This is a dispute over yes or no of a rewrite of lead sentence of the current "Comfort Women" article. The content of the dispute is shown in the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Comfort_women#Suggested_changes_to_first_paragraph Talk]. We agree that there are two opinions about "comfort women": "licensed prostitutes" and "sex slaves", and also that we have exhausted our arguments. In the current article, the first paragraph reads, "Comfort women or comfort girls were women and girls '''forced into sexual slavery''' by the Imperial Japanese Army ..."„ÄÄand the writing of "licensed prostitutes claim‚Äùis excluded as this basis. To maintain neutrality,  shouldn't this paragraph be changed to, for example, "Comfort women or comfort girls were women and girls '''to provide sexual services''' to the Imperial Japanese Army..." ?

The reason for oppositon to the writing of "licensed prostitutes" is based on the claim that the majority of comfort women is sex slaves. There is an objection to "majority of sex slaves" with evidence. Even if they are a minority, wouldn't be against wiki's 5P1 and 5P2 to exclude dissenting opinions ? Please read through Talk and comment. If you have any questions, I will answer them. [[User:Eyagi|Eyagi]] ([[User talk:Eyagi|talk]]) 05:19, 29 June 2022 (UTC)}}
