=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Politics/American politics#rfc_B0D26DF|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Politics/American politics]] expired 2022-08-16 00:01 ===
* Id: B0D26DF
* User: Elizium23
* Date: 2022-07-28 22:35:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1101026581|POL 1101026581}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1101026586|SOC 1101026586}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1104617895|POL 1104617895}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1104617899|SOC 1104617899}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Greetings, politics lovers!
Since the [[Respect for Marriage Act]] will be broadening the definition of marriage to anything we want it to be, I'm thinking of how we can uniformly address marriage issues in articles, especially about political views.
* "[[Traditional marriage]]" is a political term often used by conservatives, which tends to refer to "one-man, one-woman" [[complementarianism]] and additionally, [[child-bearing]] couples and permanent unions without divorce. Unfortunately not many supporters of Traditional Marriage can really agree on what it means.
* "[[Same-sex marriage]]" is of course a specific and recent issue which is narrow in scope.
* "[[Marriage equality]]" is a broadly inclusive political term, and I would argue that it's equivalent to "traditional marriage" in [[WP:POV]] political framing; they're both buzzwords or Shibboleths indicating support for a specific tapestry of beliefs about gender. "Marriage equality" as a neologism may also be as poorly-defined as "Traditional marriage" and subject to shifting connotations as time advances.

* Now, generally in political articles we've been writing about how politicians oppose or support same-sex marriage. BUt in light of RFMA, I don't think that narrow scope suffices anymore. I also oppose the expansion of our use of the term "marriage equality" because we've already been down that road with [[pro-life]] and [[pro-choice]] and the overwhelming consensus is to use neither term due to its political implications.

RFC question: How should the political issue of "marriage" be framed in political articles?
#Continue to frame marriage issues, and section headings, in terms of opposition/support for [[same-sex marriage]]?
#Refer neutrally to "Marriage" in section headings, and address nuances in prose?
#Turn to a duality of "traditional marriage" vs. "marriage equality" framing?
#None of the above: but avoid ideologically-framed terms in favor of something else?
[[User:Elizium23|Elizium23]] ([[User talk:Elizium23|talk]]) 22:35, 28 July 2022 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:2022 Laguna Woods shooting#rfc_5C64031|Talk:2022 Laguna Woods shooting]] expired 2022-08-16 00:01 ===
* Id: 5C64031
* User: Thundercloss
* Date: 2022-07-23 11:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1099943973|POL 1099943973}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1104617895|POL 1104617895}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which version should be used? 

'''Option 1:''' In 2009, Chou moved to Las Vegas and became a landlord with his wife. According to Balmore Orellana, a former tenant and neighbor of Chou, he was a considerate landlord as Chou did not raise his rent throughout the time that he lived there, but was verbally aggressive toward his wife as he would hear Chou yelling through the walls. In the wake of the shooting Orellana also recalled Chou telling him that he identified as Chinese despite his Taiwanese nationality, and believed that China and Taiwan were one country. In the mid 2010s Chou was almost beaten to death by two tenants who were in arrears; Orellana said the attack left him with scars all over his body and was a harbinger of the decline in his mental stability.

'''Option 2:''' According to his former neighbor, Chou was once a friendly owner of a Las Vegas apartment building. In 2012 he suffered a nearly fatal attack by two tenants over rent that led to a loss of consciousness, a broken skull, elbow, and partial hearing loss. He also suspected that police detectives tried to withhold a bag with his money before the prosecuter was involved and his bag was finally recovered. 

The background to the rfc can be found in the ‚Äúsecond paragraph‚Äù subsection of the accused section [[User:Thundercloss|Thundercloss]] ([[User talk:Thundercloss|talk]]) 11:22, 23 July 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of coups and coup attempts#rfc_C1E0221|Talk:List of coups and coup attempts]] expired 2022-08-18 00:01 ===
* Id: C1E0221
* User: NewsAndEventsGuy
* Date: 2022-07-18 23:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1099092572|HIST 1099092572}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1099092576|POL 1099092576}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1104996021|HIST 1104996021}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1104996026|POL 1104996026}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''PROPOSAL'''  .... To add [[Template:List criteria]] to the talkpage header, as stated in the template documentation, and include the following statement of list criteria:
{{Quote frame|quote=To be included on this list in [[WP:WIKIVOICE]], the event must have been described as a coup or coup attempt by the majority of <em>[[historian]]s</em> commenting in the available [[WP:Reliable sources]].  Other events may be included with regard to due [[WP:WEIGHT]] and using [[WP:INTEXT]] attribution if (A) the event included physical violence and (B) a significant portion of [[WP:NOTABLE]] commenters have described the event as a coup or coup attempt.}}
''Advantages''
* Establishes list criteria without introducing any new vocabularly to enter the WikiLawyer lexicon. 
* Uses [[Template:List criteria]] to document the consensus
* This proposal is formatted in expectation we will be asking an uninvolved ed to determine consensus and do non-admin closure. 
[[User:NewsAndEventsGuy|NewsAndEventsGuy]] ([[User talk:NewsAndEventsGuy|talk]]) 23:19, 18 July 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (miscellaneous)#rfc_3DAC6ED|Wikipedia:Village pump (miscellaneous)]] expired 2022-08-18 04:01 ===
* Id: 3DAC6ED
* User: Headbomb
* Date: 2022-08-16 01:04:00

{{rfcquote|text=
There are two questions.
# Should the mass REMOVAL of {{tl|Cleanup bare URLs}} be done by [[WP:BOTDICT#bot|bots]] or [[WP:BOTDICT#meatbot|meatbots]]?
# Should bare URLs tagged with issues, like <code><nowiki><ref>https://example.com {{deadlink}}</ref></nowiki></code> be ignored in this mass removal? Meaning that the {{tl|Cleanup bare URLs}} tag would be removed in those cases.
&#32;<span style="font-variant:small-caps; whitespace:nowrap;">[[User:Headbomb|Headbomb]] {[[User talk:Headbomb|t]] ¬∑ [[Special:Contributions/Headbomb|c]] ¬∑ [[WP:PHYS|p]] ¬∑ [[WP:WBOOKS|b]]}</span> 01:04, 16 August 2022 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (miscellaneous)#rfc_FCDCFEC|Wikipedia:Village pump (miscellaneous)]] expired 2022-08-18 04:01 ===
* Id: FCDCFEC
* User: Headbomb

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Administrators' noticeboard#rfc_A2D5E21|Wikipedia talk:Administrators' noticeboard]] expired 2022-08-18 15:01 ===
* Id: A2D5E21
* User: Shibbolethink
* Date: 2022-08-15 14:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1104724369|PROP 1104724369}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1105105051|PROP 1105105051}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
See "[[Wikipedia_talk:Administrators%27_noticeboard#Making_ANI_less_toxic|Making ANI less toxic]]". Many comparisons have been made between [[WP:ANI]] and [[WP:AE]], mostly favorably alluding to the latter being more civil and less liable to veer off into unrelated discussion, dispute, and general mayhem. One difference between these two is that AE has prescribed sections for each user. What if ANI had this?

; Options

* '''A''': ''ANI posts must be split up into sub-sections, with each user (including admins) replying only in their section "<u>Statement by (username)</u>.''"
* '''B''': ''ANI posts must be split up into sub-sections, with each "non-admin user" replying only in their prescribed section "<u>Statement by (username)</u>". Admin users comment in an "<u>Administrator discussion</u>" section at the bottom.''
* '''C''': ''ANI posts must be split up into sub-sections, with each "involved user" replying only in their section "<u>Statement by (username) (involved)</u>". Uninvolved users may then comment in an overall "<u>Uninvolved discussion</u>" section at the bottom. Admin users may then comment in an overall "<u>Administrator discussion</u>" section below that.''
* '''D''': ''Status quo, without any delineation by user.''
* '''E''': ''Two sections: "<u>Involved discussion</u>" and "<u>Uninvolved discussion</u>"''

It should be said that all of the above (A {{Emdash}} C) would still allow for proposals to be placed as separate subsections, such as "'''Topic ban proposal'''" but that such sections should have a '''Survey''' and '''Discussion'''. Thoughts, feelings?‚Äî&nbsp;[[User:Shibbolethink|<span style="color: black">Shibboleth</span><span style="color: maroon">ink</span>]] <sup>([[User talk:Shibbolethink|‚ôî]]</sup> <sup>[[Special:Contributions/Shibbolethink|‚ôï]])</sup> 14:10, 15 August 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Tennis#rfc_63D780F|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Tennis]] expired 2022-08-21 23:01 ===
* Id: 63D780F
* User: Fyunck(click)
* Date: 2022-07-22 23:01:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1099861445|SOC 1099861445}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1105813524|SOC 1105813524}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The situation. On March 1st the governing bodies of tennis (ATP,WTA,ITF) told the world that no Russian or Belarus player can play a tennis tournament under their nation's flag because of the attack on Ukraine by Russian forces. All tournaments agreed and since that time you will see no player nationality listed at any tournament. No problems there. However, authorities did not say they would remove all nationality from rankings, nor did it say that we should erase the nationality of a player for other reasons. The ATP website software seems to have a problem in that it removed all traces of nationality of Russian/Belarus players... everything. [https://www.atptour.com/en/players/daniil-medvedev/mm58/overview Daniil Medvedev's bio shows no trace of his Russian flag]. Rankings [https://www.atptour.com/en/rankings/singles?rankRange=0-100&rankDate=2020-12-28 from 2020 also show no nationality]. This is a software error and makes missing nationality from rankings on the ATP and WTA unreliable at the moment.

If we use other sources for rankings we see a different picture. [https://www.espn.com/tennis/rankings ESPN rankings], [https://www.foxsports.com/tennis/atp/rankings FOX rankings], [http://stats.washingtonpost.com/tennis/rankings.asp?tour=ATP Washington Post rankings], [https://tennisabstract.com/reports/atpRankings.html Tennis Abstract rankings]... these all show a nationality... as they should. Individual tournaments, which we can source, are a different matter. Nationality is not allowed for the tournaments and those affected players are not allowed to enter team events.

These ranking templates will be affected:
*[[Template:Current ATP singles rankings]]
*[[Template:Current WTA singles rankings]]
*[[Template:Current WTA doubles individual rankings]]
*[[Template:Current ATP doubles individual rankings]]

Joint governing body March 1st statement [https://www.atptour.com/en/news/joint-statement-by-the-international-governing-bodies-of-tennis-1-march-2022 is right here]

These templates are used in multiple articles and inside other templates, and readers have complained about missing nationalities where I have no good answer for them. Since I see no large discussion of this, and another editor and I are at a complete impasse, I have started this RfC here (since it affects multiple tennis articles). [[User:Fyunck(click)|Fyunck(click)]] ([[User talk:Fyunck(click)|talk]]) 23:01, 22 July 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Image use policy#rfc_FFE5D0C|Wikipedia talk:Image use policy]] expired 2022-08-22 14:01 ===
* Id: FFE5D0C
* User: L33tm4n
* Date: 2022-08-19 20:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1105354183|POLICY 1105354183}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1105946295|POLICY 1105946295}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
''Original discussion: [[Wikipedia talk:Image use policy#Obstructions in images of people|Obstructions in images of people]]''



I can't seem to find any policies involving obstructions in images of people.

I think certain obstructions in images of people should be prohibited (e.g., [[:Mizkif]]'s baseball cap covering part of his face + [[:Sodapoppin]] wearing his sunglasses) unless the person is notable for them (e.g., [[:Andrew Tate]] wearing his sunglasses), while others shouldn't be a problem (e.g., [[:Jacksepticeye]] holding a microphone not too close to his face + [[:TommyInnit]]'s headset microphone). [[User:L33tm4n|L33tm4n]] ([[User talk:L33tm4n|talk]]) 20:12, 19 August 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:2023 Nigerian general election#rfc_E0E5F07|Talk:2023 Nigerian general election]] expired 2022-08-24 00:01 ===
* Id: E0E5F07
* User: Number 57
* Date: 2022-08-23 22:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1106266136|POL 1106266136}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1111782296|POL 1111782296}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This article's original name was "2023 Nigerian general election" but it was changed to "2023 Nigerian elections" due to the addition of elections not on a single election day. The name was changed back a few months later leading to a requested move in April which ended in no responses, a second requested move in June also ended in no responses before being reopened later that month and again ending in no responses. A few more discussions on various talk pages also went nowhere. The dispute is between one side (me) who supports a move as the current title indicates that there is one central election on one day; however, there are dozens of different elections in Nigeria throughout 2023 (from February to at least November) making this page comparable to the [[2020 United States elections]] page. The other side ({{user|Number 57}}) argues for the page to be split.
*To correct the false claim above, the two RMs did not receive no responses. Both received responses and ended in no consensus outcomes. The false claim is on top of an attempt earlier to get the page moved by falsely claiming it was a non-controversial move at [[WP:RM/T]], The forum shopping and behavioural issues around this are getting increasingly concerning. [[User:Number 57|<span style="color: orange;">Number</span>]] [[User talk:Number 57|<span style="color: green;">5</span>]][[Special:Contributions/Number 57|<span style="color: blue;">7</span>]] 22:07, 23 August 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_A197744|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2022-08-24 01:01 ===
* Id: A197744
* User: 64.229.88.43
* Date: 2022-08-22 04:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1105868706|PROP 1105868706}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1106300631|PROP 1106300631}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I propose that a button be placed on the basic interface that toggles between light mode and dark mode, available to all users, whether with an account or not, to easily and quickly toggle between light and dark as one needs.
-- [[Special:Contributions/64.229.88.43|64.229.88.43]] ([[User talk:64.229.88.43|talk]]) 04:18, 22 August 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Elections and Referendums#rfc_D1CBF28|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Elections and Referendums]] expired 2022-08-25 01:01 ===
* Id: D1CBF28
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1100455009|POLICY 1100455009}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1106515046|POLICY 1106515046}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Over the last year, users have begun adding image galleries to the primary section of non-Presidential United States election articles. These galleries feature a note that "The images in this gallery are in the [[Public domain in the United States|public domain]] or are otherwise [[Free content#Media|free to use]]. This gallery should not be construed as a list of major or noteworthy candidates. If a candidate is not included in this gallery, it is only because there are no [[MOS:IMAGEQUALITY|high-quality]], [[Wikipedia:Public domain|copyright-free]] photographs of them available on the Internet." These galleries have proven contentious and led to

=== [[Wikipedia_talk:WikiProject_Elections_and_Referendums/Archive_20#RfC_about_primary_candidate_photos_in_election_articles|multiple prior discussions]] expired 2022-08-25 01:01 ===
* Id: 
* User: Toa Nidhiki05
* Date: 2022-07-26 00:19:00
* RFC Text:
, none of which has yielded a consensus for or against.

Currently, there is no project-wide consensus on the use of these galleries or guidance on how they should be made. This RfC will be on two topics. 

# '''Should these galleries be used in American politics articles?'''
# '''How should these sections be formatted if they are used?''' 

While discussion on 1) is underway, users can discuss the second plank in a separate section. If consensus is achieved for usage on 1), the ideas in 2) will be voted upon as well. '''[[User:Toa Nidhiki05|<i style="color: green; font-family: Mistral;">Toa</i>]] [[User talk:Toa Nidhiki05|<i style="color: green; font-family: Mistral;">Nidhiki05</i>]]''' 00:19, 26 July 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:2020 Italian regional elections#rfc_C20C703|Talk:2020 Italian regional elections]] expired 2022-08-25 14:01 ===
* Id: C20C703
* User: Scia Della Cometa
* Date: 2022-08-24 20:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1106483365|POL 1106483365}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1106483369|SOC 1106483369}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1106612684|POL 1106612684}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1106612688|SOC 1106612688}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
How should the pages of the Italian regional elections be set up?
*'''Option A:''' current set up (see [[2020 Italian regional elections]]);
*'''Option B:''' current set up, but the summary tables should only show the coalitions/parties that have won seats;
*'''Option C:''' set up similar to that one of local elections, i.e. summary table with outgoing president, new president, electoral result and seats won, with links to specific results at the bottom of the page (see [[2020 Italian local elections]]);
*'''Option C:''' new suggestion.
Please choose one of the options and possibly provide an order of preference of the various options. [[User:Scia Della Cometa|Scia Della Cometa]] ([[User talk:Scia Della Cometa|talk]]) 20:12, 24 August 2022 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the following two [[WP:MEDRS|MEDRS]] referenced sentences ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Terpene&diff=1098786732&oldid=1098785207] diff with references) be included in the article?

"Terpenes (and terpenoids) are prevalent in cannabis (marijuana) and have been postulated to modulate the medicinal or psychological effects of cannabinoids (e.g., THC or CBD) in humans; this is often referred to as the "entourage effect". However, there is currently minimal human clinical data supporting this hypothesis."  [[User:Finney1234|Finney1234]] ([[User talk:Finney1234|talk]]) 14:32, 26 July 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Preparedness paradox#rfc_ED17587|Talk:Preparedness paradox]] expired 2022-08-26 10:01 ===
* Id: ED17587
* User: Lord Belbury
* Date: 2022-07-27 09:43:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1100722132|SOC 1100722132}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1106767815|SOC 1106767815}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Are the following three situations examples of the preparedness paradox, as the article defines it?
# {{tq|...damages attributed to the Chernobyl nuclear power plant disaster could have been easily reduced if the reactor and sarcophagus had been re-ensured with additional concrete and steel bars prior to the accident.}}
# {{tq|Levees are structures which run parallel to rivers and are meant to offer protection from flooding. Paradoxically, their construction leads to a reduced awareness of and preparation for floods or breaches.}}
# {{tq|Even though the Onagawa Nuclear Power Plant was closer to the epicenter of the earthquake, it withstood the cataclysm because of the preparations made by the facility's owners. On the other hand, the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant suffered heavy damage because of a lack of preparation due to the perception of less risk.}}
-- [[User:Lord Belbury|Lord Belbury]] ([[User talk:Lord Belbury|talk]]) 09:43, 27 July 2022 (UTC)}}

Anyway, though, I think we should pick something to say in the lead paragraph, and avoid making clowns of ourselves. Maybe this is an impossible task. So here are a few things that we could say. {{rfcquote|text=
Should Fox News (the news website, not the TV shows) be considered reliable or unreliable '''for politics and science'''? 

#'''Upgrade''' to ''Generally Reliable'' for factual reporting
#'''Status quo''' to maintain present situation; ''No Consensus'', ''Unclear'', or ''Additional Considerations Apply''
#'''Downgrade''' to ''Generally Unreliable'' or ''Questionable'' for factual reporting
#'''Deprecate''' entirely to ''Generally Prohibited''

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1108409793|PROP 1108409793}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should any article written by Sydney Zatz on Royal Central be depreciated? The reason why I ask was because I found [https://royalcentral.co.uk/uk/milestones-of-a-monarch-the-rhodesia-crisis-176036/ this article by the author] on Royal Central which appeared to have directly copied a paragraph from our [[Queen of Rhodesia]] article. When I [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_379#Royal_Central%2C_deprecate%3F raised the initial discussion at RSN], {{ping|user:Mhawk10}} made the point that [[WP:EARWIG]] shows that a number of her other articles also seem to copy from Wikipedia without attribution ([https://copyvios.toolforge.org/?lang=en&project=wikipedia&title=&oldid=1082459436&use_engine=0&use_links=0&turnitin=0&action=compare&url=https%3A%2F%2Froyalcentral.co.uk%2Fuk%2Fthe-history-of-royal-maundy-services-175127%2F example here but rest on RSN link]). I sent an email through Royal Central's "Contact Us" page telling them of it about a month ago and had no reply and [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard#Royal_Central_(cont.) little advice from RSN on followup]. But given this history of this author for seeming to use Wikipedia content without attribution, I would like to ask the community for their comments on this proposal or if it should be extended to all of Royal Central.

Which of the following best describes the [[WP:RS|reliability]] of Sydney Zatz's articles on ''Royal Central''<nowiki/>?
*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]] as in the [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 220#Daily Mail RfC|2017 RfC]] of the ''[[Daily Mail]]'' <span style="text-shadow:grey 0.5em 0.5em 0.6em;"> '''[[User:The C of E|<span style="color:red;">The C of E </span><span style="color:blue;"> God Save the Queen!</span>]]''' ([[User talk:The C of E|<span style="color:darkblue;">talk</span>]])</span> 06:56, 5 August 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Boro people#rfc_3927887|Talk:Boro people]] expired 2022-08-31 20:01 ===
* Id: 3927887
* User: Northeast heritage
* Date: 2022-08-30 02:21:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1107458376|HIST 1107458376}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1107769094|HIST 1107769094}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
We are having some issues with interpretations of what the Authors said and what an editor interprete. I assumed good faith in the editor since she/he is a senior editor but not a single source discusses "Boro Identity Formation". Authors discuss socio-religious and political transformation or aspirations of the community. Based on {{tq|"From the colonial period, the Bodos have been defining themselves as a community in opposition to other communities. The Bodo-educated elites and intelligentsia have been articulating their divergence from the Assamese caste Hindu society and highlighting issues like land alienation and social and economic backwardness."}}, The editor interpreted the "Boro Identity Formation" began in the colonial period. To my understanding, Neither her/his interpretation is correct nor the section name is WP:DUE. Should there be some changes? I will appreciate your comments. [[User:Northeast heritage|Northeast heritage]] ([[User talk:Northeast heritage|talk]]) 02:21, 30 August 2022 (UTC)}}

:I ended the discussion. [[User:Northeast heritage|Northeast heritage]] ([[User talk:Northeast heritage|talk]]) 19:16, 31 August 2022 (UTC)

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Username policy#rfc_058403E|Wikipedia talk:Username policy]] expired 2022-08-31 21:01 ===
* Id: 058403E
* User: CaptainEek
* Date: 2022-08-01 20:51:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1101791796|POLICY 1101791796}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1107777760|POLICY 1107777760}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I suggest the following amendment to [[Wikipedia:Username_policy#Real_names|the real names section]]: {{tq|<u>You are strongly discouraged from using your real name, a nickname, or any other username which might be traced to you.</u> <s>Consider carefully before creating an account in your real name or a nickname which might be traced to you, as these increase</s> <u>Using your real name</u> increases the potential for harassment, especially if you edit in controversial subject areas. <u>Consider your personal safety too. In some countries, editing Wikipedia can be illegal, and using your real name can put you at risk of legal consequences.</u> While it is possible to rename your account later (see Changing your username below), a record of your previous username remains permanently.}}

It is high time that our guidance on real usernames be stronger. While I understand that many users wish they had used their real name initially, you can always change your username to your real name later. But you can never scrub your real name from Wikipedia once you've used it. Further, using one's real name is I believe an example of western privilege that a good swath of our other editors do not have. But even our western editors are exposed to considerable harassment. Nor are such users immune from legal trouble. Take [[R√©mi Mathis]], who used his real name, and got in trouble with the French. Our contributors are in increasing real world danger from using their real names. Our lukewarm guidance is no longer sufficient. [[User:CaptainEek|<span style="color:#6a1f7f">'''CaptainEek'''</span>]] <sup>[[User talk:CaptainEek|<span style="font-size:82%"><span style="color:#a479e5">''Edits Ho Cap'n!''</span></span>]]</sup>[[Special:Contributions/CaptainEek|‚öì]] 20:51, 1 August 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Flag of Afghanistan#rfc_043CBFD|Talk:Flag of Afghanistan]] expired 2022-09-01 11:01 ===
* Id: 043CBFD
* User: Khestwol
* Date: 2022-08-28 11:39:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1107146824|POL 1107146824}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1107769096|POL 1107769096}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The United Nations ([https://www.un.org/en/about-us/member-states]), all international governments (see e.g. [https://www.eda.admin.ch/eda/en/fdfa/representations-and-travel-advice/afghanistan.html Switzerland]), and Afghans themselves (including all of the country's national sports teams, e.g. the [https://www.espncricinfo.com/team/afghanistan-40 cricket team]) still use the tricolor flag of Afghanistan üá¶üá´. On the other hand, the Taliban, who took over the country in August 2021, are still [[Recognition of the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan|not recognized]] by any country, but several countries (including [http://www.publicsafety.gc.ca/cnt/ntnl-scrt/cntr-trrrsm/lstd-ntts/crrnt-lstd-ntts-eng.aspx Canada]) still designate the [[Taliban#Designation_as_a_terrorist_organization|Taliban as a terrorist organization]]. So considering this, which flag should be shown in the infobox of this article?
*'''A''': Use only the tricolor flag, which is internationally recognized.
*'''B''': Use only the flag of the Taliban, which is unrecognized.
*'''C''': Use both of the above flags. [[User:Khestwol|Khestwol]] ([[User talk:Khestwol|talk]]) 11:39, 28 August 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:XOR gate#rfc_654B307|Talk:XOR gate]] expired 2022-09-01 22:01 ===
* Id: 654B307
* User: Alexander_Davronov
* Date: 2022-08-02 21:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1102001599|SCI 1102001599}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1107980748|SCI 1107980748}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
''See previous [[#Inverters|discussion here]].''

I propose to update the article with the following draft below making a short description on parts of the scheme (image). Regardless of their function I just propose to mention that sub-circuits of the scheme resemble commonly used circuits in cMOS logic family. In order to avoid possible confusion, I also propose to say that the left-stage inveter (which is B-driven) circuit is not acting exactly like a NOT gate. The net-result of the entire scheme should be left out of scope of image caption. --<span style="font-weight: bold" >[[User:Alexander_Davronov|<span style="color:#a8a8a8;">AXO</span><span style="color:#000">NOV</span>]] [[User talk:Alexander_Davronov|(talk)]] [[Special:Contributions/Alexander_Davronov|‚öë]]</span> 21:26, 2 August 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Requests for comment/Arbitration Committee Elections December 2022#rfc_36E33C3|Wikipedia:Requests for comment/Arbitration Committee Elections December 2022]] expired 2022-09-02 02:01 ===
* Id: 36E33C3
* User: Isaacl
* Date: 2022-08-03 01:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1107957677|PROP 1107957677}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1108004780|PROP 1108004780}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The purpose of this '''[[Wikipedia:Requests for comment|request for comment]]''' is to provide an opportunity to amend the structure, rules, and procedures of the '''[[Wikipedia:Arbitration Committee Elections December 2022|December 2022 English Wikipedia Arbitration Committee election]]''' and resolve any issues not covered by the [[Wikipedia:Requests for comment/Arbitration Committee Elections/ACERFC decisions to date|'''existing rules''']]. 13:49, 1 September 2022‚Äé (UTC)

'''Background''': In the case of proposals that change existing rules, or that seek to establish new ones, lack of consensus for a change will result in the rules from the 2020 election remaining in force. Some issues are not covered by the existing rules but will need to be decided one way or another for the operation of the election, in those cases it will be up to the closer to figure out a result, even if there is no clear consensus, as they have had to in the past.

'''Structure''': This RfC is divided into portions, each of which contains a discussion point for the community. The standard RfC structure will be used, in which any user may make a general statement that other users may endorse if they so agree. The points will be listed in the [[#toc|table of contents]] below, along with the users who have made statements. Anyone is free to raise any new topics that they feel need to be addressed by filling out the [[#Formatting|format template below]] or using {{tls|ACERFC statement}}.

'''Duration''':  In order to preserve the timeline of the election (see above), we should aim to close this RfC as soon as 30 days have passed, i.e. '''on or after 23:59, {{#time:d F Y|{{Arbitration Committee candidate/data|2022|rfcend}}-1 day}} (UTC)'''. The results will determine the structure, rules, and procedures for the election.

'''Timeline''': Per the consensus developed in previous requests for comment, the electoral commission timetable is as follows:

*Nominations: {{#time:l 00:00, d F Y|{{Arbitration Committee candidate/data|2022|ecbegin}}}} until {{#time:l 23:59, d F Y|{{Arbitration Committee candidate/data|2022|ecnomclose}}-1 day}} (UTC)
*Evaluation period: {{#time:l 00:00, d F Y|{{Arbitration Committee candidate/data|2022|ecnomclose}}}} until {{#time:l 23:59, d F Y|{{Arbitration Committee candidate/data|2022|ecend}}-1 day}} (UTC)
*Commission selection: completed by {{#time:l 00:00, d F Y|{{Arbitration Committee candidate/data|2022|ecdeadline}}}} (UTC)

Per the consensus developed in previous request for comments, the arbitration committee election timetable is as follows:

*Nominations: {{#time:l 00:00, d F Y|{{Arbitration Committee candidate/data|2022|nombegin}}}} until {{#time:l 23:59, d F Y|{{Arbitration Committee candidate/data|2022|nomend}}-1 day}} (UTC)
*Setup period: {{#time:l 00:00, d F Y|{{Arbitration Committee candidate/data|2022|nomend}}}} to {{#time:l 23:59, d F Y|{{Arbitration Committee candidate/data|2022|begin}}-2 day}} (UTC)
*Voting period: {{#time:l 00:00, d F Y|{{Arbitration Committee candidate/data|2022|begin}}}} until {{#time:l 23:59, d F Y|{{Arbitration Committee candidate/data|2022|end}}-1day}} (UTC)
*Scrutineering: begins {{#time:l 00:00, d F Y|{{Arbitration Committee candidate/data|2022|end}}}} (UTC)

----{{anchor|Formatting}}
Use the following format below; post a new proposal at the BOTTOM of the page.
<pre>

''' Proposal number: Proposal name '''

Neutral description of proposal. ~~~~

''' Support (proposal name) '''

# Additional comments here ~~~~

''' Oppose (proposal name) '''

# 

''' Comments (proposal name) '''

*
----
</pre>

{{TOC limit|3}}

'''Proposals'''

''' Proposal 1: Shorten nomination period to 7 days '''

Reduce the length of the nomination period to 7 days, instead of 10 days. 

Since the dates of the nomination period are known far in advance, potential candidates have ample time to prepare their statements ahead of time. Thus a lengthy nomination period isn't needed. This will reduce the amount of time that the community will engage in speculation on the number of eventual candidates. [[User:Isaacl|isaacl]] ([[User talk:Isaacl|talk]]) 01:18, 3 August 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Detailed logarithmic timeline#rfc_5DBC8BB|Talk:Detailed logarithmic timeline]] expired 2022-09-05 17:01 ===
* Id: 5DBC8BB
* User: MrPersonHumanGuy
* Date: 2022-08-06 16:39:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1102938720|HIST 1102938720}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1108663689|HIST 1108663689}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
For context, here's a timeline of events:
* '''December 21, 2019''': [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=931869671&oldid=930666039&title=Detailed_logarithmic_timeline Eric Kvaalen introduces the entry "In general, protests of 2019.", with "protests of 2019" linking to the Wikipedia article ''Protests of 2019''.]
* '''June 15, 2020''': Spartaz deletes the ''[[Protests of 2019]]'' article following a [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Protests of 2019 (2nd nomination)|deletion discussion]] and [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=962700872&oldid=961054958&title=Detailed_logarithmic_timeline delinks "protests of 2019" afterwards.]
* '''August 19, 2020''': [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=973824603&oldid=969481219&title=Detailed_logarithmic_timeline Eric Kvaalen introduces an external link to ''Protests of 2019''<nowiki>'</nowiki>s entry on Deletionpedia.]
* '''July 18, 2021''': [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=1034230257&oldid=1033766642&title=Detailed_logarithmic_timeline Kuru removes the link.]
* '''July 21, 2021''': [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=1034703246&oldid=1034230257&title=Detailed_logarithmic_timeline Eric Kvaalen restores the link.]
* '''July 22, 2021''': [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Detailed_logarithmic_timeline&diff=1034928872&oldid=1034703246 Ionmars10 removes the link.]
* '''July 31, 2021''': [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Detailed_logarithmic_timeline&diff=1036382525&oldid=1035656200 Eric Kvaalen restores the link again.]
* '''November 28, 2021''': [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Detailed_logarithmic_timeline&diff=1057641652&oldid=1057450413 Kuru removes the link again.]
* '''December 27, 2021''': [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Detailed_logarithmic_timeline&diff=1062274385&oldid=1061946336 Eric Kvaalen restores the link again.]
* <small>'''April 9, 2022''': I start editing the article to expand the Future table.</small>
* '''April 23, 2022''': [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Detailed_logarithmic_timeline&diff=1084261348&oldid=1083397749 Kuru removes the link again.]
* '''July 27, 2022''': [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Detailed_logarithmic_timeline&diff=1100707009&oldid=1098597301 Eric Kvaalen restores the link again.]
* '''July 30, 2022''': [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Detailed_logarithmic_timeline&diff=1101441023&oldid=1101042271 I remove the link.]
* '''August 4, 2022''': [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Detailed_logarithmic_timeline&diff=next&oldid=1101441023 Eric Kvaalen restores the link again.]
The discussion I wish to start here concerns the "protests of 2019" entry and whether or not it should contain the aforementioned Deletionpedia link. ‚Äì [[User:MrPersonHumanGuy|MrPersonHumanGuy]] ([[User talk:MrPersonHumanGuy|talk]]) 16:39, 6 August 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Taylor Swift#rfc_ACFDE86|Talk:Taylor Swift]] expired 2022-09-05 23:01 ===
* Id: ACFDE86
* User: Tree Critter
* Date: 2022-08-06 22:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1102793179|MEDIA 1102793179}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1103239945|BIO 1103239945}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1108725617|BIO 1108725617}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1108725621|MEDIA 1108725621}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hi!

In a 2019 interview [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ellK-CXh7B4&ab_channel=GoodMorningAmerica] (it happens at 2:01) Taylor Swift stated "Starting November 2020 I can re-record albums one through five all over again" in reference to [[Taylor Swift|her masters controversy]]. [[User:Ippantekina]] and [[User:Binksternet]] both feel this is not an adequate source to add the recording date of "November 2020‚Äì" to the re-recorded songs.

[[User:Ippantekina]] disagrees because she does not explicitly mention ''Fearless'' or ''Red'' [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Begin_Again_(Taylor_Swift_song)&diff=prev&oldid=1102424478&diffmode=source], [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User_talk:Ippantekina#Taylor_re-recordings]. I disagree with this disagreement because she mentions her first five albums, which ''Fearless'' and ''Red'' fall under.

Despite [[User:Binksternet]] agreeing with me that she did not re-record these songs before November 2020 [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User_talk:Binksternet#??], they feel this is an example of [[WP:SYNTH]] because Taylor does not explicitly state every song in question. I believe this is an example of [[WP:NOTJUSTANYSYNTH]] because saying "album" is enough to imply the songs on the album.

Please watch the interview for yourself and come to your own conclusion on whether or not the songs' infoboxes should reflect having not been recorded prior to November 2020.

Thank you for taking the time. [[User:Tree Critter|Tree Critter]] ([[User talk:Tree Critter|talk]]) 22:26, 6 August 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Second Cold War#rfc_E2D25A0|Talk:Second Cold War]] expired 2022-09-06 16:01 ===
* Id: E2D25A0
* User: NickMartin
* Date: 2022-08-07 15:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Biology#rfc_B57F8AF|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Biology]] expired 2022-09-06 17:01 ===
* Id: B57F8AF
* User: BarrelProof
* Date: 2022-08-18 01:39:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1105012550|SCI 1105012550}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1105012557|STYLE 1105012557}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1108859639|SCI 1108859639}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1108859644|STYLE 1108859644}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Background''': A [[Wikipedia_talk:WikiProject_Biology/Archive_4#Consensus_how_scientific_names_are_displayed_in_the_lead_of_species_articles_listed_under_common_names|discussion was held in June‚ÄìJuly 2011]] that ended with a declaration of a consensus that stated, in part, that in an article about an organism, if the scientific name of the organism is not the title of the article, the scientific name should {{em|not}} be presented in boldface in the opening sentence{{snd}} i.e. that only italics should be used (ordinarily inside of parentheses). As far as I am aware, that consensus has not been formally overturned, and indeed many articles about organisms on Wikipedia do not use boldfacing for the scientific name of the organism. See, for example, the current versions of the [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Timber_rattlesnake&oldid=1103846852 Timber rattlesnake] article and the [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wild_turkey&oldid=1104936823 Wild turkey] article. Some articles do not even use boldface for the scientific name when it {{em|is}} the title of the article{{snd}} e.g. see the current version of the ''[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Crotalus_cerastes&oldid=1103869585 Crotalus cerastes]'' article. The general Wikipedia guideline about the boldfacing of topic names can be found at [[MOS:BOLD]] and [[MOS:BOLDSYN]], which say that boldfacing should be used for the topic name {{em|and for significant alternative names}} that redirect to the article, which appears to differ from that July 2011 conclusion. This question was recently discussed further at [[Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (fauna)#Boldface for common vs. scientific names]], wherein several editors suggested that the scientific name, since it is always one of the significant alternative names by which an organism is known and is practically always the name of a redirect when it is not the title of the article, should {{em|always}} be boldfaced when it is introduced.

'''The question''': In an article about an organism, should the scientific name of the organism {{em|always}} be presented in boldface (as well as italics) when it is introduced?

‚Äî&#8288;&#8202;&#8288;[[User:BarrelProof|BarrelProof]] ([[User talk:BarrelProof|talk]]) 01:39, 18 August 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Edward Faulks, Baron Faulks#rfc_06A9489|Talk:Edward Faulks, Baron Faulks]] expired 2022-09-06 22:01 ===

* Date: 2022-09-06 14:12:00

=== [[Wikipedia talk:What Wikipedia is not#rfc_B437E01|Wikipedia talk:What Wikipedia is not]] expired 2022-09-07 03:01 ===
* Id: B437E01
* Date: 2022-08-08 02:41:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1103035765|POLICY 1103035765}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1108939622|POLICY 1108939622}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should "just the notable ones" (bolded section) be removed from [[WP:NOTDIRECTORY]]?

{{tq|'''Simple listings''' without [[Wikipedia:Writing better articles#Provide context for the reader|contextual information]] showing encyclopedic merit. [[WP:DAB|Disambiguation pages]] (such as [[John Smith (disambiguation)|John Smith]]) are not intended to be complete listings of every person named John Smith''' - just the notable ones'''. Nor should listings such as the [[Telephone directory|white]] or [[yellow pages]] be replicated. See [[WP:LISTCRITERIA]] for more information.}} 02:41, 8 August 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Article for deletion#rfc_BAECD98|Template talk:Article for deletion]] expired 2022-09-08 11:01 ===
* Id: BAECD98
* Date: 2022-08-09 10:57:00

* RFC Text:

I am proposing to change the weight of the text inside the template to the following, to make these templates consistent with the speedy deletion templates.  Personally I find this text does not stand out to me and I fail to read it, which no doubt also happens to other editors, and the template erroniously removed from articles as a result.

"Feel free to improve the article, '''but do not remove this notice before the discussion is closed and do not blank the page'''. For more information, read the guide to deletion."

Your thoughts and consensus on this would be appreciated. [[User:Osarius|'''''Osarius''''']] 10:57, 9 August 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Exxon#rfc_3D240EA|Talk:Exxon]] expired 2022-09-11 01:01 ===
* Id: 3D240EA
* User: InvadingInvader
* Date: 2022-09-08 01:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1109423851|ECON 1109423851}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1109639976|ECON 1109639976}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I'm debating whether to propose a merger between the [[Exxon]] article and the [[ExxonMobil]] article. The article here is a bit short, and a majority of its content could be merged into [[ExxonMobil]] and/or a new article on the histories of both Exxon and Mobil before and after the 1999 merger (these two companies are the biggest direct descendants of Standard Oil save for Chevron).<br/>
There's a few big reasons why I'm thinking of a merger: <br/>
1. ExxonMobil is commonly referred to as Exxon, most likely because Exxon is first in the merged company's name<br/>
2. The merger didn't create a completely new company; ExxonMobil is in essence a merged continuation of Exxon<br/>
3. ExxonMobil already contains a lot of history on Exxon prior to the merger, including but not limited to the Valdez.<br/>
4. The merger was similar to the [[Merger of Sprint Corporation and T-Mobile US]], except that both brands survived.<br/>
I don't feel ready to propose the merger just yet, but rather survey editors on whether it should/could be done first. [[User:InvadingInvader|InvadingInvader]] ([[User talk:InvadingInvader|talk]]) 01:33, 8 September 2022 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
An editor reverted a support vs oppose section as "Wikipedia does not support abuse". Is it not against the rules to end discussion because you don't like a possible result? Another editor reverted the edit as they said a consensus had already been reached. I agree, except to the opposite end. There was a consensus for including the content. * Id: F655172
* User: 2804:248:f650:6600:86f:165c:bba5:8f4

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Recently there was controversy over what map or other image, if any, should be placed in the article's lead, eventually an RfC was held, with the conclusion that there was consensus against the proposed maps due to concerns over original research, but given that the only users who took part in it were ones who were already involved in the dispute, I thought it was appropriate to at least have further discussion on this issue.

I made some proposals which were already mentioned above:

# The world map based on The Man in the High Castle, which was recently removed: [[c:File:The Man in the High Castle Plausible World Map.png]]
# A world map based on Fatherland: [[c:File:Fatherland.png]]
# Another map based on Fatherland, but this time of Europe only, this was the one originally in the lead: [[c:File:Fatherland's 1964 Europe.jpg]]
# A model of the Volkshalle, which was to be built if Germany won: [[c:File:Bundesarchiv Bild 146-1986-029-02, "Germania", Modell "Gro√üe Halle".jpg]]
# A broader model of "Germania", the planned rebuilding of Berlin: [[c:File:Bundesarchiv Bild 146III-373, Modell der Neugestaltung Berlins ("Germania").jpg]]

Other suggestions would be welcomed. -- [[Special:Contributions/2804:248:f650:6600:86f:165c:bba5:8f4|2804:248:f650:6600:86f:165c:bba5:8f4]] ([[User talk:2804:248:f650:6600:86f:165c:bba5:8f4|talk]]) 03:35, 13 August 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Universal suffrage#rfc_ECDDAF2|Talk:Universal suffrage]] expired 2022-09-13 18:01 ===
* Id: ECDDAF2
* User: 51.9.184.124
* Date: 2022-08-06 11:51:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1108815998|HIST 1108815998}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1108816002|POL 1108816002}}

* RFC Text:

When did women gain Universal Suffrage (the ability to have the same rights as men to vote) in Switzerland? Was it when they were granted the right to vote at the federal level, but not the local level, in 1971? Or was it when women went to the supreme court and won the additional right to vote in local elections in 1990? --[[Special:Contributions/51.9.184.124|51.9.184.124]] ([[User talk:51.9.184.124|talk]]) 11:51, 6 August 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Sh?nen manga#rfc_58D7F5E|Talk:Sh?nen manga]] expired 2022-09-13 19:01 ===
* Id: 58D7F5E
* User: Morgan695
* Date: 2022-09-08 15:20:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1109210235|MEDIA 1109210235}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1110128689|MEDIA 1110128689}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
How should this article define the age range of ''sh≈çnen'' manga?

*An impasse has emerged on this article  over defining the age range of ''sh≈çnen '' manga, which can be reviewed in the discussion immediately above this RfC. ''A Brief History of Manga'' by [[Helen McCarthy]] defines the age range as 9 to 18, while ''Understanding Manga and Anime'' by Robin E. Brenner defines it at 12 to 18. The other sources provided by [[User:SG1994!]] supporting the 12-18 range are, in my view, plainly unreliable blogs. I propose that "''Sh≈çnen'' manga" under "Terminology and etymology" be revised to the following: {{tq|''Sh≈çnen'' manga refers to manga aimed at an audience of adolescent boys, with the primary target audience alternately defined as widely as 9 to 18 years old [McCarthy cite] and as narrowly as 12 to 18 years old. [Brenner cite] Of the four primary demographic...}} [[User:Morgan695|Morgan695]] ([[User talk:Morgan695|talk]]) 15:20, 8 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Brothers of Italy#rfc_8C8E0B9|Talk:Brothers of Italy]] expired 2022-09-16 16:01 ===
* Id: 8C8E0B9
* User: Vacant0
* Date: 2022-08-17 15:59:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1104929328|POL 1104929328}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1110639422|POL 1110639422}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
What would be the best option to solve the ongoing dispute regarding the ideologies in the infobox?
* '''Option 1:''' Include [[neo-fascism]] in the infobox, alongside [[national conservatism]] and [[right-wing populism]]. ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Brothers_of_Italy&oldid=1104358810 Example])
* '''Option 2:''' Include [[neo-fascism]] with a note that states that "FdI has been also described as post-fascist".
* '''Option 3:''' Include [[post-fascism]] (a redirect to neo-fascism) in the infobox. ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Brothers_of_Italy&oldid=1104858961 Example])
* '''Option 4:''' Exclude [[neo-fascism]] from the "Ideology section" and let it stay in the footnote instead. ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Brothers_of_Italy&oldid=1104874248#cnote_a Example])
* '''Option 5:''' Exclude [[neo-fascism]] from the Infobox completely. --[[User:Vacant0|Vacant0]] ([[User talk:Vacant0|talk]]) 15:59, 17 August 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Royalty and Nobility#rfc_20A5AAD|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Royalty and Nobility]] expired 2022-09-17 18:01 ===
* Id: 20A5AAD
* User: GoodDay
* Date: 2022-09-16 18:20:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1110665341|HIST 1110665341}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1110665343|POL 1110665343}}

* RFC Text:

I've noticed in a few "Titles & Styles" sections of bios, that there's at times inconsistencies on the dates. Most recently disputes have occurred at [[William, Prince of Wales]] & [[Prince George of Wales]], for example. So, how do we handle this? I think Prince William's bio would be a good focal point, given the multiple changes he's went through on September 8 & 9, 2022. 

Do we use ''end dates'' for titles, when a 'higher' title has been proclaimed? or do we continue to show the lower titles as continuing to be used? <br>

Note: The Scottish titles/styles are <u>not</u> being disputed, in term of their dates. [[User:GoodDay|GoodDay]] ([[User talk:GoodDay|talk]]) 18:20, 16 September 2022 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
How would you evaluate the reliability of Military-Today.com?

*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]]
[[User:Horse Eye&#39;s Back|Horse Eye&#39;s Back]] ([[User talk:Horse Eye&#39;s Back|talk]]) 16:47, 18 September 2022 (UTC)}}

I‚Äôd like to recommend that the basketball guideline add a numbered statement (in the first position) under ‚ÄúSignificant coverage is likely to exist for basketball figures if they:‚Äù

* Played at least one game in the National Basketball Association (NBA), existing 1946-present

Overwhelmingly it appears NBA players get significant coverage either through their NBA careers or college or other leagues. A new outcome in this discussion could have parallel impact at [[Trans man]]. The options are:
'''Proposal 1'''{{talkquote|A '''trans woman''' is a person who was [[assigned male at birth]] and has a female [[gender identity]].}}
'''Proposal 2 (''status quo'')''' {{talkquote|A '''trans woman''' is a [[woman]] who was [[assigned male at birth]].}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Geography#rfc_4B2D227|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Geography]] expired 2022-09-22 08:01 ===
* Id: 4B2D227
* User: Davidstewartharvey
* Date: 2022-08-23 07:11:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1106118525|HIST 1106118525}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1106118530|POL 1106118530}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1111672353|HIST 1111672353}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1111672361|POL 1111672361}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hi. I only come across this issue when I saw a discussion on the Talk page of [[Southend-on-Sea]] regarding the [[County Borough of Southend-on-Sea]] page. I raised this as an AFD, which basically has had little input other from myself and [[User talk:Crouch, Swale]], and then as a discussion on the [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Geography]], placing notices of the discussion on both the notability page for geography and the  [[WikiProject:Councils]] talk page. So far there has only been two people involved - guess who! 

As Wikipedia is a community and is governed by concensus, I have raised this AFD to bring clarity, as there seems to be no actual rules just opinion.

The first issue is the Metropolitan and Non metropolitan districts of England: What is their correct name? As evidenced from different sources the names are different: Take [[City of Chelmsford]], the Ordnance survey [https://data.ordnancesurvey.co.uk/doc/7000000000038907 district] says City of Chelmsford, the Office for National Statistics  [https://geoportal.statistics.gov.uk/documents/ons::local-authority-districts-counties-and-unitary-authorities-april-2021-map-in-united-kingdom-/about] says Chelmsford, GOV.uk (which lists them as Councils although the download page states it is metropolitan and non metropolitan districts) [https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/1026384/List_of_councils_in_England_2021.pdf] as Chelmsford City Council,  the Council tax: stock of properties, 2018 on gov.uk "Table CTSOP1.0: Number of properties by Council Tax band and region, county and local authority district" which comes from the Valuation Office Agency [https://www.gov.uk/government/statistics/council-tax-stock-of-properties-2018] says Chelmsford, or the Ministry of Housing,
Communities & Local Government Open data portal [https://opendatacommunities.org/atlas/resource?uri=http%3A%2F%2Fopendatacommunities.org%2Fid%2Fgeography%2Fadministration%2Fgb%2FK03000001] says Chelmsford. When you look at Southend-on-Sea, the name fluctuates between Southend-on-Sea and Southend-on-Sea Unitary Authority!

As the UK government seem to have an issue to what the naming conventions should be should we:

1. Go with current naming convention, based on Ordance Survey.
2. Go with the Ministry Ministry of Housing,
Communities & Local Government Open data portal.

Second Issue. Do we need to have separate pages for the local authority district and the local authority council? Or could these be combined ?

1. Keep separate pages for both district and council.
2. Merge pages together and name under a. The district or b. The council.

[[User:Davidstewartharvey|Davidstewartharvey]] ([[User talk:Davidstewartharvey|talk]]) 07:11, 23 August 2022 (UTC)}}

Yes, the headship is disputed, but pages like this exist for other heirs apparent and I think it should be the same deal in this case. --[[User:IndustryPlantCooper|IndustryPlantCooper]] ([[User talk:IndustryPlantCooper|talk]]) 14:38, 22 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Death of Mahsa Amini#rfc_0E8A890|Talk:Death of Mahsa Amini]] expired 2022-09-23 16:01 ===
* Id: 0E8A890
* User: Roj im
* Date: 2022-09-23 10:03:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1111870050|BIO 1111870050}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1111906261|BIO 1111906261}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Initially, there was her name in Kurdish. An editor removed it insisting that it was not a necessity. I discussed the matter, we didn't agree, there was a sort of edit warring, then we got a third opinion, we edited it as the third opinion suggested, the warring continued, the page got protected, a poll was started, the poll ended, the article was edited again as suggested by the poll results, the protection went away, an editor reverted the poll suggestions partially by editing the article directly without previous agreements, and then the poll pivoted from "to have her name in Kurdish or not" to "to have only one version her name in Kurdish or both" and "to have her name in Kurdish in the infobox or not". Now I want to know if the partial revert of the poll results by @[[User:Mitrayasna|Mitrayasna]] was a good thing or not. I think since we all agreed on that, it should be reverted. ‚Äî [[User:Roj im|Roj im]] ([[User talk:Roj im|talk]]) 10:03, 23 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:William, Prince of Wales#rfc_8B2FE09|Talk:William, Prince of Wales]] expired 2022-09-23 18:01 ===
* Id: 8B2FE09
* User: A.D.Hope
* Date: 2022-09-17 10:35:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1110767448|BIO 1110767448}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1110767453|STYLE 1110767453}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1110820194|HIST 1110820194}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1111922532|BIO 1111922532}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1111922533|HIST 1111922533}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1111922539|STYLE 1111922539}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'Titles and Styles' is a section in the articles of many royal figures, including British ones. Most include a bulleted list of titles and styles with a date range showing when the titles and styles were used. There are inconsistencies with these date ranges. For example, recent versions of this article have used:

* [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=William,_Prince_of_Wales&oldid=1110667639#Styles,_titles,_honours,_and_arms 8 September 2022 ‚Äì present: His Royal Highness The Duke of Cornwall and Cambridge]

and

* [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=William,_Prince_of_Wales&oldid=1110701241#Styles,_titles,_honours,_and_arms 8 ‚Äì 9 September: His Royal Highness The Duke of Cornwall and Cambridge]

I believe the root of the issue is that titles and styles are different things with incompatible dating conventions. 

I would appreciate '''comment on how the 'Titles and Styles' section of this article should be formatted or changed.''' Thank you.

''Note'': a similar RfC has been made at [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Royalty and Nobility#RFC: Titles & Styles|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Royalty and Nobility#RFC: Titles & Styles]] by @[[User:GoodDay|GoodDay]]. I am opening this RfC on the advice given there that this is a more appropriate place to request comment. [[User:A.D.Hope|A.D.Hope]] ([[User talk:A.D.Hope|talk]]) 10:35, 17 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:People's Mojahedin Organization of Iran#rfc_7C98FBC|Talk:People's Mojahedin Organization of Iran]] expired 2022-09-24 14:01 ===
* Id: 7C98FBC
* User: Fad Ariff
* Date: 2022-09-21 12:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1111529539|POL 1111529539}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1112067500|POL 1112067500}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
<s>Should the following sentence be removed from the article? </s>

<s>{{tq|"During the second phase of the ideological revolution, all members were forced to surrender their individuality to the organization"|}}</s><ref>{{cite book|title=Revisionism and Diversification in New Religious Movements |first=Masoud |last=Banisdar |date=2013 |chapter=The Metamorphosis of MEK|publisher=Ashgate Publishing|editor-first=Eileen |editor-last=Barker|isbn=9781409462309 |page=174}}</ref>

<s>'''Yes''' or '''Nay'''? [[User:Fad Ariff|Fad Ariff]] ([[User talk:Fad Ariff|talk]]) 12:16, 21 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Cooperative#rfc_AA1E878|Talk:Cooperative]] expired 2022-09-24 21:01 ===
* Id: AA1E878
* User: IohannesChicaginiensis
* Date: 2022-08-25 20:45:00

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1106669988|ECON 1106669988}}

{{rfcquote|text=
In the article [[Cooperative]], should the term "cooperative" be taken in a '''technical & historical''' sense or a '''general & natural''' sense? [[User:IohannesChicaginiensis|IohannesChicaginiensis]] ([[User talk:IohannesChicaginiensis|talk]]) 20:45, 25 August 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Categorization#rfc_C2601B1|Wikipedia talk:Categorization]] expired 2022-09-24 21:01 ===
* Id: C2601B1
* User: Jweiss11
* Date: 2022-08-25 20:30:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1106670011|POLICY 1106670011}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1112134910|POLICY 1112134910}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[[WP:CAT#T]] states "Templates are not articles, and thus do not belong in ''content categories''." While templates are certainly not articles, they often contain content, in some cases content that appears in no other place on Wikipedia, e.g. [[Template:1933 Southeastern Conference football standings]]. From a practical standpoint, it may useful to navigate directly from a content category like [[:Category:Southeastern Conference football]] to a category like [[:Category:Southeastern Conference football templates]] and its subcats like [[:Category:Southeastern Conference football standings templates]], which contain templates related the subject of Southeastern Conference football. After all, the point of categories is to organize things by batching related things together and helping users find them, right?

In late 2020, we had a discussion on this talk page concerning this issue; see [[Wikipedia talk:Categorization/Archive 18#procedure makes the category tree worse, both coming and going]]. Participants included {{u|Tahc}}, {{u|Dr Greg}}, {{u|Michael Bednarek}}, {{u|andrybak}}, {{u|Oculi}}, {{u|Fayenatic london}}, {{u|DexDor}}, and me. We had substantial support there for changing the existing policy. What does the wider community think? Should we change this policy?

Thanks, [[User:Jweiss11|Jweiss11]] ([[User talk:Jweiss11|talk]]) 20:30, 25 August 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of dignitaries at the state funeral of Elizabeth II#rfc_42A51E1|Talk:List of dignitaries at the state funeral of Elizabeth II]] expired 2022-09-25 00:02 ===

* Date: 2022-09-23 20:02:00

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1112161000|POL 1112161000}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
*'''A''' Population of country determines. Larger countries get a separate section
*'''B''' Economic size of country determines. Richer countires get a separate section
*'''C''' Racial makeup of country determines with most like English getting a separate section
*'''D''' Alphabetical
*'''E''' No country gets a section except the UK
*'''F''' Only 3 countries get a section
[[User:CandyStalnak|CandyStalnak]] ([[User talk:CandyStalnak|talk]]) 20:02, 23 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:James Gordon (British Army officer, died 1783)#rfc_DC88E41|Talk:James Gordon (British Army officer, died 1783)]] expired 2022-09-25 11:01 ===
* Id: DC88E41
* User: Anne Ammundsen
* Date: 2022-08-26 10:44:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1107154417|BIO 1107154417}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1112245690|BIO 1112245690}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Wishing to resolve the issue of whether or not the [[James Gordon (British Army officer, died 1783)|James Gordon]] article should have a link included to a photograph of the memorial created in his mother's honour, commissioned by his brother, Andrew Gordon. I would suggest: ''"In 1792, Gordon's younger brother, Andrew, erected a memorial to their mother, which reads: "M<sup>rs</sup> Elizabeth Glen widow of James Gordon, Esq<sup>r</sup> of Ellon, died 7<sup>th</sup> March MDCCXCII, aged 80 years. To the memory of a beloved parent this monument of filial piety is erected by Lieu<sup>t</sup> Gen<sup>l</sup> Andrew Gordon".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://images.findagrave.com/photos/2012/277/98279086_134938572911.jpg|title=Image of monumental inscription|publisher=Find a Grave|accessdate=19 August 2022}}</ref>
James Gordon died in America at the end of the Revolution, predeceasing his mother by two decades. [[User:Anne Ammundsen|Anne]] ([[User talk:Anne Ammundsen|talk]]) 10:44, 26 August 2022 (UTC)}}

There are two questions:
#For the purposes of Wikipedia (i.e. not limited to this article), is the name of the British currency "pound sterling", "pound", or "sterling"?

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_80E45C6|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2022-09-27 23:01 ===
* Id: 80E45C6
* User: Khirurg
* Date: 2022-09-27 02:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1112597898|HIST 1112597898}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1112752764|HIST 1112752764}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There have recently been a lot of problems in the Balkan topic area regarding the use of Albanian author Pellumb Xhufi. While ostensibly an academic, he has been repeatedly criticized for "virulently Anti-Greek positions" [https://books.google.com/books?id=8f0OEAAAQBAJ&pg=PA65&dq=xhufi+albanian&hl=el&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwi38I23_ur5AhXCM1kFHWcCAiYQ6AF6BAgGEAI#v=snippet&q=%22himself%20an%20active%20politician%20who%20has%20served%22&f=false] and nationalism by various scholars [https://iog.univie.ac.at/fileadmin/user_upload/i_iog/ueber_uns/personen_dokumente/Schmitt_Onlinepublikationen/Regionenband.pdf] (search for "nationalistischer Ton (P√´llumb Xhufi"). While publications in peer reviewed journals are considered reliable no matter the author, problems arise regarding the use of works by Xhufi that are published by publishers of unknown reliability and journals for which the level of peer-review is unclear. The issue has been festering for a while, and even though I've already posted twice here regarding this author, nothing conclusive was decided. I think the best way to resolve the question is via RfC with the following options.

'''Option 1. Publications by Xhufi not in international peer-reviewed journals should not used at all on Wikipedia.'''

'''Option 2. Publications by Xhufi not in international peer-reviewed journals should only be used to source non-controversial claims and facts.'''

'''Option 3. Publications by Xhufi not in international peer-reviewed journals can only be used to source controversial claims and facts with attribution ("According to P. Xhufi...). Non-controversial claims and facts do not need attribution.'''

'''Option 4. Publications by Xhufi not in international peer-reviewed journals can be used without attribution.'''

Please note again that the above applies only to publications by Xhufi not in international peer-reviewed journals. "Controversial" would be anything that is typically controversial (e.g. ethnicity, demographics), especially in relation to other sources. In order to achieve meaningful consensus it would be nice to have buy in from as many non-Balkan editors as possible. [[User:Khirurg|Khirurg]] ([[User talk:Khirurg|talk]]) 02:18, 27 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject National Football League#rfc_7963626|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject National Football League]] expired 2022-09-28 02:01 ===
* Id: 7963626
* User: Useight
* Date: 2022-09-12 16:45:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1110341933|SOC 1110341933}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1112774243|SOC 1112774243}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the tables with the combined regular season and playoff statistics be deleted?

This keeps happening on a number of pages (primarily on statistics in which Tom Brady would be on the top of the leaderboard).  See:

* [[List of National Football League career passing completions leaders#Most completions and attempts, including playoff games]]
* [[List of National Football League career passing touchdowns leaders#Most career touchdown passes including playoff games]]
* [[List of National Football League career passing yards leaders#Players with the most career passing yards including playoff games]]

There may be other articles with the same problem.  The NFL does not combine regular season and post-season statistics.  See, for example, page 622 of the 2022 Official National Football League Record & Fact Book (PDF found here: https://operations.nfl.com/updates/the-game/2022-nfl-record-and-fact-book/).  Combining the statistics constitutes original research.  I am opening this discussion to talk about the removal of combined regular season and post-season stats from all articles within the scope of the NFL WikiProject.  [[User:Useight|Useight]] ([[User talk:Useight|talk]]) 16:45, 12 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Category talk:Books by publisher#rfc_A9A944D|Category talk:Books by publisher]] expired 2022-09-30 18:01 ===
* Id: A9A944D
* User: Wingedserif
* Date: 2022-08-31 17:21:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1107752511|MEDIA 1107752511}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1113279029|MEDIA 1113279029}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I have attempted to find any consensus or discussion of the guidance listed at the top of the category, which says "Book articles should appear in subcategories for the publishers of their first or simultaneous editions including paperback originals, their major revised editions, and their translations ‚Äî not for the publishers of reprints or reissues that differ by minor revisions or by nationality. Books with simultaneous publication in various countries may be listed with each publisher." I couldn't find any, but the criteria was first introduced with [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Category:Books_by_publisher&oldid=413796252 this edit].

When, if ever, would it be appropriate to include reprints in this category? ‚Äî<u>''[[User:Wingedserif|Wingedserif]]''</u> ([[User talk:Wingedserif|talk]]) 17:21, 31 August 2022 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Question 1: Should the letter[https://www.cnn.com/2022/08/02/politics/economists-democrats-package-downward-pressure-inflation/index.html]<s>[https://www.forbes.com/sites/rhettbuttle/2022/08/03/experts-agree-the-inflation-reduction-act-accomplishes-a-lot-for-small-business-and-working-families/]</s>[https://apnews.com/article/inflation-nato-biden-climate-and-environment-7bc6644107e4ce365ab9e225c0591b5c][<small>forbes is unreliable so swapping for ap '''[[User:Andrevan|Andre]]'''<span style="border:2px solid #073642;background:rgb(255,156,0);background:linear-gradient(90deg, rgba(255,156,0,1) 0%, rgba(147,0,255,1) 45%, rgba(4,123,134,1) 87%);">[[User_talk:Andrevan|üöê]]</span></small>] signed by 126 economists, which asserts this bill reduces inflation, be included* in the article?
*'''Option 1a''': include in the '''"Reactions"''' section
*'''Option 1b''': include in the '''"Impact"''' section
*'''Option 2''': do not include this letter at all

Question 2: Should the letter[https://thehill.com/opinion/finance/3594889-the-inflation-reduction-act-not-the-big-win-media-dems-declare/][https://reason.com/2022/08/08/senate-passes-740-billion-inflation-reduction-act-that-will-probably-make-inflation-worse/][https://www.foxbusiness.com/politics/schumer-calls-economists-wrong-who-cautioning-manchins-spending-bill-increase-inflation][https://www.afr.com/world/north-america/americans-are-likely-to-have-long-memories-on-inflation-20220809-p5b8kt]<small>I added the AFR citation. [[User:X-Editor|X-Editor]] ([[User talk:X-Editor|talk]])</small> signed by 230 economists, which asserts this bill does not reduce inflation, be included* in the article?
*'''Option 1a''': include in the '''"Reactions"''' section
*'''Option 1b''': include in the '''"Impact"''' section
*'''Option 2''': do not include this letter at all
'''[[User:Andrevan|Andre]]'''<span style="border:2px solid #073642;background:rgb(255,156,0);background:linear-gradient(90deg, rgba(255,156,0,1) 0%, rgba(147,0,255,1) 45%, rgba(4,123,134,1) 87%);">[[User_talk:Andrevan|üöê]]</span> 14:29, 9 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Classical music#rfc_BE5479C|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Classical music]] expired 2022-10-09 16:01 ===
* Id: BE5479C
* User: Why? I Ask
* Date: 2022-09-09 15:56:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1111018125|SOC 1111018125}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1124968103|SOC 1124968103}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Recently, I have been looking through Wikipedia's lists of instrumental repertoire and have found that some do not comply with the project's guidelines. As such, I have either merged the article to its parent page or started an AfD discussion depending on what I best felt was needed for the article. However, per [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Flute repertoire]], some editors thought it'd be best to start a wider discussion on how to move forward with these lists.

So how should lists of instrumental repertoire be treated on Wikipedia?
*'''Option 1''': No lists of repertoire 
*'''Option 2''': Lists of notable repertoire based on sources and the existence of Wikipedia pages
*'''Option 3''': Lists of compositions that try to include every piece for that instrument

~ [[User:Why? I Ask|Why? I Ask]] ([[User talk:Why? I Ask|talk]]) 15:56, 9 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_BBFA0C4|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2022-10-09 17:01 ===
* Id: BBFA0C4
* User: Horse Eye&#39;s Back
* Date: 2022-09-10 20:42:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1109603875|PROP 1109603875}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1115311308|PROP 1115311308}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
What best describes globalsecurity.org's reliability?

*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]]
[[User:Horse Eye&#39;s Back|Horse Eye&#39;s Back]] ([[User talk:Horse Eye&#39;s Back|talk]]) 20:42, 10 September 2022 (UTC)}}
