=== [[Talk:Ceres (dwarf planet)#rfc_C39F639|Talk:Ceres (dwarf planet)]] expired 2022-10-09 20:01 ===
* Id: C39F639
* User: Fyunck(click)
* Date: 2022-09-13 23:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1110163900|SCI 1110163900}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1115094528|SCI 1115094528}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
As the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Ceres_(dwarf_planet)#ENGVAR discussion above illustrated], there are reasonable reasons for using either English variant in the article. It appears to have started in American English (semimajor rather than semi-major), when more than a stub it may have been both American and British English (hard to tell), and when first nominated as a good article it looks to be a mix (colour but neighborhood) with American dates. When it made "good article" it was still a mix of usage and dates. When it made featured article it was still a mixture of styles plus it had American dates. It went through years of demotions. In 2021 it was relisted as a good article... American English but British dates. That has stayed ever since, until yesterday. Having both styles in one article is messy for an encyclopedia so we should settle on one type and use it throughout. Yesterday someone changed it all to British English and today someone added the template "British English Only." This is a level 4 vital article and a former featured article; current and past good article. There should be consensus before adding such a permanent template to this article so I'm attempting it here. [[User:Fyunck(click)|Fyunck(click)]] ([[User talk:Fyunck(click)|talk]]) 23:07, 13 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Football#rfc_5A2C59B|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Football]] expired 2022-10-11 19:01 ===
* Id: 5A2C59B
* User: Dr Salvus
* Date: 2022-09-11 18:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1109764177|SOC 1109764177}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1109773231|BIO 1109773231}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1115492198|BIO 1115492198}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1115492200|SOC 1115492200}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Background''': We have always categorised players by clubs that they have signed for, whether or not they have played, and whether or not they have been professional, amateur, youth etc. Neither I, nor many WP:FOOTY members like the fact that we put categories on players who haven't played for the first team. [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Football/Archive 151#Players who have played for the reserve team but haven't ever for the youth sectors nor for the first team|We'd arleady discussed on in early February, finding no concensus]].

How should we categorise footballer who just played for a team at youth level? I'll make a second survey (after the one held in February)

#Inserting a team's category for whom he only played at youth level (what we currently do)
#Not inserting a team's category for whom he only played at youth level
#Inserting a team's category for whom he's ever signed a professional contract
#Inserting the category for teams inserted in the "Senior career" of the footballer's infobox
#Creating subcategories for players such as: Juventus F.C. first-team players, Juventus Next Gen players, Juventus F.C. Youth Sector players, Juventus F.C. (women) players and Juventus F.C. (women) Youth Sector. [[:Category:Juventus F.C. players]] would still exist, but being composed by the aforementioned subcategories. 
#Any other suggestion. (Specify below)

[[User:Dr Salvus|<b style="font-family: Verdana; color: #6633FF;">Dr</b>]] [[User talk:Dr Salvus|<b style="font-family: Verdana; color: #6633FF;">Salvus</b>]] 18:18, 11 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Biography#rfc_73BACE2|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Biography]] expired 2022-10-13 05:01 ===
* Id: 73BACE2
* User: A.D.Hope
* Date: 2022-09-23 18:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1111930463|BIO 1111930463}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1111930466|HIST 1111930466}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1117817095|BIO 1117817095}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1117817097|HIST 1117817097}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Many articles related to British royalty (and possiby others) contain a section on their titles and styles, for example those at [[Charles III#Titles, styles, honours and arms|Charles III]], [[Anne, Princess Royal#Titles, styles, honours and arms|Anne, Princess Royal]], and [[Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother#Titles, styles, honours and arms|Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother]]. Within them titles and styles are usually presented in a single subsection, with a bulleted list of titles and styles and the dates when they were used.

An [[Talk:William, Prince of Wales#RfC on Titles and Styles|RfC recently occured at William, Prince of Wales]] about how to organise these sections. The broad consensus was that titles and styles are different things and should therefore not be combined into a single subsection, as this is confusing.

'''I am requesting comment on whether 'Titles and Styles' sections should contain separate 'Titles' and 'Styles' subsections, and any other relevant comments on how these sections might be organised.''' Thank you! [[User:A.D.Hope|A.D.Hope]] ([[User talk:A.D.Hope|talk]]) 18:05, 23 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Biography#rfc_9BC7DFF|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Biography]] expired 2022-10-13 05:01 ===

* Date: 2022-09-13 04:31:00

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1110027534|STYLE 1110027534}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1110027535|POLICY 1110027535}}

{{rfcquote|text=
How should we list the birthplace of individuals born in occupied and illegally annexed territory, such as [[Kuwait Governorate|Iraqi-annexed Kuwait]]?

*'''A''': List the legitimate controller (eg, Kuwait)
*'''B''': List the occupier (eg, Iraq)
*'''C''': List the name most commonly used by reliable sources to describe where the individual was born

04:31, 13 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Circumcision and HIV#rfc_C5B911D|Talk:Circumcision and HIV]] expired 2022-10-13 16:01 ===

* User: KlayCax
* Date: 2022-10-07 16:25:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1114664194|HIST 1114664194}}

* RFC Text:

The two questions asked are:

* Is there a ''general'' consensus in the scientific community that circumcision reduces HIV/AIDS transmission in high-risk contexts: particularly sub-Saharan Africa?
* Is the strikethroughed material [[WP: DUE]] for the the lead?''' (e.g. version #1) '''In particular, the wording that has been struckthrough by Prcc27: who argues there is a substantive debate in the scientific community over the issue of circumcision's prophylactic effects against HIV/AIDS in the context of high risk populations?

Leading to the question: 

* Which version is the best? Version #1, #2, or #3?

=== [[Template talk:Edit taxonomy#rfc_77491FE|Template talk:Edit taxonomy]] expired 2022-10-15 08:01 ===
* Id: 77491FE
* User: Sdkb
* Date: 2022-09-15 07:06:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1110407117|SCI 1110407117}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1110407120|STYLE 1110407120}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1116186207|SCI 1116186207}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1116186209|STYLE 1116186209}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This RfC concerns the icon that should be used in the infobox for organism articles, which when clicked takes one to a page that allows one to edit the taxonomic classification. Since 2011, it has been [[:File:Red Pencil Icon.png]] at 16px ([[File:Red Pencil Icon.png]]). For examples, clicking the icon in the infobox at [[Acacia pycnantha]] leads to [[Template:Taxonomy/Acacia]]. It appears on more than 300,000 pages. In discussion above from earlier this year, editors proposed various changes to the icon, which are reflected in the elements below.

Please !vote on your preferred format for the icon by indicating your stance on each of these three elements:
*'''Style/color''': Skeuomorphic ([[File:Red Pencil Icon.png]], status quo), Red ([[File:OOjs UI icon edit-ltr-destructive.svg|16px]]), Black ([[File:OOjs UI icon edit-ltr.svg|16px]]), Blue ([[File:OOjs UI icon edit-ltr-progressive.svg|16px]]), or Other
*'''Size''': 16px ([[File:OOjs UI icon edit-ltr-progressive.svg |frameless |text-top |16px]], status quo), 15px ([[File:OOjs UI icon edit-ltr-progressive.svg |frameless |text-top |15px]]), 12px ([[File:OOjs UI icon edit-ltr-progressive.svg |frameless |text-top |12px]]), 10px ([[File:OOjs UI icon edit-ltr-progressive.svg |frameless |text-top |10px]]), or Other
*'''Text''': No Text (status quo), Plain Text ([[File:OOjs UI icon edit-ltr-progressive.svg |frameless |text-top |16px |link=Template:Taxonomy/Plantae]] [[Template:Taxonomy/Plantae|edit]]), or Bracketed Text ([[File:OOjs UI icon edit-ltr-progressive.svg |frameless |text-top |16px |link=Template:Taxonomy/Plantae]] <span class="mw-editsection plainlinks"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><span style="color:#002bb8;">[{{fullurl:Template:Taxonomy/Plantae|action=edit}} edit]</span><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span>)
You may also !vote for no icon to be used, or for some other idea. ‚Äì <span style="color:#AAA"><small>&#123;{u&#124;</small><span style="border-radius:9em;padding:0 5px;background:#088">[[User:Sdkb|<span style="color:#FFF">'''Sdkb'''</span>]]</span><small>}&#125;</small></span>‚ÄØ<sup>[[User talk:Sdkb|'''talk''']]</sup> 07:06, 15 September 2022 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
The following 2 quotes were removed from the article:
{{Quote box
|quote  = The biggest myth, though, is that pit bulls have danger in their DNA ‚Äî going back to the original fighting ‚Äúpits‚Äù in turn-of-the-century New York City through to the dog-fighting rings of recent decades ‚Äî bred so that they‚Äôre born to kill. 

But as a geneticist explains in ‚ÄúPit Bull,‚Äù the likelihood that a dog bred for the worst behavior imaginable could somehow pass on its unique genetic heritage without it being diluted is ‚Äúabsolutely ludicrous.‚Äù Besides, dog aggression, as Dickey points out, is largely considered to be influenced most by a dog‚Äôs early development, and how it‚Äôs been socialized with other dogs and humans. ~Kelly Lauerman<ref name="Lauerman 2016">{{cite web | last=Lauerman | first=Kerry | title=It‚Äôs time to stop demonizing pit bulls | website=Washington Post | date=2016-05-20 | url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/animalia/wp/2016/05/20/pit-bull-rescue-mission-restoring-a-bad-dogs-good-name/ | access-date=2022-09-13}}</ref>
|width = 90%
|align= center
|bgcolor= #FFACD
}}
And
{{Quote box
|quote  = Any dog can be trained to be a bad dog, just as they can trained to be a good dog.
|source = ~Bill Lambert, The Kennel Club, ''Staffordshire bull terriers: A question of class?'' [[BBC]] (2015)<ref name="Potts 2015">{{cite web | last=Potts | first=Lauren | title=Staffordshire bull terriers: A question of class? | website=BBC News | date=24 January 2015 | url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-30902078 | access-date=12 February 2022}}</ref>
|width = 60%
|align= center
|bgcolor= #FFACD
}}

Should they be allowed to remain in the article?  
*Option 1: Yes 
*Option 2: No.

How would you evaluate the reliability of Military-Today.com?

*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]]

=== [[Talk:Reactions to the death of Elizabeth II#rfc_A99DBE7|Talk:Reactions to the death of Elizabeth II]] expired 2022-10-17 18:01 ===
* Id: A99DBE7
* Date: 2022-09-17 17:02:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1110813475|HIST 1110813475}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1110813477|SOC 1110813477}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1116658217|HIST 1116658217}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1116658225|SOC 1116658225}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Seeking resolve''' to a dispute on '''whether the opening lead paragraph should have any sort of reference to republican/abolition discourse/reactions based on the weight of content (reactions to the death) in the article'''. This RfC is '''primarily about whether there should be any mention of it in the first place or none at all by determing the weight of the article's content'''. Though specific wording might be suggested in proposed revisions as a by‚Äìproduct of the discussion process, '''this RfC is ''not'' primarily about selecting a revision on its specific wording''' but about if the '''wider discourse that it relates to the paragraph''' should be mentioned in any type of wording at all. As a starting point, if you wish to see an example revision of an opening lead paragraph with some sort of mention to these concepts, see this [[Special:Permalink/1110693943|old edit]]. If you wish to see an example revision of an opening lead with no mention at all to these concepts, see [[Special:Permalink/1110804144|the article's current revision]]. In summary, '''yes or no''' ‚Äì no maintains the current paragraph as it exist now, yes means there is a change to include some sort of summary mentioning this discourse/reactions in the opening lead paragraph (how and what comes afterwards if we cross that bridge). '''17:02, 17 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Polo#rfc_12464E1|Talk:Polo]] expired 2022-10-20 10:01 ===
* Id: 12464E1
* User: Haoreima
* Date: 2022-09-20 09:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1111311375|HIST 1111311375}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1111311377|SOC 1111311377}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1117181069|HIST 1117181069}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1117181073|SOC 1117181073}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Please comment on whether shall we add the two different facts mentioned in [[Guinness World Records]] as well as [[Encyclopedia Britannica]] or add either only one! 
The origin of polo is said to be "Persia (Iran)" by [[Encyclopedia Britannica]] but the [[Guinness World Records]] says the origin of polo is "Manipur". 
The [[Guinness World Records]] clarified the record of the origin of polo as [[Manipur]] in its 1991 edition, from its former record, [[Persia]] mentioned in 1984 edition.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Italian seal on Manipur polo origin - Milan-based writer to visit Imphal to collect material for book on game's history|url=https://www.telegraphindia.com/north-east/italian-seal-on-manipur-polo-origin-milan-based-writer-to-visit-imphal-to-collect-material-for-book-on-game-s-history/cid/791135|access-date=2022-09-17|website=www.telegraphindia.com}}</ref> 
In the 1991 edition of Guinness World Records, it states {{quote|Polo can be traced to origins in Manipur state c. 3100 B.C., when it was played as Sagol Kangjei. Other claims are of it being of Persian origin, having been played as pulu c. 525 B.C.<ref>{{Cite book |last=McFarlan |first=Donald |url=https://books.google.co.in/books?id=yPfPrgK21okC&q=1991+manipur+Guinness+Book+of+Records&dq=1991+manipur+Guinness+Book+of+Records&hl=en&newbks=1&newbks_redir=0&source=gb_mobile_search&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwiK6o2HwJ76AhU06jgGHdi5ClsQ6AF6BAgCEAM#1991%20manipur |title=Guinness Book of World Records 1991 |last2=McWhirter |first2=Norris |publisher=Bantam Books |year=1991 |isbn=978-0-553-28954-1 |pages=288 |language=en |quote=Polo can be traced to origins in Manipur state c. 3100 B.C., when it was played as Sagol Kangjei.}}</ref>}}
The same Guinness World Records' fact is re highlighted in various renowned newspapers and magazines like these - <ref>{{Cite web |last=sportstract |title=Guinness Book of World Records 1991 says ‚ÄúPolo can be traced to origins in Manipur state c. 3100 B.C., when it was played as Sagol Kangjei‚Äù ‚Äì SportsTract |url=https://sportstract.com/guinness-book-of-world-records-1991-says-polo-can-be-traced-to-origins-in-manipur-state-c-3100-b-c-when-it-was-played-as-sagol-kangjei/ |access-date=2022-09-17 |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2012-11-21 |title=US museum unveils exhibit on Manipur polo history {{!}} Guwahati News |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/guwahati/us-museum-unveils-exhibit-on-manipur-polo-history/articleshow/17306801.cms |access-date=2022-09-18 |website=[[The Times of India]] |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=MANIPUR: The Birthplace of Modern Polo |url=https://www.magzter.com/stories/Fashion/Urban-Melange/MANIPUR-The-Birthplace-of-Modern-Polo |access-date=2022-09-18 |website=www.magzter.com |publisher=[[Magzter]] |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=The Pony Returns - Indian Express |url=http://archive.indianexpress.com/news/the-pony-returns/1040905/ |access-date=2022-09-18 |website=archive.indianexpress.com |publisher=[[Indian Express]]}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Pal |first=Sanchari |date=2017-01-30 |title=Manipur's Ponies Are on the Brink of Extinction. And This Sporting Event Could Save Them! |url=https://www.thebetterindia.com/84306/manipur-pony-polo-tournament-sagol-kangjei/ |access-date=2022-09-18 |website=[[The Better India]] |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Staff |date=2007-04-27 |title=Pony on verge of extinction in the land of Polo |url=https://www.oneindia.com/2007/04/27/pony-on-verge-of-extinction-in-the-land-of-polo-1177657538.html |access-date=2022-09-18 |website=www.oneindia.com |publisher=[[Oneindia]] |language=en}}</ref>
At the same time, Encyclopedia Britannica says {{quote|polo was first played in Persia (Iran) at dates given from the 6th century BC to the 1st century AD.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.britannica.com/sports/polo | title=Polo &#124; sport &#124; Britannica}}</ref>}} 
I respect both the sources and I want both information to be added in the article citing their sources properly. The problem is one editor challenges the authenticity of Guinness World Records, first saying it's not said by Guinness, and later claiming that even though Guinness mentioned it, the fact is not possible. --[[User:Haoreima|Haoreima]] ([[User talk:Haoreima|talk]]) 09:12, 20 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Lavender oil#rfc_51C2BE7|Talk:Lavender oil]] expired 2022-10-20 22:01 ===
* Id: 51C2BE7
* User: Pyrrho the Skipper
* Date: 2022-09-20 21:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1111416234|SCI 1111416234}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1117283134|SCI 1117283134}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Talk Page discussion directly above. Regarding the first sentence in [[Lavender oil#Adverse effects|Adverse Effects]]. 

Based on the sources, which way should it read?
 
The '''bold''' is the constested part:
 
'''Option 1''' {{tq|If ingested, lavender oil is poisonous '''in amounts as small as 5 millilitres (0.18 imp fl oz; 0.17 US fl oz)''' due to its constituents linalyl acetate and linalool.}}
 
'''Option 2''' {{tq|If ingested, lavender oil is poisonous due to its constituents linalyl acetate and linalool.}}

'''Option 3''' Something else?
 
The sources used for this claim about 5ml for lavender oil are:
 
1. [https://www.rch.org.au/clinicalguide/guideline_index/Essential_Oil_Poisoning/ this]
 
2. [https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.5694/mja2.50403 this]
 
3. [https://medlineplus.gov/ency/article/002711.htm this]
 
Please read the sources and decide if they support the statement about lavender oil, specifically. [[User:Pyrrho the Skipper|Pyrrho the Skipper]] ([[User talk:Pyrrho the Skipper|talk]]) 21:33, 20 September 2022 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the Basque spelling of Elcano's name be rendered in bold in the opening sentence? There is a dispute over this, with one editor maintaining that [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Juan_Sebasti%C3%A1n_Elcano&diff=1111422257&oldid=1111395451 "it's distracting]. [[MOS:BOLDALTNAMES]] tells us that bolding is appropriate for "significant alternative names (which should usually also redirect to the article)". I note that [[Elkano]] indeed redirects to our article; the only point of contention I see here is about "significant". Editors are asked to be '''concise'''. === [[Template talk:Infobox animanga#rfc_7FABB36|Template talk:Infobox animanga]] expired 2022-10-23 02:01 ===
* Id: 7FABB36
* User: Gotitbro
* Date: 2022-09-23 01:20:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1111811947|MEDIA 1111811947}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1111811952|SOC 1111811952}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1111811955|TECH 1111811955}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1117687503|MEDIA 1117687503}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1117687508|SOC 1117687508}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1117687510|TECH 1117687510}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the "licensee" and "network_en" parameters from {{t|Infobox animanga/Video}} be removed? 
*Proposing this for {{t|Infobox animanga/Video}}, and coming here after the successful implementation of [[Template talk:Infobox television channel#RfC for removal of "Availability" section]].

:This template lists the English licensees of anime (television and film). Considering that this is a subcategory of the broader television and films, none of whose templates ({{t|Infobox television}} and {{t|Infobox film}}) specifically list English "licensees" or "networks", this exception for anime is incongruous and aberrant with the rest of the enwiki. The information contained herein appears mostly unencyclopedic per [[WP:NOTDIRECTORY]] and [[WP:NOTINDISCRIMINATE]] and from what I have seen serves no useful purpose but to clutter articles.

:Any notable case of release by licensed broadcasters/film distributors can be noted in the article body (if relevant), as is the case for other films and television. I am not including the "publisher_en" counterpart of {{t|Infobox animanga/Print}}, as it appears to have precedent at {{t|Infobox book}} (though not at {{t|Infobox comic book title}}). [[User:Gotitbro|Gotitbro]] ([[User talk:Gotitbro|talk]]) 01:20, 23 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of longest-reigning monarchs#rfc_4D6E9E6|Talk:List of longest-reigning monarchs]] expired 2022-10-23 03:01 ===
* Id: 4D6E9E6
* User: Supertrinko
* Date: 2022-09-23 02:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1111914574|HIST 1111914574}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1117695530|HIST 1117695530}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Unfortunately disagreements above have led to the necessity of another RFC.

This disagreement is over the interpretation of previous RFC and whether or not Barbados should be included next to Elizabeth II, or whether all 32 states should be included (and how to display that), I've taken GoodDay's advice and moved it to RFC.

Even though this RFC is clearly going to only impact Elizabeth's unique reign, I've made it a generic RFC because I believe that's the best way to avoid interpretation issues down the road.

'''Current state'''

Currently, based on [[Talk:List of longest-reigning monarchs/Archive 5#Request for comment on Elizabeth duality|this previous RFC]], 15 states were selected to be added next to Elizabeth under the reasoning "Jamaica and other sovereign nations with Elizabeth as head of state be all listed together".

As such, 17 states were excluded based on the fact that they were no longer under Elizabeth's rule.

Additionally, above the first table you'll notice the sentence "Twenty-five longest-reigning monarchs of states that were internationally recognized as sovereign for most or all of their reign."

Interpretation of this sentence has been up for debate, but in my opinion, it would exclude 16 of those excluded states (All except Barbados), because all were under Elizabeth's reign for a minority/less than half of her reign.

'''RFC scope'''

Can we therefore have a discussion (Read: Not a vote, at least not yet) on when and how to include a state or states for a Monarch during their reign.

Do we abolish the "most or all" part, and just include any state that was sovereign during their reign? Do we adjust that to say only states that were sovereign for the entirety of their reign? Or states that were still under their rule at the end of that reign? (These aren't choices, just examples of discussion).

Note, this is a request for ''comment'', not a request for votes, it's not up to me to limit your options, and I believe previous attempts to limit votes to specific options have resulted in subsequent RFCs. If you have a particular view of how it should be, please explain the merits of that view, so that we can build consensus.

If no consensus is formed, we'll take it to a vote and ping those who have commented to come and discuss. [[User:Supertrinko|El Dubs]] ([[User talk:Supertrinko|talk]]) 02:09, 23 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Comparison of EDA software#rfc_A04EA43|Talk:Comparison of EDA software]] expired 2022-10-24 10:01 ===
* Id: A04EA43
* User: Goitseu
* Date: 2022-09-24 09:29:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1112039063|SCI 1112039063}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1117938047|SCI 1117938047}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should programs which don't have yet an own Wikipedia entry be allowed in this comparison list? 
Unfortunately [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Talk%3AComparison_of_EDA_software#Removing_the_intimidating_edit_notice? no clear consensus could be found] in the talk page yet.
While the article passed from [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Comparison_of_EDA_software&oldid=1092698210 this] to [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Comparison_of_EDA_software&oldid=1111900768 this] the current policy has created not a few troubles as shown for example [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Talk:Comparison_of_EDA_software&diff=1111692215&oldid=1111691714 '''here'''], [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Goitseu&diff=1111913289&oldid=1111897802 here] and [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Talk:Comparison_of_EDA_software&diff=1111531578&oldid=1111522391 here] demonstrating the negative impact that policies enforced by such an "edit notice" can have as already highlighted [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Getting_Things_Done#Page_notice here] and [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Talk:Comparison_of_EDA_software&diff=1111878227&oldid=1111835242 here].  [[User:Goitseu|Goitseu]] ([[User talk:Goitseu|talk]]) 09:29, 24 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Alec Baldwin#rfc_8463EFA|Talk:Alec Baldwin]] expired 2022-10-24 15:01 ===
* Id: 8463EFA
* User: ChicagoWikiEditor
* Date: 2022-09-24 14:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1112076946|BIO 1112076946}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1117977383|BIO 1117977383}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Based on the introductory and the fact that the lead should identify the topic and summarize the body of the article with appropriate weight, do you '''support''', '''oppose''', or '''oppose partially''' the removal of political activist and/or comedian from the lede and occupation infobox of this article?

As I've concluded after previous discussions pertaining to what makes a subject a notable comedian, many editors agree that:
* Appearing in comedy films and being a comedian is not the same thing
* The usual criteria for being a comedian includes at minimum a period of having done stand-up, or as a stretch, regularly appearing cast members of any sketch comedy show.

He simply isn't notable for being a political activist, I don't think any further argument needs to be made regarding this.

Vote below and specify if required. [[User:ChicagoWikiEditor|ChicagoWikiEditor]] ([[User talk:ChicagoWikiEditor|talk]]) 14:26, 24 September 2022 (UTC)}}

I recently made an edit as I created List of Danger Force characters and it imminently got reverted back to a redirect. There was no discussion when the list of Henry Danger characters page when it was created. Since the Henry Danger character page didn't have a discussion and this show uses many of the same characters it should of been okay and justified to create the split without discussing. Question: Can we use Health Liberation Now! as a source for factual information?
: '''1)''' We can use it as a source without in-text attribution (X happened)

: '''3)''' We can't use it as a source at all

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Astronomy#rfc_9F673A0|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Astronomy]] expired 2022-10-30 03:01 ===
* Id: 9F673A0
* User: Betseg
* Date: 2022-09-30 02:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1113161742|SCI 1113161742}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1113161746|STYLE 1113161746}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1118981591|SCI 1118981591}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1118981597|STYLE 1118981597}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Currently articles are inconsistent with the naming of the aforementioned planetary system, here are two examples:

; [[Milky Way]] : {{tq|The Milky Way is the galaxy that includes our Solar System <code><nowiki></nowiki></code>}}
; [[Sun]] : {{tq|The Sun is the star at the center of the Solar System <code><nowiki></nowiki></code>}}

Both articles (and more) had had multiple RfCs in their talk pages, but most of them ended with no consensus.

* '''Option A''': Use {{tq|our Solar System}}.<ref>Sorted alphabetically.</ref>
* '''Option B''': Use {{tq|the Solar System}}.
* '''Option C''': Keep the ''status quo'', decide in a case-by-case basis.

[[User:Betseg|Betseg]] ([[User talk:Betseg|talk]]) 02:52, 30 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Rapid-onset gender dysphoria controversy#rfc_C671DFF|Talk:Rapid-onset gender dysphoria controversy]] expired 2022-10-30 20:01 ===
* Id: C671DFF

{{rfcquote|text=
Should we describe "Rapid Onset Gender Dysphoria" as pseudoscientific in the lead? [[User:TheTranarchist|TheTranarchist ‚öß ‚í∂]] ([[User talk:TheTranarchist|talk]]) 19:48, 30 September 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Paul Wheaton#rfc_596D7B9|Talk:Paul Wheaton]] expired 2022-10-30 21:01 ===
* Id: 596D7B9
* User: SUPry
* Date: 2022-10-30 19:14:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1119113509|BIO 1119113509}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1119122462|BIO 1119122462}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I‚Äôd like to raise consideration on whether this page should be deleted (due to lack of notability) or if it simply needs major revisions (due to current lack of non-promotional references). It is my belief that this website exists solely for the purpose of promoting Mr. Wheaton. I am a casual Wikipedia editor, so I don‚Äôt know the best path forward.


Looking back into the history of the page, the page was created in 2013 by @[[User:Wikifan115|Wikifan115]]. Later that year, wikifan115 was issued a temporary ban due to suspected paid editing (and apparently an admin had proof of a fiverr account at that time). I don‚Äôt have any proof as it relates to this specific article, but I find it a bit intriguing. 


The next phase of this page had a significant number of edits by @[[User:Ephemeralcas|Ephemeralcas]]. This user‚Äôs history seems to center around Mr. Wheaton‚Äôs life with edits to this page, terminal-emulators, wood-burning stoves, and creating the page for ‚Äú [[Ernie and Erica Wisner]] ‚Äé‚Äù which is linked from this page. This user also added Mr. Wheaton to the page  [[List of people from Missoula, Montana]], listing Mr. Wheaton as the ‚ÄúDuke of Permaculture.‚Äù


The next phase of this page had a series of edits from anonymous users.


The following phase has a series of edits from @[[User:EmilyTheEditor|EmilyTheEditor]]. This editor‚Äôs entire history revolves around Mr. Wheaton.


The next major segment of edits comes from @[[User:Datapass|Datapass]]. I don‚Äôt have anything special to say about this user or their edits.


Finally we get to current time with recent edits all being made by @[[User:GamgeeGardner|GamgeeGardner]]. This is once again a user who‚Äôs only contributions have been to Mr. Wheaton‚Äôs page. The first edit made by GamgeeGardner was reverted by @[[User:Serols|Serols]] for ‚ÄúAdvertising/promotion.‚Äù GamgeeGardner re-did that edit nearly identically and that text (and Amazon link) still exists on the page today.


There are claims made on the article I don‚Äôt know are backed up with proper sources. For example: ‚Äú As a software engineer, he has worked on the ground system for the [[satellite]] that took pictures for [[Google Earth]] and [[DigitalGlobe]].‚Äù This statement is followed up by two sources. One of the sources is Mr. Wheaton‚Äôs own website. The second is a local newspaper from Mr. Wheaton‚Äôs hometown about him, which I don‚Äôt know if that is a good source for about his background.


Additionally, all external links on the page go to websites controlled by Mr. Wheaton, or are otherwise money making sources for him (e.g. Amazon link). 24 of the 61 references have an author listed of Mr. Wheaton or one of his websites.


The conclusion is this: This page seems to be solely designed to advertise and promote Mr. Wheaton. It was first published by a known paid writer, updated overtime primarily by people who only work on Mr. Wheaton‚Äôs page (and closely related topics), and exists today in a form which actively links to Amazon (and other) links which Mr. Wheaton is paid from while sourcing much of the information from Mr. Wheaton himself. 


I‚Äôm a very casual editor of Wikipedia, so I don‚Äôt know what the best course of action is for this article. [[User:SUPry|SUPry]] ([[User talk:SUPry|talk]]) 19:14, 30 October 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of All Elite Wrestling personnel#rfc_618C85A|Talk:List of All Elite Wrestling personnel]] expired 2022-11-03 22:01 ===
* Id: 618C85A
* User: McPhail
* Date: 2022-10-04 21:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1114116439|BIO 1114116439}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1119875313|BIO 1119875313}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Prior to 4 October 2022, this page listed the individual [[Abadon (wrestler)]] under "female wrestlers" and the individual [[Sonny Kiss]] under "male wrestlers" ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_All_Elite_Wrestling_personnel&oldid=1113455315 link]). Per their individual biography pages, Abadon self-identifies as non-binary and uses "they/them" pronouns, while Sonny Kiss identifies as genderfluid and uses both "he/his" and "she/her" pronouns. My reading of [[MOS:GENDERID]] is that referring to Kiss as a male and to Abadon as a female on this page is contrary to the policy. Accordingly, I changed the page to list Abadon and Sonny Kiss under "non-binary wrestlers" ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_All_Elite_Wrestling_personnel&oldid=1114004554 link]). However, my edit was reverted. I would be grateful for views from the community on the correct course of action. [[User:McPhail|McPhail]] ([[User talk:McPhail|talk]]) 21:15, 4 October 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Infobox settlement#rfc_6140117|Template talk:Infobox settlement]] expired 2022-11-06 01:01 ===
* Id: 6140117
* User: DiscoA340
* Date: 2022-10-30 17:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1119095769|TECH 1119095769}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1120250381|TECH 1120250381}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The {{para|official_name}} parameter is optional but it I think that an official consensus needs to be reached on it as there seems to be pushback above its use. The official name usually says '''City of X''' or '''Town of X''' as that is the official name for them while the common name has a shortened version which usually says '''Town name''' or '''Town name, State or Province''' ([[Detroit|Example of this in action]].) I have been recently in contact with someone who is against the use of it and states that it's redundant and not useful. The problem is that the template offers no instructions on its use, so it seems that many different users have interpreted its use differently. Either the original template authors didn't factor in its use or didn't think it would be used as much as it currently is. The discussion here is not weather the cites call themselves City of X because almost all do; rather is it useful to include on Wikipedia. Keep in mind that the consensus from the discussion will affect thousands or articles across the United States and Canada.

# '''Keep''' - No change, though its use is better written in the instructions.
# '''Remove''' - Remove from template all together.
# '''Change''' - Change the use of the parameter.

[[User:DiscoA340|DiscoA340]] ([[User talk:DiscoA340|talk]]) 17:32, 30 October 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Requests for adminship#rfc_1BCEEB3|Wikipedia talk:Requests for adminship]] expired 2022-11-06 01:01 ===
* Id: 1BCEEB3
* User: HouseBlaster
* Date: 2022-10-07 11:57:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1114619320|PROP 1114619320}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1120250384|PROP 1120250384}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Question''': Should RfAs automatically be put on hold after one week? <br>
'''Details''': This would be implemented by modifying {{tl|rfa}} to automatically place the RfA  "on hold" after one week. Bureaucrats would still be responsible for evaluating consensus, formally closing the discussion, granting admin access itself, etc. This would not affect the ability of 'crats to extend the duration of RfAs, if they deem it necessary. [[User:HouseBlaster|House]][[Special:Contributions/HouseBlaster|Blaster]]<sup>[[User talk:HouseBlaster|talk]]</sup> 11:57, 7 October 2022 (UTC)}}

[[User:Bastun|<span style="font-family:Verdana, sans-serif">Bastun</span>]]<sup>[[User_talk:Bastun|ƒñƒ°√°·∏çŒ≤√°≈õ‚ÇÆ≈≠≈É!]]</sup> 17:21, 7 October 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Circumcision#rfc_FD5690D|Talk:Circumcision]] expired 2022-11-06 20:01 ===
* Id: FD5690D
* User: KlayCax
* Date: 2022-10-07 19:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1114692730|SCI 1114692730}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1120396838|SCI 1120396838}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There has been an overgoing, almost years-long dispute on the wording of this part of the lead. With one side stating that there is a consensus in the literature that circumcision definitely reduces STD's in certain contexts and reduces the incidence of urinary tract infections. The other saying that  there is no consensus and that the lead should merely state that there is an "association" between circumcision and UTI/STD prevalence. A small minority of editors have gone further: stating that circumcision ''increases'' the incidence of STD's and UTI's: [[Talk:Circumcision#Prevention of STDs is highly disputed|citing various sources]].

'''Version #1: '''

<blockquote>Circumcision '''reduces '''rates of sexually transmitted infections and urinary tract infections.</blockquote> 

'''Version #2: '''

<blockquote>Circumcision '''is associated with''' reduced rates of sexually transmitted infections and urinary tract infections</blockquote> 

The RfC question: 

*'''Is circumcision merely "associated with" reducing STD's/UTI's? Or does it definitely reduce forms of both, given certain contexts? 
*'''Is version #1 or #2 a better description of consensus?'''

Note that this is '''not''' a discussion on whether circumcision in developed nations is appropriate, ethical, or should be routine. (Or whether risks outset these metrics.) 

Rather, it is asking on whether there a general agreement among sources that circumcision definitely reduces UTI's and certain STD's in certain contexts? 

A [[Talk:Circumcision and HIV|very similar RfC discussion is ongoing]] on the [[circumcision and HIV]] page. So editors here might want to check that out as well. Thanks! [[User:KlayCax|KlayCax]] ([[User talk:KlayCax|talk]]) 19:40, 7 October 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:User pages#rfc_7E9A87A|Wikipedia talk:User pages]] expired 2022-11-07 02:01 ===
* Id: 7E9A87A
* User: Ad Orientem
* Date: 2022-10-08 01:13:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1114746796|POLICY 1114746796}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1120448146|POLICY 1120448146}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Following up on [[WP:NONAZIS]] and [[WP:No Confederates]] I propose that [[WP:UPNOT]] be amended to include the following text:
:'''In line with the above, expressly prohibited are any text, images or symbols that might reasonably be construed as indicating support or sympathy for extremist ideologies and or beliefs closely associated with discrimination, mass repression or violence against whole groups of people. Examples include but are not limited to racism and racial supremacy of any kind, slavery, antisemitism, homophobia, and totalitarian ideologies such as Nazism, Fascism, Communism, and symbols directly related to them.'''
::-[[User:Ad Orientem|Ad Orientem]] ([[User talk:Ad Orientem|talk]]) 01:13, 8 October 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Jehovah's Witnesses congregational discipline#rfc_F92A9CA|Talk:Jehovah's Witnesses congregational discipline]] expired 2022-11-07 09:01 ===
* Id: F92A9CA
* User: Clovermoss
* Date: 2022-10-13 20:46:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1115910566|RELI 1115910566}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1115910573|SOC 1115910573}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1120496866|RELI 1120496866}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1120496871|SOC 1120496871}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I don't think I've ever started an RfC before, but I'm trying because I think this is important. I'm starting this because I think that it'd be useful when there's only 6 people (including me) that are considered "active" (as in, editing anything JW-related in the past two years) by the WikiProject. Jeffro77 cares a lot about Jehovah's Witnesses-related articles and I'm not discounting that, but I think further eyes might help on a subject matter like this. A lot of this hasn't really taken place on this talk page but there's some context at Jeffro77's talk page. Now on to the purpose of this RfC: 
* Are primary sources reliable in this matter? I would argue, no, and that the situation is similar, but not exactly the same, as to what is described at [[Disconnection (Scientology)]]. Here's one reason why I don't think relying on primary sources like ''Shepherd the Flock of God'', a handbook for elders, is the best idea [https://www.theatlantic.com/family/archive/2019/03/the-secret-jehovahs-witness-database-of-child-molesters/584311/]
* Is it relevant to include information about being shunned by family members? I would say yes, it is important to clarify that it's not simply the congregation that shuns you. I don't nessecarily agee with this: {{tquote|There is no problem with the editor‚Äôs latest removal of ‚Äòthe congregation‚Äô in the lead sentence, but it isn‚Äôt necessary to elaborate there about the nuances of which family members are shunned (and without the nuances is a misleading simplification).}} Yes, there's nuance, but I think the article as-is is misleading in itself. [https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-40704990][https://jme.bmj.com/content/26/5/381][https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11089-020-00935-0][https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/calgary/religious-shunning-jehovahs-witness-1.3767074#:~:text=What%20is%20shunning%20and%20why,they%20are%20a%20family%20member.] These are just some of the many sources that could be used here, but here's a quote from the last one: "There are typically two routes of leaving the JW: (1) disfellowship (forced exit), the result of contravening religious rules, and (2) leaving the group voluntarily (known as disassociation or fading). Regardless of the exit route, former members often report being mandatorily shunned by their family and friends who remain in the faith".
I get that the edits from the new editor, {{u|GiaHova}}, aren't ideal, but I do think they could potentially be lead in the right direction and that their argument that the article is misleading as-is and relies on primary sources has some merit. I think a broader consensus that isn't like three or four people might be useful. [[User:Clovermoss|<span style="color:darkorchid">Clover</span><span style="color:green">moss</span>]] [[User talk:Clovermoss|(talk)]] 20:46, 13 October 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Capital letters#rfc_776FCCB|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Capital letters]] expired 2022-11-07 22:01 ===
* Id: 776FCCB
* User: SchreiberBike#top
* Date: 2022-10-23 12:35:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1117764426|RELI 1117764426}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1117764429|STYLE 1117764429}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1120605644|RELI 1120605644}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1120605647|STYLE 1120605647}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should [''T'']''the'' be capitalized mid-sentence and mid-article title when referring to [T]the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints? Please respond '''Capitalize''' or '''Lower case''' and explain as you desire. There is an additional section below for [[#Discussion and alternatives|discussion and alternatives]].

Sentence examples:
*The history of '''The''' Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints includes ... .
or
*The history of '''the''' Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints includes ... .

Article title examples:
*History of '''The''' Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
or
*History of '''the''' Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints

The text above, and the notifications and headings below were developed and finalized at [[User:SchreiberBike/Workspace/Mid-sentence and mid-article title capitalization of the in the full name of the LDS Church|User:SchreiberBike/Workspace/Mid-sentence and mid-article title capitalization of ''the'' in the full name of the LDS Church]] and the associated talk page. That proposal was announced on this page above.&nbsp;[[User:SchreiberBike|SchreiberBike&nbsp;]]&#124;[[User talk:SchreiberBike#top|&nbsp;‚å®&nbsp;]] 12:35, 23 October 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Quantities of bits#rfc_EC889F7|Template talk:Quantities of bits]] expired 2022-11-09 02:01 ===
* Id: EC889F7
* User: Locke Cole
* Date: 2022-10-10 01:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1115151177|HIST 1115151177}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1115151181|SCI 1115151181}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1120833640|HIST 1120833640}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1120833642|SCI 1120833642}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This is a multiple question RFC: 

1. What should the column name for [[Special:Permalink/1113613251|the column shown in this revision as "JEDEC"]] be going forward?
:*Also common
:*Common
:*Common Usage
:*Computing
:*Customary
:*Deprecated
:*Historical
:*JEDEC
:*Legacy
:*Memory
:*Metric
:*Traditional
:Please indicate your choice from the list above, or if you have an alternative choice not listed, state that.

2. Should the above named column be positioned before the "IEC" column? Please answer yes or no.

3. Should the full list of entries be provided up to yottabyte/yottabit? Please answer yes, no, or the maximum value you would support.

Thank you for your participation. ‚Äî[[User:Locke Cole|Locke Cole]] ‚Ä¢ [[User talk:Locke Cole|t]] ‚Ä¢ [[Special:Contributions/Locke Cole|c]] 01:19, 10 October 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion#rfc_AC3B2DD|Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion]] expired 2022-11-10 00:01 ===
* Id: AC3B2DD
* User: Shibbolethink
* Date: 2022-10-10 23:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1115337684|POLICY 1115337684}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1120998955|POLICY 1120998955}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
For background, see this recent thread on the Admin's Noticeboard: [[Wikipedia:Administrators%27_noticeboard#Are_CSD_tags_edits_for_the_purposes_of_WP:G13?|Are CSD tags edits for the purposes of WP:G13?]]

The question is: Does a human CSD tagging a draft, in and of itself, count against "{{!xt|have not been edited by a human in six months}}" of CSD G13? and how do we resolve this paradox? Should we? If so, what should be included?

'''Option 1:''' A human tagging a draft <u>does not</u> reset the clock, but anyone (admin or otherwise) removing a CSD tag <u>does</u>.
{{ctop|bg=#C9D0FC|Option 1 revision text|2=The edit is shown in green italics}}
This applies to any pages that have not been edited by a human in six months found in:
# [[Wikipedia:Drafts|Draft namespace]],
# [[WP:UD|Userspace]] with an {{Tl|AFC submission}} template
# Userspace with no content except the [[Wikipedia:Article Wizard|article wizard]] placeholder text.
Redirects are exempt from G13 deletion. ''{{tq|Adding a CSD template to a page does not reset the six month clock, but removing a CSD template does.}}'' Pages deleted under G13 may be restored upon request by following the procedure at [[Wikipedia:Requests for undeletion/G13]].
{{cbot}}
:'''Option 1.5''': Removal of a G13 tag by a user who claims to intend to improve the draft <u>does</u> restart the clock, procedural removal <u>doesn't</u>. <small>(c/o @[[User:Animal lover 666|Animal lover 666]])</small>
{{hr}}
'''Option 2:''' A human making an "edit to the content of the draft" <u>does</u> reset the clock, but any other kind of edit (e.g. tagging with a CSD, admin actions on that tag) <u>does not</u>. <small>(c/o @[[User:Szmenderowiecki|Szmenderowiecki]])</small>
{{ctop|bg=#FCC9C9|Option 2 revision text|2=The edit is shown in green italics}}
This applies to any pages ''{{tq|without a human edit that visibly changes article content in six months. This applies to:}}''
# [[Wikipedia:Drafts|Draft namespace]],
# [[WP:UD|Userspace]] with an {{Tl|AFC submission}} template
# Userspace with no content except the [[Wikipedia:Article Wizard|article wizard]] placeholder text.
Redirects are exempt from G13 deletion. Pages deleted under G13 may be restored upon request by following the procedure at [[Wikipedia:Requests for undeletion/G13]]. ''{{tq|Nominating these pages for speedy deletion or [[WP:PROD|proposed deletion]], administrator actions to these nominations, as well as additions of [[Wikipedia:Tagging_pages_for_problems#Lists_of_tags|problem tags]] to these pages without any further action, do not start a new six-month period.}}''
{{cbot}}
{{hr}}
'''Option 3:''' <u>Clarify</u> that any human edit, including a CSD tag, <u>does</u> reset the clock. In essence, humans should not use G13.
{{ctop|bg=#DFC9FC|Option 3 revision text|2=The edit is shown in green italics}}
This applies to any pages that have not been edited by a human in six months found in:
# [[Wikipedia:Drafts|Draft namespace]],
# [[WP:UD|Userspace]] with an {{Tl|AFC submission}} template
# Userspace with no content except the [[Wikipedia:Article Wizard|article wizard]] placeholder text.
Redirects are exempt from G13 deletion. ''{{tq|A 'human edit' means that manually adding a CSD template to a page will reset the six month clock. This template should only be used by bots.}}'' Pages deleted under G13 may be restored upon request by following the procedure at [[Wikipedia:Requests for undeletion/G13]].
{{cbot}}
{{hr}}
'''Option 4:''' Status quo.
{{ctop|Option 4 (status quo) text}}
This applies to any pages that have not been edited by a human in six months found in:
# [[Wikipedia:Drafts|Draft namespace]],
# [[WP:UD|Userspace]] with an {{Tl|AFC submission}} template
# Userspace with no content except the [[Wikipedia:Article Wizard|article wizard]] placeholder text.
Redirects are exempt from G13 deletion. It was determined that the community consensus in [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)/Archive 135#Draft Namespace Redirects|this RfC]] regarding draft namespace redirects amounted to "there is a clear consensus against deletion of draft namespace redirects. There is a rough consensus against the alternative proposal to delete draft namespace redirects after six months." Pages deleted under G13 may be restored upon request by following the procedure at [[Wikipedia:Requests for undeletion/G13]].
{{cbot}}
{{hr}}
This RFC is an attempt to resolve an ambiguity. There are many thoughts on all sides, and I heavily encourage anyone confused or concerned to read the thread linked above to see if that idea has already been articulated succinctly, and to echo those thoughts, whenever possible. Thanks all!‚Äî&nbsp;[[User:Shibbolethink|<span style="color: black">Shibboleth</span><span style="color: maroon">ink</span>]] <sup>([[User talk:Shibbolethink|‚ôî]]</sup> <sup>[[Special:Contributions/Shibbolethink|‚ôï]])</sup> 23:33, 10 October 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_899BB23|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2022-11-11 23:01 ===
* Id: 899BB23
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

=== [[Talk:War crimes in the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine#rfc_5BA9877|Talk:War crimes in the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine]] expired 2022-11-17 23:01 ===
* Id: 5BA9877
* User: Gitz6666
* Date: 2022-10-18 23:00:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1116902589|POL 1116902589}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1122503566|POL 1122503566}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This RfC concerns whether and how the article should report about killings of suspected collaborators of the Russian occupiers.

'''Option 1 (status quo)'''. The article should not include a section on killings of suspected collaborators of the Russian occupiers.

'''Option 2 (proposed text)'''. The article should include a section as the one proposed here below.

'''Option 3 (different text)'''. The article should include a section different from the one proposed (specify how).

{{cot|Proposed text}}

'''Extrajudicial executions of suspected collaborators'''

As of 30 August nearly a dozen people had been killed and others injured in assassination attempts on [[Collaboration with Russia during the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine|collaborationists]] and Russian-appointed officials in the occupied territories.<ref>{{cite web |date=8 August 2022 |title=Collaborationist officials targeted and killed in Ukraine‚Äôs occupied territories |url=https://meduza.io/en/feature/2022/08/30/collaborationist-officials-targeted-and-killed-in-ukraine-s-occupied-territories |access-date=2022-10-10 |website=[[Meduza]]}}</ref> Some of the attacks against high-ranking political collaborators were allegedly conducted by Ukrainian partisans led and trained by Ukrainian special forces.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-10-04 |title=Ukraine: at least 18 people working for occupiers targeted in attacks |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/oct/04/ukraine-at-least-18-people-working-for-occupiers-targeted-in-attacks |access-date=2022-10-10 |website=[[The Guardian]] |language=en}}</ref>

On 2 March 2022 [[Volodymyr Struk]], a pro-Russian mayor in the town of Kremnina, was abducted and shot dead by unknown gunmen. An advisor to the Ukrainian Ministry of Internal Affairs, [[Anton Herashchenko]], reported that Struk had been ‚Äújudged by the public tribunal and apparently shot by unknown patriots as a traitor".<ref>{{cite report|date=13 April 2022 |first1=Wolfgang |last1=Benedek |first2=Veronika |last2=B√≠lkov√° |first3=Marco |last3=Sass√≤li |title=Report On Violations Of International Humanitarian And Human Rights Law, War Crimes And Crimes Against Humanity Committed In Ukraine Since 24 February 2022 |url=https://www.osce.org/files/f/documents/f/a/515868.pdf |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220414032244if_/https://www.osce.org/files/f/documents/f/a/515868.pdf |archive-date=13 April 2022 |access-date=14 April 2022 |publisher=[[Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe]]|id=ODIHR.GAL/26/22/Rev.1}}</ref>

On 8 September, the ''[[Washington Post]]'' reported a wave of assassinations and attempted killings against Russian-appointed officials and Ukrainian collaborators, as Ukrainian hit squads and saboteurs gunned down, blown up, hanged and poisoned almost 20 people considered to be collaborators of the puppet governments of [[Donetsk People's Republic|Donetsk]] and [[Luhansk People's Republic|Luhansk people's republics]].<ref name="WaPo_Hit_Squads">{{Cite news |date=8 September 2022 |title=Ukrainian hit squads target Russian occupiers and collaborators |language=en-US |work=Washington Post |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2022/09/08/ukraine-assassinations-occupied-territory-russia/ |access-date=2022-10-12 |issn=0190-8286}}</ref> The assassination campaign was described as raising questions "about extrajudicial killings and potential war crimes, particularly when the targets are political actors or civilians".<ref name="WaPo_Hit_Squads" />

On 27 September, the [[ Office of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights]] documented six killings of alleged "traitors" of Ukraine. The victims were local authority officials, policemen and civilians who were believed to have voluntarily cooperated with the enemy. According to OHCHR, these killings may have been committed by government agents or with their acquiescence and could constitute extrajudicial executions and war crimes.<ref>{{cite report |url=https://www.ohchr.org/en/documents/country-reports/report-human-rights-situation-ukraine-1-february-31-july-2022 |title=Report on the human rights situation in Ukraine, 1 February to 31 July 2022 |date=27 September 2022 |publisher=[[OHCHR]] |access-date=10 Oct 2022 |at=para. 40}}</ref>
{{reflist-talk}}
{{cob|}} [[User:Gitz6666|Gitz]] ([[User talk:Gitz6666|talk]]) ([[Special:Contributions/Gitz6666|contribs]]) 23:00, 18 October 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Gender identity#rfc_810EA8C|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Gender identity]] expired 2022-11-20 20:01 ===
* Id: 810EA8C
* User: MSG17
* Date: 2022-10-21 19:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1117449832|STYLE 1117449832}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1122943777|STYLE 1122943777}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I have noticed some discussions about [[neopronouns]], but mostly on a case-by-case basis and mainly focusing on [[noun-self pronouns]], so I am starting this RfC for a more comphrensive discussion. The current policy on neopronouns states:

:{{tq|When the subject of the article identifies with [[neopronouns]], the pronouns should default to [[singular they]].}}

Based on previous discussions, I identify some options:

* '''Option A''': Allow all neopronouns
* '''Option B''': Don't use [[noun-self pronouns]], use other neopronouns (e, xe, xir, zir etc; see [[Gender neutrality in languages with gendered third-person pronouns#Table of standard and non-standard third-person singular pronouns|this table of English third-person singular pronouns]] for more)
* '''Option C''': Retain status quo (use singular ''they'')
* '''Option D''': Refer to subjects only by name
* '''Option E''': Mention the neopronouns once in the article lead, default to singular ''they'' otherwise
* '''Option H''': Use the pronouns most common in recent reliable and independent sources

Other possible options are welcome.

[[User:MSG17|MSG17]] ([[User talk:MSG17|talk]]) 19:18, 21 October 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Main Page#rfc_D2C7653|Talk:Main Page]] expired 2022-11-21 11:01 ===
* Id: D2C7653
* User: Storye book
* Date: 2022-11-15 13:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1122034709|POLICY 1122034709}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1122034712|TECH 1122034712}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1122034714|PROP 1122034714}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1123033485|POLICY 1123033485}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1123033486|TECH 1123033486}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1123033487|PROP 1123033487}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''The issue to !vote on''': Should we retain the existing DYK box as it stands on the Main Page, with its quirky hooks "interesting to a broad audience", but add a second box containing factual hooks for specialist articles?

'''Note''': this issue to vote on is solely about whether we want a second box or not, and the discussion is about why we may or may not want a second box for WP's improvement. At this stage, it is not about logistics such as whether we have enough reviewers, or where the templates should be listed for review and prep, or Main Page overall design. 

'''History''': This issue was triggered by difficulties on [[Template:Did you know nominations/Talia Or]] (and previously many other similar difficulties on previous nomination templates). In the hope of resolving the difficulties which were stalling the progress of certain DYK nominations, a discussion and Rfc was opened at: [[Wikipedia talk:Did you know#Request for comment: The need to update Wikipedia:DYK#gen3]]. The difficulty was that some reviewers felt that DYK hooks should all have quirky or intriguing elements aimed at a "general audience" (however one defines that). But some nominators and reviewers felt that sometimes a factual hook was the only type suitable for a particular article, even if that article contained potential quirky-hook material. It has been impossible to reach a compromise, and that is why the idea of an extra hook box arose, and why the Rfc has been opened here. Please see the "Possible reasons for adding another hook box" section below, for more information. [[User:Storye book|Storye book]] ([[User talk:Storye book|talk]]) 13:49, 15 November 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi#rfc_F60AAC0|Talk:Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi]] expired 2022-11-21 17:01 ===
* Id: F60AAC0
* User: RoughEndofthePineapple
* Date: 2022-11-18 17:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1122637219|BIO 1122637219}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1123071332|BIO 1123071332}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is a statement at the end of the first paragraph of this article that reads: "Some  journalists have alleged that al-Baghdadi was Jewish and affiliated with Mossad." Four sources are listed for this statement. However, while some of the sources reference the allegation that Al-Baghdadi was a Mossad agent, none of the sources support or even mention the allegation that he was Jewish. In light of this, what should be done with this statement? [[User:RoughEndofthePineapple|RoughEndofthePineapple]] ([[User talk:RoughEndofthePineapple|talk]]) 17:52, 18 November 2022 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
I need an opinion can ≈Ωeljko Heimer who leads, maintains and edits this [https://zeljko-heimer-fame.from.hr/home.html website] be considered a reliable source?

I believe he is an established expert in vexillology and can be used as a reliable source. [[User:Governor Sheng|Governor Sheng]] ([[User talk:Governor Sheng|talk]]) 12:09, 13 November 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Median income#rfc_33A2065|Talk:Median income]] expired 2022-11-30 23:01 ===
* Id: 33A2065
* User: JimsMaher
* Date: 2022-10-31 22:06:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1119322853|ECON 1119322853}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1124867399|ECON 1124867399}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
It has come to my attention that the ranked list on this page is woefully outdated or possibly completely fabricated. The source listed was archived in 2013, with data only as recent as 2011. Yet the listed dates for each row are much more recent, circa 2019. What numbers I have checked against the source don't line up with any year. Also, a quick search of several other sources for the most recent median income by country returns drastically different numbers. For example, the most recent World Bank data has the US at a median income (PPP) less than half the current listed value on this page ... source: https://worldpopulationreview.com/country-rankings/median-income-by-country

Should the current list be preserved and amended? Or completely removed and replaced? Which sources are considered the most reliable for this kind of information? In order to most accurately update it. [[User:JimsMaher|JimsMaher]] ([[User talk:JimsMaher|talk]]) 22:06, 31 October 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:XOR gate#rfc_8B7FEA7|Talk:XOR gate]] expired 2022-12-02 07:01 ===
* Id: 8B7FEA7
* User: Alexander_Davronov
* Date: 2022-11-02 06:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1119564418|SCI 1119564418}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1125111400|SCI 1125111400}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
{{User:ClueBot III/DoNotArchiveUntil|1662501700}}
''See previous [[#Inverters|discussion here]].''

I propose to update the article with the following draft below making a short description on parts of the scheme (image). Regardless of their function I just propose to mention that sub-circuits of the scheme resemble commonly used circuits in cMOS logic family. In order to avoid possible confusion, I also propose to say that the left-stage inveter (which is B-driven) circuit is not acting exactly like a NOT gate. The net-result of the entire scheme should be left out of scope of image caption. --<span style="font-weight: bold" >[[User:Alexander_Davronov|<span style="color:#a8a8a8;">AXO</span><span style="color:#000">NOV</span>]] [[User talk:Alexander_Davronov|(talk)]] [[Special:Contributions/Alexander_Davronov|‚öë]]</span> 06:49, 2 November 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Cardiff Arms Park#rfc_4EFEEDD|Talk:Cardiff Arms Park]] expired 2022-12-03 01:01 ===
* Id: 4EFEEDD
* Date: 2022-11-17 16:34:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1122494914|SOC 1122494914}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1125252945|SOC 1125252945}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
{{ping|Mn1548}} My overall preference is that [[Cardiff Arms Park]] is not split. The main problem for me in spitting is that it ends up with too many articles on the one subject. However, I think if a split is the consensus of the Wikipedia community, then there are two options to consider that may be acceptable to editors: 

*Option 1: Do not split, i.e. revert it back to the [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Cardiff_Arms_Park&oldid=1120321667 original version] prior to the split. 
*Option 2: Split as:
**[[Cardiff Arms Park]], to tell the overall story of the site, then...
**[[Cardiff Arms Park (rugby ground 1876 to 1967)]], the old stadium/ground, before the National Stadium was built
**[[Cardiff Arms Park (rugby ground)]] the present day stadium/ground and 
**[[National Stadium (Cardiff)]], (unfortunately this new article is now a mess) although to be clear it would be better to rename it [[National Stadium (Cardiff Arms Park)]]
**[[Cardiff Arms Park Stadium]] redirected into [[Cardiff Arms Park (rugby ground)]]

=== [[Talk:Camel toe#rfc_00A01DB|Talk:Camel toe]] expired 2022-12-07 17:01 ===
* Id: 00A01DB
* User: La Nave Partir√†
* Date: 2022-11-30 09:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

{{rfcquote|text=
The phenomenon and the slang term ''male camel toe'' is common, and I find it insulting (for women) not to mention it alongside the description of female camel toe.

google "male cameltoe" - 420,000 results

google "male camel toe" - 80,000 results

google "moose toe" - 12,000 results (moose knuckle is another thing)

There are several photos in commons - [[c:Category:Cameltoes|Category:Cameltoes]]

It happens unintentionally, but there are also   [https://www.etsy.com/listing/502675162/camel-toe-panty-gaff-for-male-to-female panties for sale] for men who wish to create camel toe deliberately.

Thank you,

Not a native English speaker  - [[User:La Nave Partir√†|La Nave Partir√†]] ([[User talk:La Nave Partir√†|talk]]) 09:07, 30 November 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Biographies of living persons#rfc_28C4A24|Wikipedia talk:Biographies of living persons]] expired 2022-12-09 02:01 ===
* Id: 28C4A24
* User: Newimpartial
* Date: 2022-11-09 01:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1120833635|BIO 1120833635}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1120833646|POLICY 1120833646}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1126384330|BIO 1126384330}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1126384336|POLICY 1126384336}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Should [[WP:BIO]] mandate the inclusion of rebuttals and denials that are [[WP:ABOUTSELF|sourced only to the BLP subject]] of the accusation?'''

Context: [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia_talk:Biographies_of_living_persons/Archive_36#RfC:_Official_Responses_/_Rebuttals an RfC] held in February, 2014 mandated the inclusion of such rebuttals and denials. Since that time, a number have editors have argued on various article and policy Talk pages that denials should be subject to the usual provisions of [[WP:RS]] sourcing and [[WP:BALANCE]]. Therefore, the community should decide whether its view on this question has changed since the 2014 RfC. [[User:Newimpartial|Newimpartial]] ([[User talk:Newimpartial|talk]]) 01:48, 9 November 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Abortion in Texas#rfc_2FA07ED|Talk:Abortion in Texas]] expired 2022-12-09 23:01 ===
* Id: 2FA07ED
* User: Elizium23
* Date: 2022-11-09 22:29:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1120991202|POL 1120991202}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1126545957|POL 1126545957}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This is an RFC because the decision spans [[:Category:Abortion in the United States by state]]; most articles in that category contain this boilerplate. The "Terminology" and "Context" section of these articles typically contain two paragraphs of copied boilerplate which attempts to explain the terminology and context of abortion in the united states. The text, and the sources, do not connect the information to the U.S. state in question, or any state at all. The sources are generalized according to the lessons attempted to be imparted by the "Terminology" and "Context" sections. The [[Abortion in Texas]] article, for example, already bears a {{tl|relevance}} tag from September 2021.

I propose that all generalized text be removed from these sections. If there is relevant prose left it may be merged into the rest of the article or retained in an appropriately-named section. Per [[WP:UNDUE]] and [[WP:COATRACK]], it is important that each state-related article remain focused on the U.S. state which is its topic. Please consider removing irrelevant and unfocused information, particular in "Terminology" and "Context" sections which have been copied over and over to each article. [[User:Elizium23|Elizium23]] ([[User talk:Elizium23|talk]]) 22:29, 9 November 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Nazis#rfc_5AFD5EC|Talk:Nazis]] expired 2022-12-12 20:01 ===
* Id: 5AFD5EC
* User: InvadingInvader
* Date: 2022-12-12 04:01:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1126964152|HIST 1126964152}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1127080496|HIST 1127080496}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''TLDR: should this redirect ''[[Nazis]]'' be retargeted to [[Nazi Party]] instead of its present destination, [[Nazism]]'''?<br/>

As of writing, there are 2 other redirects that are of interest and relating to this, which is [[Nazi]] (currently targeting to the [[Nazism]] ideology), and [[The Nazis]] (which targets to the [[Nazi Party]]). I agree that for the former two, these are the best options save for ''maybe'' making Nazi a disambiguation, but that's beyond the point of this RFC.

Presently, this redirect also targets to the Nazism ideology, however, it's difficult for Nazis plural to be able to refer to the Nazism ideology in common conversation. If I say "Nazis" in a discussion, I'm most frequently referring to either the regime/party/Third Reich, or neo-Nazi movements/participants. Based on this, I don't believe that "Nazis" ''plural'' as a redirect should target to the ideology but rather the party, as modern proponents of the ideology and party are designated as "neo-Nazis" rather than "Nazis" on WP. I believe a reader looking for information on Neo-Nazism would type neo-Nazism or related terms in the search box. A person typing "Nazis" would expect to find the regime, not the ideology. 

I understand some editors would suggest I [[WP:JUSTDOIT]], but given the high amount of controversy surrounding almost anything to do with the regime, the ideology, and the party, I think we should put this up for an RFC first given the drastic impact this could have. <b><span style="color:#0080FB">Invading</span><span style="color:#0668E1">Invader</span></b> ([[User:InvadingInvader|userpage]], [[User talk:InvadingInvader|talk]]) 04:01, 12 December 2022 (UTC)}}
