=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_8450D2A|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2022-12-15 00:01 ===
* Id: 8450D2A
* User: GizzyCatBella
* Date: 2022-11-21 08:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1123028868|PROP 1123028868}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1128665245|PROP 1128665245}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The founder and chief editor of [[Encyclopedia of Ukraine]] was a major [[Ukrainian Nazi collaborators|Nazi collaborator]] [[Volodymyr Kubijovyƒç]] who [[World War II|during the war]] worked closely under [[Hans Frank]] in [[General Government|GG]]. Among other things Volodymyr Kubijovyƒç was an originator and funder of [[14th Waffen Grenadier Division of the SS (1st Galician)|14th Waffen Grenadier Division of the SS]] responsible for [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/14th_Waffen_Grenadier_Division_of_the_SS_(1st_Galician)#Atrocities war atrocities]. After the war Kubijovyƒç settled in the West.

<u>Is the Encyclopedia of Ukraine a reliable source '''for [[World War II|WW2]] history'''?</u>


''Example:''

I‚Äôll present you an article about Ukrainian Nazi collaborator and war criminal [[Roman Shukhevych]] responsible for the [[Massacres of Poles in Volhynia and Eastern Galicia|massacres]] of approximately 100,000 civilians.
*This is what we say about [[Roman Shukhevych]]
*This is what Encyclopedia of Ukraine says about [http://www.encyclopediaofukraine.com/display.asp?linkpath=pages%5CS%5CH%5CShukhevychRoman.htm Roman Shukhevych]
Notice that in the Encyclopedia of Ukraine there is '''not a single word''' about the atrocities Shukhevych committed.
Examples of such white-washing in the Encyclopedia of Ukraine are plenty, including the article about [http://www.encyclopediaofukraine.com/display.asp?linkpath=pages%5CK%5CU%5CKubijovyJ0Volodymyr.htm Kubijovyƒç] himself, were he describes himself as: {{tq|''exceptional organizer and statesman''}} (while working for the Nazis). - <small><span style="border:1px solid black;padding:1px;">[[User:GizzyCatBella|<span style="color:#40">'''GizzyCatBella'''</span>]][[User talk:GizzyCatBella|<span style="color:transparent;text-shadow:0 0 0 red;font-size:80%">üçÅ</span>]]</span></small> 08:48, 21 November 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Circumcision (disambiguation)#rfc_1A1B044|Talk:Circumcision (disambiguation)]] expired 2022-12-15 01:01 ===
* Id: 1A1B044
* User: KlayCax
* Date: 2022-12-14 12:04:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1127392502|SCI 1127392502}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1127392506|SOC 1127392506}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1129084525|SCI 1129084525}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1129084527|SOC 1129084527}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''The question:'''

*''' Is it a violation of [[WP: NPOV]] for the disambiguation page to state that "female circumcision" is predominately proscribed by major medical organziations? '''

There's recently been an [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Circumcision_(disambiguation)&action=history irretractable edit dispute] (and on this talk page above) on whether it is a violation of [[WP: NPOV]] and [[WP: Undue]] to state that the term "female circumcision" is strongly discouraged by major medical organizations. 

The original wording of the disambiguation page stated: 

<blockquote>{{tqi|Female circumcision, a [[Wiktionary:Appendix:Glossary#proscribed|proscribed]] term for female genital mutilation.}}</blockquote>

{{re|Neveselbert}} objected to this statement and deleted it. Arguing that the disambiguation page should simply read: 

<blockquote>{{tqi|Female circumcision}}</blockquote>

[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Circumcision_%28disambiguation%29&type=revision&diff=1126768504&oldid=1126342584 While stating that it] would be 

<blockquote>{{tqi|completely unnecessary WP:POV-pushing}}</blockquote>

To state that "female circumcision" is proscribed by major medical practitioners and that labeling it as "female genital mutilation" is "controversial".  After a through discussion ‚Äî see above ‚Äî he requested that a RFC be performed on the matter and stated he would revert any reversion to the previous version.

And [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Talk%3ACircumcision_%28disambiguation%29&type=revision&diff=1127147103&oldid=1127146602 stating]:

<blockquote>{{tqi|They're not compulsory [descriptions for articles]], and when they're controversial they're usually omitted. Again, open a [[WP:RFC]] if you believe such a description is warranted.}}</blockquote>
 
Thus, per request, I created a RFC on the matter to prevent the start of an edit war. [[User:KlayCax|KlayCax]] ([[User talk:KlayCax|talk]]) 12:04, 14 December 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Turkey#rfc_239A6E5|Talk:Turkey]] expired 2022-12-15 16:01 ===
* Id: 239A6E5
* Date: 2022-11-15 15:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1122051800|HIST 1122051800}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1122051805|POL 1122051805}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1127592422|HIST 1127592422}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1127592427|POL 1127592427}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Zero mention in this article about the deepening authoritarianism.<ref name="Yƒ±lmaz Turner 2019 pp. 691‚Äì699">{{cite journal | last=Yƒ±lmaz | first=Zafer | last2=Turner | first2=Bryan S. | title=Turkey‚Äôs deepening authoritarianism and the fall of electoral democracy | journal=British Journal of Middle Eastern Studies | publisher=Informa UK Limited | volume=46 | issue=5 | date=2019-07-11 | issn=1353-0194 | doi=10.1080/13530194.2019.1642662 | pages=691‚Äì698}}</ref>

Should the article mention the democratic backsliding that has happened in the past dacade refering to the country as a competitive authoritarian regime ?<ref name="Esen Gumuscu 2016 pp. 1581‚Äì1606">{{cite journal | last=Esen | first=Berk | last2=Gumuscu | first2=Sebnem | title=Rising competitive authoritarianism in Turkey | journal=Third World Quarterly | publisher=Informa UK Limited | volume=37 | issue=9 | date=2016-02-19 | issn=0143-6597 | doi=10.1080/01436597.2015.1135732 | pages=1581‚Äì1606}}</ref><ref name="G√ºnay 2016 pp. 39‚Äì46">{{cite journal | last=G√ºnay | first=Cengiz | title=Foreign Policy as a Source of Legitimation for | journal=Georgetown Journal of International Affairs | publisher=Georgetown University Press | volume=17 | issue=2 | year=2016 | issn=15260054 | jstor=26396170 | pages=39‚Äì46 | url=http://www.jstor.org/stable/26396170 | access-date=2022-11-15}}</ref><span style="font-weight:bold;color:darkblue">[[User:Moxy|Moxy]]</span>-[[File:Maple Leaf (Pantone).svg|15px|link=User talk:Moxy]] 15:32, 15 November 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Investigations into the origin of COVID-19#rfc_F9CE1C0|Talk:Investigations into the origin of COVID-19]] expired 2022-12-15 19:01 ===
* Id: F9CE1C0
* User: Adoring nanny
* Date: 2022-11-15 18:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1122079731|HIST 1122079731}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1122079734|SCI 1122079734}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1122079739|POL 1122079739}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1127618537|HIST 1127618537}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1127618539|SCI 1127618539}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1127618543|POL 1127618543}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which version of the first paragraph is preferable? (refs omitted here from both options):

'''Option A (status quo)''':
There are several ongoing efforts by scientists, governments, international organisations, and others to determine the origin of [[Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2|SARS-CoV-2]], the virus responsible for the [[COVID-19 pandemic]]. Most scientists say that as with other pandemics in human history, the virus is likely of [[zoonotic]] origin in a natural setting, and ultimately originated from a [[Bat virome|bat-borne virus]]. Many other explanations, including several [[COVID-19 misinformation#Misinformation regarding virus origin|conspiracy theories]], have been proposed about the origins of the virus. Some have speculated that SARS-CoV-2 was accidentally [[COVID-19 lab leak theory|released from a laboratory]], but there is no evidence for this, and it is considered much less likely than a natural origin.

:'''Option A.1 (status quo + fixed ambiguity)''': [identical to A until]... Some <u>{{tq|scientists and politicians}}</u> have speculated that SARS-CoV-2 was accidentally [[COVID-19 lab leak theory|released from a laboratory]], but <u>{{tq|this theory}}</u> is considered much less likely than a natural origin <u>{{tq|due to a lack of supportive evidence}}</u>.

'''Option B''' (example [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Investigations_into_the_origin_of_COVID-19&oldid=1121931734https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Investigations_into_the_origin_of_COVID-19&oldid=1121931734]):
There are several ongoing efforts by scientists, governments, international organisations, and others to determine the origin of SARS-CoV-2, the virus responsible for the COVID-19 pandemic. Debate centers on two ideas -- a zoonotic origin in a natural setting, ultimately originated from a bat-borne virus, or a lab leak. Scientists consider the zoonotic scenario more likely. [[User:Adoring nanny|Adoring nanny]] ([[User talk:Adoring nanny|talk]]) 18:05, 15 November 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_FBCEDBB|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2022-12-17 20:01 ===
* Id: FBCEDBB
* User: √Üo
* Date: 2022-11-17 19:27:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1122476955|HIST 1122476955}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1122476962|RELI 1122476962}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1122476965|SOC 1122476965}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1127989431|HIST 1127989431}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1127989435|RELI 1127989435}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1127989438|SOC 1127989438}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
QUESTION: Should we deprecate the Gordon-Conwell Theological Seminary's ''World Religion Database''/''World Christian Database'', also published by the Association of Religion Data Archives, as [[WP:SPONSORED]], [[WP:PARTISAN]], [[WP:QUESTIONABLE]] & [[WP:CRYSTAL]], and the ''Pew-Templeton's Global Religious Futures'' dataset as [[WP:CRYSTAL]], thus as unreliable sources in the field of religion statistics and demographics?

Please see:
* The [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard&oldid=1122336651#Summary_of_general_consensus '''summary of general consensus'''] as a rationale for deprecation, with the main links to the datasets in question.
* The entire discussion above, and in particular the [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard&oldid=1122336651#Authoritative_critical_assessments '''authoritative critical assessments'''] that have been collected.

Further considerations:
* Note well that this RfC for deprecation is unrelated to the "general consensus" elaborated hereabove, which is built on the discussion further above plus the fragmented consensuses about the same issue reached over the years in various Wikipedia talk pages (according to which the datasets in question should never replace data from censuses and statistical organisations, as they are built largely on Christian missionary sources and/or speculative projections, not yielded by actual surveys); this RfC will only enforce that consensus through deprecation, in case the community will express itself in favour of deprecation.
* A RfC for deprecation is needed because, despite the aforementioned fragmented consensuses collected over the years, the datasets in question are periodically re-added to Wikipedia articles about countries and religion demographics and passed off as results of actual surveys, and this could be better curbed with a deprecation warning.

Nom:--[[User:√Üo|√Üo]] ([[User talk:√Üo|talk]]) 19:27, 17 November 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of European cities by population within city limits#rfc_CB21D18|Talk:List of European cities by population within city limits]] expired 2022-12-17 21:01 ===
* Id: CB21D18
* User: Pan Nƒõkdo
* Date: 2022-11-17 20:51:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1122485868|HIST 1122485868}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1127997881|HIST 1127997881}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the Caucasian cities be included in this list?

Currently there is no clear approach to cities in Caucasus (Tbilisi, Baku, Yerevan) and it causes edit wars. There has been a lot of discussion about it here but it's too long to read and despite the lenght it gives no clear guidelines about their inclusion/exclusion. So I think we should solve it once and for all. In the end it should end up in FAQ as Istanbul ended. The only consensus that has arised from the discussions so far is that they shouldn't be included without note about their unclear placement to Europe. --[[User:Pan Nƒõkdo|Pan Nƒõkdo]] ([[User talk:Pan Nƒõkdo|talk]]) 20:51, 17 November 2022 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1128415590|SCI 1128415590}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1128415593|RELI 1128415593}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1128415597|SOC 1128415597}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which version of the Royal Dutch Medical Association's recommendations should be included in the article, the full version or the shortened version?

*'''Full version''': "Because the evidence that circumcision prevents HIV mainly comes from studies conducted in Africa, the Royal Dutch Medical Association (KNMG) in 2010 questioned the applicability of those studies to developed countries. Circumcision has not been included in their HIV prevention recommendations. The KNMG viewpoint document said that the relationship between HIV transmission and circumcision was unclear, and that behavioral factors seemed to have more of an effect on HIV prevention than circumcision. The KNMG also said that the choice of circumcision should be put off until an age when a possible HIV risk reduction would be relevant, so that boys could decide for themselves whether to undergo the procedure or choose other prevention alternatives. This KNMG circumcision policy statement was endorsed by several Dutch medical associations."
*'''Shortened version''': "Because the evidence that circumcision prevents HIV mainly comes from studies conducted in Africa, the Royal Dutch Medical Association (KNMG) in 2010 questioned the applicability of those studies to developed countries. Circumcision has not been included in their HIV prevention recommendations."

Some users have argued that the Royal Dutch Medical Association (KNMG) viewpoint is [[WP:FRINGE]] and out-of-date, while others have argued that the KNMG recommendations qualify as a "significant minority viewpoint" per [[WP:DUE]] and that it is important to include recommendations on circumcision & HIV from different regions of the world. [[User:Prcc27|Prcc27]] ([[User talk:Prcc27|talk]]) 00:20, 20 November 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Infobox settlement#rfc_5BDBB2E|Template talk:Infobox settlement]] expired 2022-12-21 00:01 ===
* Id: 5BDBB2E
* User: Hike395
* Date: 2022-11-20 23:11:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1125065350|TECH 1125065350}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1128597979|TECH 1128597979}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
{{Infobox settlement/sandbox
| name                    = Baghdad
| official_name     = Mayoralty of Baghdad
| native_name       = ÿ®ÿ∫ÿØÿßÿØ ([[Arabic]])<br />ÿ®€ïÿ∫ÿØÿßÿØ ([[Kurdish languages|Kurdish]])
| settlement_type   = [[Metropolis]] and [[capital city]]
| image_skyline           = 5628442718 b10fc2c47f o.jpg
| image_seal               = 
| nickname                 = City of Peace (ŸÖÿØŸäŸÜÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ≥ŸÑÿßŸÖ)
}}
{{Infobox settlement/sandbox
| name                    = Name
| official_name            = City of Raleigh
| caption                  = Clockwise from top left: [[North Carolina State University Memorial Bell Tower|NC State bell tower]], Confederate monument at the [[North Carolina State Capitol]] (now removed), houses in [[Boylan Heights (Raleigh, North Carolina)|Boylan Heights]], houses in [[Historic Oakwood]], statue of Sir [[Walter Raleigh]], skyline of the downtown, [[Fayetteville Street (Raleigh)|Fayetteville Street]], and the [[Warehouse (Raleigh)|warehouse district]]
| settlement_type          = [[List of capitals in the United States|State capital city]]
| nickname                 = City of Oaks, Raleigh Wood, Oak City
| image_skyline            = Raleigh photo collage.jpg
| imagesize                = 250px
| image_flag               = {{multiple image 
| border      = infobox 
| total_width = 110 
| image_style = 
| perrow      = 1/1/0 
| image1      = Flag of Raleigh, North Carolina.svg
| image2      = Flag of Raleigh rear side.svg }}
| flag_link                = Flag of Raleigh, North Carolina
| image_seal               = Seal of Raleigh, North Carolina.svg
| image_blank_emblem       = City of Raleigh logo.svg
| blank_emblem_type        = Logo
}}
{{Infobox settlement/sandbox
|name = Bolivia, North Carolina
|official_name = Town of Bolivia
|settlement_type = [[Town]]

|image_skyline = File:Bolivia NC post office.jpg
|imagesize = 
|image_caption = Post office
|nickname = 
|motto = 
}}
We can improve the presentation of names in this infobox by following the design of {{tl|Infobox mountain}}. Currently, all of the different kinds of names for a settlement are shown together in the header box, without explanation or labels. A reader doesn't know  the meaning or importance of each name.

Instead, I propose having a naming section in this infobox, below the images at the top of the infobox. The arguments to {{para|official_name}}, {{para|native_name}}, and {{para|other_name}} will be shown in the infobox, each with a label. I've implemented this proposal in the [[Template:Infobox settlement/sandbox|sandbox]]: you can see the differences by going to [[Template:Infobox settlement/testcases|the testcase page]] or [[Template:Infobox settlement/testcases2|the alternative testcase page]]. An example of such an infobox is shown to the right.

Not only will this be clearer for readers (IMO), but will also resolve the redundancy issue brought up by {{U|Surtsicna}}, above, by moving the display of {{para|official_name}} out of the header, and clearly labeling it. What do other editors think?

(Hat tip to {{U|DiscoA340}} --- one of their suggestions [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Cities/US Guideline#Infobox redundancies|here]] triggered this idea)

{{group ping|Pinging other discussants|Magnolia677|Hwy43|Sbmeirow|Washuotaku|WCCasey}} ‚Äî [[User:Hike395|hike395]] ([[User talk:Hike395|talk]]) 23:11, 20 November 2022 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
 There has lately been a lively discussion of the appropriateness of including the phrase "convicted felon" in the opening sentence of a biography. A consensus-building discussion has taken place at [[Wikipedia talk:Biographies of living persons/Archive 46#Applying controversial labels to people|Wikipedia talk:Biographies of living persons/Archive 46#Applying controversial labels to people]] and https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia_talk:Biographies_of_living_persons#%22Convicted_Felon%22_in_the_lead. 

Therefore, my question is this: should the phrase "convicted felon" be removed from the opening sentence of David Duke's page? [[User:Philomathes2357|Philomathes2357]] ([[User talk:Philomathes2357|talk]]) 23:34, 20 December 2022 (UTC)}}

Generally, and excluding special situations such as direct quotations or [[Wikipedia:words as words|words as words]], should the nomenclature of currencies commonly called ruble (e.g. the [[Russian ruble|Russian]] or [[Soviet ruble|Soviet]] currencies) be:
*Option A: ruble
*Option B: rouble
*Option C: Native names wherever applicable (e.g. "rubel" for [[Belarusian ruble]])
*Option D: This is an engvar problem, and should be solved according to our pre-existing rules regarding English variants

{{rfcquote|text=
There is a current dispute on the section of international responses. The bombing campaign of Syria has been met with hard opposition from the US, and most sources have consensus on this, with the US publicly stating it opposes any Turkish intervention, with US troops being stationed with the SDF in Syria.[https://www.voanews.com/a/another-major-turkish-military-ground-incursion-very-likely-amid-rising-tensions-in-syria-experts-say-/6844866.html 1][https://www.defense.gov/News/Releases/Release/Article/3227725/dod-statement-on-escalating-actions-in-iraq-syria-and-turkey/ 2] Ecrusized wants to include a series of quotes of US condemnation to the [[2022 Istanbul bombing]] yet I find these quotes are completely unrelated, they should be included in that article not this. The text of "The Pentagon opposes any Turkish intervention" is directly sourced from the DoD quote "The Department of Defense continues to oppose any military action that destabilizes the situation in Syria or violates Iraq‚Äôs sovereignty through military actions uncoordinated." I find this is a good description of the source yet Ecrusized states this is editorialization. A third opinion would be generally helpful. [[User:Des Vallee|Des Vallee]] ([[User talk:Des Vallee|talk]]) 17:40, 25 November 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Jason David Frank#rfc_C080A99|Talk:Jason David Frank]] expired 2022-12-27 02:01 ===
* Id: C080A99
* User: 50.86.94.196
* Date: 2022-11-27 01:04:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1124045781|BIO 1124045781}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1129769303|BIO 1129769303}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[https://www.tmz.com/2022/11/22/power-rangers-jason-david-frank-suicide-death-wife-argument/ TMZ has reported] that, per anonymous "law-enforcement sources," Jason David Frank died by suicide. It appears TMZ is the only source that basing this claim on its original reporting. Several other outlets have also reported that Frank died by suicide, but they attribute the information to either TMZ (as with [https://consequence.net/2022/11/power-rangers-actor-jason-david-frank-died-by-suicide/ Consequence], [https://pagesix.com/2022/11/22/power-rangers-star-jason-david-frank-argued-with-wife-before-death/ Page Six], and [https://www.yahoo.com/video/power-rangers-actor-jason-david-181248084.html Yahoo News], to name just a few), or, in the case of the Guardian, [https://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/2022/nov/20/jason-david-frank-mighty-morphin-power-rangers-star-dies "multiple reports"]. Should the article state that Frank died by suicide at all, given that only TMZ has originally reported the cause of death?--[[Special:Contributions/50.86.94.196|50.86.94.196]] ([[User talk:50.86.94.196|talk]]) 01:04, 27 November 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Pasquale Conte#rfc_DA009CA|Talk:Pasquale Conte]] expired 2022-12-27 05:01 ===
* Id: DA009CA
* User: Ommar365
* Date: 2022-12-25 09:14:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1129434937|BIO 1129434937}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1129799783|BIO 1129799783}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
For starters, I'll admit I'm not well versed on mobsters or wiki editing policies, so this request may be misguided but in short:

In the last few years of edit history, claims have sprung up asserting that article subject is deceased. Sourcing isn't great on this article in general, so these claims of death are not only added without sources, but also the alleged date of death varies wildly. As of now, there's no semblance of consensus whatsoever. In my attempt to fill out other parts of the article, I came across a recent [https://casetext.com/case/conte-v-tapps-supermarket-inc court case] (28 Sep, 2022) where the parties involved are close relatives:
<blockquote><blockquote><small>''Plaintiff Anthony Conte, appearing ''pro se, ''commenced this action against Defendants Tapps Supermarket, Inc., Seven Seas Partners, Inc., Anthony C. Conte, Paul S. Conte, and Pasquale Conte, Jr., '''the Estate of Pasquale Conte, Sr.''', Anthony Bileddo, and Feder Kaszovitz LLP, for purportedly stealing/depriving Plaintiff of stock, ...''</small></blockquote></blockquote>

It can be reliably inferred from this that Pasquale is deceased<sup>(''recently?'')</sup>, no? I imagine ''Pasquale Conte, Sr.'' has to be him, and Pasquale junior is some descendant. Can this be construed into a valid citation somehow? There are no other credible sources, not even dubious sources, that have reported on this. I believe the article should state he's deceased, but I can't really support the edit with my original research on some tangentially related court case that happens to mention Pasquale's estate. 

[[User:Ommar365|Ommar365]] ([[User talk:Ommar365|talk]]) 09:14, 25 December 2022 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
Do you support revising the introduction of this page as following?

"'''Georgia''' ({{Lang-ka|·É°·Éê·É•·Éê·É†·Éó·Éï·Éî·Éö·Éù}}, {{Transliteration|ka|{{noitalics|{{Small|[[Romanization of Georgian|romanized]]:}}}}&nbsp;Sakartvelo}}; {{IPA-ka|s…ëk ∞…ërt ∞v…õl…î|IPA|Sakartvelo.ogg}}) is a [[transcontinental country]] located at the intersection of [[Eastern Europe]] and [[Western Asia]]. Geopolitically, it is regarded as part of Europe.<ref>[[United Nations Regional Groups]], [https://www.un.org/dgacm/en/content/regional-groups Regional groups of Member States: "Eastern European States"], 2022</ref><ref name="EU perspective">[[European Parliament]], [http://www.europarl.europa.eu/sides/getDoc.do?type=TA&language=EN&reference=P8-TA-2014-0009 Resolution 2014/2717(RSP)], 17 July 2014: "...pursuant to Article 49 of the Treaty on European Union, Georgia, Moldova and Ukraine ‚Äì like any other European state ‚Äì have a European perspective and may apply to become members of the Union‚Ä¶"</ref><ref>Valentin Naumescu, Dan Dungaciu. ''"The European Union‚Äôs Eastern Neighbourhood Today: Politics, Dynamics, Perspectives"'', Cambridge Scholars Publishing, 2015, p. 147: "Hence, the Association Agreement recognizes that Georgia, an Eastern European country, is committed to implementing and promoting these values and that Georgia shares historical links and common values with the [EU] Member States."</ref> Situated in the [[Caucasus]] region, it is bounded by the [[Black Sea]] to the west, by [[Russia]] to [[Georgia‚ÄìRussia border|the north and northeast]], by [[Turkey]] to [[Georgia‚ÄìTurkey border|the southwest]], by [[Armenia]] to [[Armenia‚ÄìGeorgia border|the south]], and by [[Azerbaijan]] to [[Azerbaijan‚ÄìGeorgia border|the southeast]]..." 

[[Special:Contributions/2600:1700:20:1D80:68E0:803D:494B:216D|2600:1700:20:1D80:68E0:803D:494B:216D]] ([[User talk:2600:1700:20:1D80:68E0:803D:494B:216D|talk]]) 04:57, 27 November 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Mariupol#rfc_198EBFA|Talk:Mariupol]] expired 2022-12-31 07:01 ===
* Id: 198EBFA
* User: Wikiexplorationandhelping
* Date: 2022-12-01 06:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1124924510|STYLE 1124924510}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1130648384|STYLE 1130648384}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Proposal''': Pinging {{u|Rsk6400}}, {{u|Roger 8 Roger}}, {{u|Mellk}}, RFC for guideline: I would also like to propose a new guideline for this issue, since I've been seeing heavy disputes with this:

If an article of a population center in '''de jure''' Ukraine that have the exact same '''English rendering of Ukrainian''' and '''English rendering of Russian names''' (i.e. [[Kherson]], [[Simferopol]], [[Yalta]], [[Kerch]]), the header would display both Russian and Ukrainian names if at least one of the criterias below are met: 

* '''The population center is near the frontline or is in a battle between Russia and Ukraine.'''
* '''The population center is under de facto control of Russia.'''
* '''Significant events occuring in or near the population center that relates with Russia.'''

If an article of a population center in '''de jure''' Ukraine has a different English rendering of Ukrainian and Russian names (i.e. [[Kharkiv]], [[Kyiv]], [[Luhansk]], [[Kryvyi Rih]]), '''the English rendered Russian name''', as well as the '''Russian name''', shall be put alongside the '''English rendered Ukrainian name''' and the '''Ukrainian name''', if at least one of the criterias below are met:

* '''The population center is under de facto control of Russia.'''
* '''The English rendered Russian name of the population center has a higher prevalence than the English rendered Ukrainian name of the population center, in at least one comparison, when compared with Google News, Ngram, etc.'''

Let me know your thoughts about this proposal by pinging me, thank you, [[User:Wikiexplorationandhelping|Wikiexplorationandhelping]] ([[User talk:Wikiexplorationandhelping|talk]]) 06:40, 1 December 2022 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
Do you favour the addition of the following text at [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Dates and numbers#Currencies and monetary values]], under the "Currency names" section?

# '''Option A''': Currency names and symbols should not be changed unless there is consensus to the contrary.
# '''Option B''': Currency names and symbols should not be changed unless there is consensus or reliable sources to the contrary.
# '''Option C''': Currency names and symbols should not be changed unless there is consensus or reliable sources to the contrary. Widespread changes to currency names should have consensus before they are changed.
# '''Option D''': (Status quo, add nothing)

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_2E3DD22|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2022-12-31 12:01 ===
* Id: 2E3DD22
* User: Yae4
* Date: 2022-12-08 22:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1126358539|ECON 1126358539}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1126358543|SCI 1126358543}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1134269864|MEDIA 1134269864}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1136004707|ECON 1136004707}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1136004709|SCI 1136004709}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1136004710|MEDIA 1136004710}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which of the following best describes 9to5Google's ([https://9to5google.com/ 9to5google.com]) technology articles? 

* Option 1: Generally reliable
* Option 2: Additional considerations apply
* Option 3: Generally unreliable

'''Option 3: Generally unreliable''': In two citations at [[GrapheneOS]], written by a "Videographer" they mostly un-critically re-publish material from the subject's website[https://9to5google.com/2022/03/10/protonaosp-12-3-0-brings-android-12l-to-pixel-6-and-6-pro-ahead-of-google-rollout/] or from their Twitter[https://9to5google.com/2022/03/11/privacy-focused-grapheneos-based-upon-android-12l-comes-to-pixel-6-in-latest-beta/]. Although their contact list[https://9to5google.com/contact/] has some Editor titles, it looks like another ad-infested group blog site, intended to advertise and sell Google products with affiliate links.[https://9to5mac.com/about/#affiliate]

To my knowledge, 9to5Google has only been mentioned in passing  once: [[Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_298#PhoneArena_et_al]] at [[WP:RSN]]. Apologies in advance if this RfC is somehow incorrect. -- [[User:Yae4|Yae4]] ([[User talk:Yae4|talk]]) 22:22, 8 December 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Verifiability#rfc_928B0AB|Wikipedia talk:Verifiability]] expired 2022-12-31 19:01 ===
* Id: 928B0AB
* Date: 2022-12-01 18:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1125012194|POLICY 1125012194}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1130741684|POLICY 1130741684}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Editors have been talking for months about the interaction of various policies and procedures around cited material whose inclusion is disputed on grounds related to whether the material is verifiable.  Here's the scenario:

Alice and Bob decided to create an article together.  They were editing collaboratively until they ran into a serious disagreement.  One of them wants to briefly mention a related subject, and the other doesn't think that related subject should be mentioned at all (in this particular article).  They are unable to agree, and when you look on the talk page, you find a discussion between multiple editors, which is very evenly divided.  These are the facts:

# The material in question is fully verifiable, factually correct, well cited to two high-quality reliable sources, and not about a [[Wikipedia:BLP|BLP]].   
# There is no consensus to include the material and ''equally'' no consensus to exclude the material.  There are good arguments on both sides.
# It is not possible to compromise half-way, because there is no way to write an article so that it both briefly mentions, and also does not mention at all, the related subject.

You edit in this area regularly, so these editors have asked you personally for your advice on the dispute.  Specifically, they ask you to tell them whether you believe that it is generally better for Wikipedia to include or exclude material in this type of situation.

Your job is to finish this sentence:  '''"When editors have been unable to reach an agreement about whether to include a piece of verifiable, cited material, I believe it is usually best for Wikipedia to ______"'''. 18:08, 1 December 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Classical music#rfc_34FD818|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Classical music]] expired 2022-12-31 22:01 ===
* Id: 34FD818
* User: Why? I Ask
* Date: 2022-12-01 21:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1125039134|MEDIA 1125039134}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1130770480|MEDIA 1130770480}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I am starting a new RfC that will hopefully be more neutral and lead to some actual progress rather than me being brash and presenting poor options. The RfC will involve these articles:
{{hlist|[[Flute repertoire]]|[[Bassoon repertoire]]|[[Trumpet repertoire]]|[[Trombone repertoire]]|[[Tuba repertoire]]|[[Viola repertoire]]}} (Note: As [[Euphonium repertoire]] and [[Organ repertoire]] are largely prose, they are not included in this proposal.)

'''Question 1''': Should this batch of articles be renamed to "List of compositions for ''(instrument)''"? 

'''Question 2''': What should the criteria be for inclusion in these articles? (For example, 'it must have a Wikipedia page', 'must be listed in several index of works', 'must be written by a notable composer', etc.) This was briefly discussed at [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Classical music#Establishing criteria for entries]], but was never formally settled.

Question 2 is extended to include articles such as:
{{hlist|[[List of compositions for cello and organ]]|[[List of compositions for two violins]]|[[List of compositions for viola: A to B]] (and other letters)|[[List of compositions for piano duo]]}} [[User:Why? I Ask|Why? I Ask]] ([[User talk:Why? I Ask|talk]]) 21:33, 1 December 2022 (UTC)}}
